Lenie sells seafood products including fish and shrimp. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lenie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital.

Lenie is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used purchase fresh fish and feed for her pigs. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to sell and feed for her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en: Ma. Luz is a married woman who lives in Victorias City, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a general store, rice and root crop retailing and farming. Her husband Reynaldo who is 74 years old is retired from work. They have nine children who are between 32 and  47 years old. Ma. Luz joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1990 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 21 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Luz has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,400, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 22nd loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 to purchase stock so that she can continue to save up for the future. Ma. Luz is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store

loans.name: Jonhy Richar

texts.es: Johny es padre de casa de 30 años de edad. Vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos en casa familiar en la zona rural del distrito de Pacasmayo, una zona con bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Desde hace siete años, se dedica a la venta de frutas al por mayor. Cuento con un puesto cerca del Mercado San Pedro donde vende sus productos todos los días. Actualmente, una nueva temporada escolar ha comenzado en Perú y Edpyme Alternativa  les ofrece a sus clientes la posibilidad de solicitar un préstamo para solventar gastos escolares.  Por ello, Johny ha acudido a la institución para solicitar un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles lo cual ayudará a pagar los gastos escolares de sus hijos menores y comprarles útiles escolares. Johny es muy trabajador y responsable. Ha manejado otros préstamos y los canceló de manera puntual. Johny es bastante entregado a su familia y labora siempre para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en: Johny is the father of the house and is 30 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in their home in the rural district of Pacasmayo, an area with significant commercial movement that is located in the La Libertad region, more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. For the past seven years, he has worked in wholesale selling fruit. He has a stand near the Mercado San Pedro where he sells his products every day. The school season has begun in Peru and Edpyme Alternativa offers its clients the possibility of asking for a loan to pay school expenses. Because of this, Johny has approached the institution to ask for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles which will help him to pay the school expenses of his younger children and purchase school supplies. Johny is a hard worker and responsible. He has had other loans and has paid them punctually. Johny is very involved with his family and alweays works to help them get ahead.

loans.use: to pay for school expenses for his two young children

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a wide variety of bowls to add to her business

loans.name: Marquita

texts.es:
La señora Marquita es socia del banco comunal Las Dalilas del Distrito de Yarinacocha, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos que todavía están a su cargo y en edad escolar.
El tiempo que lleva en Manuela Ramos ha servido para que pueda  comprar un par de motocarros para ponerlos en alquiler.  Su esposo es empleado público, pero aprovechando sus vacaciones está trabajando en uno de sus motocarros. 
Con este nuevo prestamos de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles se comprará un nuevo motocar para ponerlo también en alquiler, es un negocio que le genera buenos ingresos.
Este negocio le ha sido muy lucrativo porque les ha permitido poder construir su casa pequeña pero muy acogedora  y tener algunas comodidades en su hogar, definitivamente ha mejorado su vida familiar.

En la foto se muestra junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Marquita is a member of the Las Dalilas community bank in the distrito of Yarinacocha, departament of Ucayali. She is 34 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children who are still under her care and school aged.  

The time she has spent in Manuela Ramos has served to buy a couple of motorcyle cars to rent out. Her husband is a public employee, but when he is one vacation he works in one of her motorcyle cars. With this new loan of  S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles, she will buy a new motorcyle car to rent it out as well. This business generates good income for her.  

This business has been very lucrative for her because it has allowed her to build her small but very charming house and to have some conveniences there. It definitely has improves her family's life.

She is shown with her husband in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorcyle car.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw body.

loans.name: Ddc Group

texts.en:
Zakia, who is in her early 30s, is a divorcee with three children. Two of them go to school.  

She has been selling new clothes, bed sheets and curtains at a place called Kimara for two years now. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Zakia’s third loan from Tujijnge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her business and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to buy and sell more ladies' clothes, bed sheets and curtains. Her dream is to one day open a grocery.

Zakia will share this loan with her loan group “DDC” which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy and sell more ladies' clothes, bedsheets and curtains.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 44 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Dani de 47 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. En la ciudad de Pucallpa una de las pastelerías mas conocidas y concurridas es la que administra Rosa, sus deliciosas tortas y pasteles han hecho que su negocio sobre salga de entre los demás, motivo por el cual tiene más clientes que los de su competencia. Ella aprendió la repostería de sus padres, quienes tenían un horno y hacían pan y pasteles para vender. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es decorar las tortas, tiene mucha paciencia para hacerlo y eso se nota en los hermosos decorados que realiza, lleva 10 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es trasnocharse, para cumplir con los pedidos que le hacen. Con el paso de los meses, espera abrir una nueva pastelería en otro lugar concurrido de la ciudad. Este será su décimo primer crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una socia responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas vitrinas, para abrir su nueva pastelería.
texts.en: Rosa is 44 years old, a friendly and hardworking woman, and lives at home with her husband Dani, who is 47, and her 3 beloved children who she wants to offer a better quality of life. She manages one of Pucullpa's best known and most frequented bakeries. Thanks to her delicious pancakes and cakes her bakery stands out among the rest resulting in having more customers then her competitors. She learned how to bake from her parents who have an oven and made bread and cakes to sell. What she likes most about her job is decorating her cakes. She has a lot of patience to decorate and this can be seen in the beautiful designs she makes. She has been working in this business for 10 years and considers staying up late to finish orders to be the most difficult part. This will be her 10th loan with MFP. She has always been punctual with her payments and plans to do the same for these payments. In her communal bank she is a responsible member which is why she is well liked. With the three thousand Peruvian Soles loan she will buy new display cabinets to open her new bakery.

loans.use: buy display cabinets to sell her cakes.

loans.name: Gotitas De Amor Group

texts.es:
Felipa es integrante D. la  Alcancía Comunal “Gotitas D. Amor” que esta conformada por 7 personas dedicadas a diversas actividades D. comercio. 
Felipa tiene 63 años D. edad, es viuda con  7 hijos, D.  los cuales 2 dependen D. ella, la Sra. Felipa se dedica a la  venta D. productos como: kekes, panetónes, turrónes, entre otros, donD. lleva trabajando en ese rubro más D. 25 años, ella nos cuenta que empezó vendiendo comida y chupetes en las afueras D. su vivienda,  pero gracias al  buen uso que le dio a su dinero pudo juntar un capital e  invertir y emprender su propio  negocio.  Con su esfuerzo Felipa ha comprado su propio terreno y ayudado a sus  hijos en su educación. Felipa tiene como meta abrir una bodega donD. pueda ofrecer productos D. primera necesidad y así seguir apoyando en sus estudios a sus hijos. Con el préstamo solicitado  invertirá en sus productos comprando en mayor cantidad. La Alcancía Comunal “Gotitas D. Amor” son personas responsables que  agradecen el apoyo y la confianza depositada en ellos. La señora María no pudo estar presente porque tuvo que llevar a su esposo al médico.
texts.en:
Felipa, 63, is a member of the “Gotitas D. Amor” (Little Drops of Love) communal bank which has 7 members dedicated to diverse commercial activities.

She’s a widow with seven children two of which still depend on her.  She sells products like cakes, Panettones and nougats, among others.  She’s been in this line of work for over 25 years.  She tells us that she started out selling food and lollipops outsiD. her house.  Thanks to the good way she managed her income she was able to amass some capital to invest in starting her own business.  With her efforts, Felipa has purchased her own land and helped her children with their education.

Felipa’s goal is to open a store where she can sell basic need items to continue supporting her children’s schooling.  She will use the requested loan to buy larger amounts of products.

The “Gotitas D. Amor” communal bank’s members are responsible people who are grateful for the support and trust that’s been placed in them.
María wasn’t able to be present because she had to take her husband to the doctor.

loans.use: to buy cakes, nougats and Panettones.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 24 years old and single. He has been running his  businesses for one year. He earns a monthly income of about 7,700 Kenyan shillings (KES), which he saves and uses both in his business and for personal use.

He has been loaned KES 10,000 from KADET Ltd. This is his first loan from KADET Ltd. He intends to purchase a cow, and he plans to use the anticipated profit to buy piglets for rearing.

His dream and hopes are that he will be able to operate his own large-scale farm.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica es una mujer muy joven, es madre de dos niños y vive en casa de sus suegros junto a su esposo, la casa en donde vive es de los padres de su pareja. Para Jessica el trabajo empieza muy temprano cuando se tiene que levantar para ir al mercado en busca de los ingredientes necesarios para poder realizar la venta por la noche. Ella vende en la vereda de la casa de su suegros, realiza este trabajo sola y ya va casi 2 años en este negocio el cual le esta dando buenos ingresos como para poder apoyar en su hogar. Además no pierde en ningún momento, pues si no vende mucho durante el día, los ingredientes que quedan lo utiliza para la preparación del alimento para su familia. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo por las tardes para poder estar a lado de sus hijos que aún son muy pequeños y necesitan que su madre este cerca de ellos, lo que no le gusta es tener que quedarse a veces hasta altas horas de la noche en espera de los comensales. Espera poder seguir trabajando e implementando su negocio. Es el segundo crédito con MFP, le agrada trabajar en este grupo ya que se lleva bien con todos y siempre están al tanto de lo que sucede con los demás para ayudarse entre si. Con el préstamo de 1000 soles solicitados ella implementará su local, comprando materiales para instalar el techo, ya que cuando llueve tiene que perder su inversión del día pero con eso se solucionará gran parte del problema.
texts.en:
Jessica is a very young woman and mother of two children. She lives with her husband in his parents' house. Jessica starts work very early in the morning. Each day she goes to the market to purchase the ingredients necessary to sell her product in the evening. She sells food on the sidewalk in front of her in-laws' house. She has been doing this for two years and she earns a good income to help support her household. She doesn't let anything go to waste and if she does not sell very much during the day, she uses the leftover ingredients to prepare dinner for her family. 

What she likes most about her job is that she has free time in the afternoons to spend with her children, who are still very young and need to be close to their mother. What she doesn't like about her job is that, sometimes, she has to work very late nights waiting for customers. She hopes to be able to continue working and improving her business. 

This is her second loan with MFP. She enjoys working with this group because she gets along well with everyone and because they are always there to help each other out. With the loan of 1000 soles she is requesting, Jessica will buy the materials to install her stand and the roof because when it rains, she loses revenue. The loan will help her solve this problem.

loans.use: purchase materials to build a roof for her food stand.

loans.name: Nahed

texts.en:
Nahed is a 29-year-old woman. She is married and has three sons and three daughters. Nahed lives in Rafah city in Palestine. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee. Nahed has a shop where she works with her husband. The shop is for fixing and mending electronic devices and machines.

Nahed receives customers during the day and her husband fixes the machines after his work. Nahed's husband needs a new maintenance and fixing kit. Therefore, she took out a loan of $3,000 from FATEN to pay for the new kit.

Nahed is a conservative woman. Her husband is photographed instead in the project.

loans.use: To purchase new tools

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es: Jacinto tiene 43 años, es padre de 3 niños y vive al lado de su esposa en casa una alquilada. Como jefe de familia decidió emprender diversas actividades para generar los ingresos necesarios, fue así que ha desarrollado múltiples oficios y en una de ellas  ha descubierto que es rentable  el reciclaje, desde entonces recolecta productos en desuso como: botellas de plásticos, diversos envases para venderlos por kilos, del mismo modo vende papeles y cartones según recolecte en los días libres que tiene. Por otro lado trabaja de manera dependiente como obrero de construcción de casas de material noble, por lo que también recibe un ingreso considerable. Jacinto sueña con tener algún día una casa propia y darle toda la comodidad a su familia por ello continuará trabajando. Decidió trabajar con MFP por las buenas referencias que ha recibido de sus vecinos que le informaron sobre los beneficios de trabajar de manera grupal a la cual se animó a formar parte de este grupo. Ahora tiene muchas expectativas positivas y se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita, comprará una moto triciclo que le ayudará a transportar todos los envases reciclables que recolecte en las calles.
texts.en:
Jacinto, age 43, has three children.  He lives with his wife in a rented house.  As head of the family he decided to undertake diverse business activities in order to generate the necessary income.  That is how he has developed multiple trades.  One of them that he has discovered to be profitable is recycling.

Since then he collects products that are no longer used such as plastic bottles and various cans.  He sells them by the kilo.  Similarly, he sells paper and cartons in accordance with what he collects on his days off. 

In addition, he is an employee who works building solid construction houses.  He receives considerable income for that work.

Jacinto dreams of one day having his own house and giving his family all of the comforts.  He will continue working for that.

He decided to work with MFP because of the good references he got from his neighbors.  They told him about the benefits of working as a group, and this encouraged him to become part of this group.  He now has many positive expectations, and he pledges to make his payments punctually.  

He will use the requested loan to buy a “moto triciclo” (a three wheeled motorized vehicle) to transport all of the recyclable containers that he gathers from the streets.

loans.use: to buy a “moto triciclo” (a three wheeled motorized vehicle).

loans.name: Remalyn

texts.en:
Remalyn is 27 years old. She has a dry goods stand in their market. She sells dresses, shorts and pants. For the three months she has been operating her business, she is earning PHP 25,000. Just enough to sustain the school fees of her two children, allowances, electric bills and food for a month.

She wants to increase her capacity for sales. Therefore, she needs a loan of  PHP 10,000 to buy new dry goods such as pants, shirts and skirts as additional goods to sell in her stand. She hopes this loan will contribute success to her business in order to develop their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new dry goods such as pants, shirts and skirts

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Julienne, mariée et mère de 1 enfant vit auprès de ses parents. Elle vend divers articles tels que sucre, laits, conserves, Bissaps, etc... dans une boutique sise à Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin. Sporadiquement, elle vend aussi les pagnes mais sur commande de ses clients. Elle a une clientèle fidèle composée des habitants de sa localité et des zones environnantes. Julienne exerce cette activité génératrice de revenus depuis environ 2 décennies et en maitrise tous les contours. Elle effectue ses achats près des grossistes au marché international du Bénin. Elle a sollicité et obtenu le renouvellement de son prêt à FINADEV afin de renforcer sa capacité financière à faire face aux multiples exigences de ses clients. Avec les revenus supplémentaires qui découleront de l'exercice de son activité, Julienne contribuera à une meilleure prise en charge des besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Julienne, married and the mother of one child, lives with her parents. She sells various items such as sugar, milk, tinned goods, dried hibiscus flowers, etc. in a little shop located in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Sporadically, she also sells lengths of African print cloth, but only when her customers order them from her. She has a clientele composed of repeat customers from her neighborhood and surrounding areas. 

Julienne has been in this income-generating business for about 20 years and is quite expert at it. She makes her purchases from wholesalers at the international market of Bénin. She has requested and obtained a renewal of her loan from FINADEV in order to bolster her financial capacity and deal with the multiple needs of her customers. 

With the supplemental revenue that she receives from her business, Julienne will contribute to better covering the needs of her own family.

loans.use: to buy 10 cases of milk, five cases of sugar, and 10 cases of other items.

loans.name: Menontin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MENONTIN est composé de trois membres. La représentante de ce groupe du nom de Séraphine est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. Séraphine est âgée de 48 ans et vit au Bénin. Séraphine est mariée à un pêcheur du nom de Nathanaël. Le couple à six enfants,dont quatre restent encore à leur charge.Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Séraphine et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Séraphine n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants,  Séraphine mène comme activité la vente des poissons et des crevettes.Séraphine s'approvisionne dans l'un des lacs du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et mieux satisfaire à la demande de leur clientèle, Séraphine et les autres membres du groupe MENONTIN, sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé.Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The MENONTIN group consists of three members. Their representative is Séraphine, seen with her hand raised in the photo. She is 48 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a fisherman named Nathanaël, and the couple has six children, four of them still in their care. Some of the children have attended school. Séraphine herself never went to school. She and her husband live together with their children. 

To support herself and her family, Séraphine sells fish and shrimp. Her stock comes from one of Benin’s lakes. 

In an effort to bolster their activities and better meet customer demand, Menontin is seeking financial support from ALIDé. Séraphine and the other group members are requesting a fifth loan. All previous loans were repaid without incident.

loans.use: to buy fish and shrimp for resale

loans.name: Renee

texts.es:
Renee es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer, tiene 26 años, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 5 años.
Renee vende golosinas y abarrotes en una carreta ubicada en la puerta de su casa, recuerda que le primer crédito que recibió lo utilizó para comprar golosinas porque antes solo vendía golosinas y de ahí fue aumentando, ahora en su negocio también vende raspadilla, su gran meta es poder terminar de construir su casa, da gracias porque le enseñaron a poder ahorrar, y así se puede trazar metas y cumplirlas. Ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de azúcar, carne, arroz.
texts.en:
Renee is a member of the Florecer Community Bank. She is 26 years old and has been with Kiva partner FINCA Peru for five years. 

Renee sells candy and groceries from a cart located at the door to her house. She remembers that the first loan she received was used to buy candy. That was all she sold at the beginning. Since then her business has expanded, and she now sells snow cones too. 

Her biggest goal is to finish building her house. She is grateful to her Community Bank which has taught her how to save, how to set goals, and how to reach them. 

With the money from the loan, Renee plans to buy sugar, meat, and rice.

loans.use: to buy sugar, meat, and rice

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура замужем и у нее 3 детей. Она продает женские одежды в одном из местных рынков на протяжении более 20 лет. Ее уникальная возможность предоставить свой товар и удовлетворение потребностей клиентов являются сильными сторонами способствующее быстрому росту ее бизнеса. Тем не менее, Манзура считает, что ее бизнес только начинает расти, и до сих пор имеет большой потенциал для дальнейшего расширения. Она хотела бы открыть еще один точку для продажи своих товаров. Ее стратегия на данный момент заключается в увеличении разновидности товаров к предстоявшему зимнему сезону. Вот почему Манзура просит займ в размере $3000 долларов США.
texts.en: Manzura is married and has three children.  She has been selling women's clothing at one of the local markets for over 20 years.  Her unique ability to offer merchandise and satisfy customer demands are some of the strongest qualities conducive to the quick growth of her business.  Despite this, Manzura thinks that her business is just beginning to grow and still has a lot of potential for further growth.  She wants to open another retail outlet to sell her merchandise.  Her current strategy is to expand the variety of merchandise for the upcoming winter season.  This is why Manzura is requesting a loan in the sum of $3000.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for the upcoming winter season

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married with seven children. She is 44 years old and lives in Sto. Niño, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Helen sells food for snacks to earn a living; she has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan for 5000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her food vending business.

Helen has been a member of PMPC for more than one year. In the future, Helen hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her food vending business.

location.town: Liloy-Sto. Niño, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Chhi's Group

texts.en:
This group has four members. They are residents of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. One of them, Mrs. Chhi, a 41-year-old widow woman, is the leader of this group. She is in the business of selling fish, while the other 3 are in the fishing business. Currently, Chhi is living with 3 single children, one of whom helps her sell fish in a local market that is located in Chong Khneas commune. From this business, she can earn an income of $4.00 each day to raise her family but it seems barely enough for the expenses. 

Mrs. Chhi wants to buy more fresh fish and more stock of dried fish for continual sales in the future. That is why she looking for funds in the sum of $200 from HKL to supplement her existing capital and to purchase her merchandise. She hopes to gain more income by using these funds.

loans.use: to purchase fresh and dried fish

loans.name: Artur

texts.en: Artur is a young entrepreneur from Meghry. He runs a little cafe. In just a few years Artur has managed to gain a large number of clients due to the quality of his services.  Now Artur would like to renovate the cafe to provide services of a higher quality. With the requested loan Artur plans to purchase a freezer, furniture and floor tiles. This loan will help Artur to develop his business and increase his income. With this additional income Artur will ensure a brighter future for his family. Artur lives together with his wife and two daughters.

loans.use: to pay for a freezer, furniture and floor tiles.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
This is Norma, 55, resident of Dasmariñas Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Evilio, a carpenter, and is the mother of three children. One is already working while the other two are married. By the grace of God, Norma has managed to support their daily needs.

Norma operates a tailoring business. She’s been in this business for 25 years. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home draping. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php700 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Norma dreams to build a tailoring shop and to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.
 
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 27 years old, married, and has three children ranging in age from one to ten. She describes herself as a principled woman. She has sold cakes in a busy estate for the last two years. Her business faces the challenge of high prices of ingredients (like baking flour) for baking cakes. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a motorbike which will help her deliver the cakes to her customers. In the future, Grace hopes to run a big bakery shop.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to deliver cakes.

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира трудолюбивая и честная женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать четверых детей. Муж пенсионер. Пенсия мужа не хватает на содержания семьи и поэтому Мунира начала заниматься бизнесом. Более 4 года она занимается купле- продажей продуктов питания. В бизнесе помогают дети. Мунира хотела бы получить займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки продуктов питания с целью пополнения оборотного капитала. Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту. Спасибо!
texts.en: Munira is a hardworking and honest woman.  She is married and is a loving mother of four children.  Her husband is a retiree, whose pension is not enough to support the family.  This is why Munira started her own business.  She has been involved in buying and selling food products for over four years.  Her children help her with the business.  Munira wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 5000 Somoni to purchase food products in order to increase her working capital.  She relies on your help and kindness.  Thank you!

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Nolberto Orlando

texts.es:
Norberto Orlando tiene 20 años de edad es Soltero, vive con su madre,en el  recinto San Josè de Guayabal Cantón Chillanes provincia  de Bolívar no tiene hijos.

La ventanilla LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Josè de Guayabal, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz, mora, fréjol.

Norberto Orlando  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, mora desde hace tres años. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Chillanes.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz, fréjol, mora. 

El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es incrementar los sombríos de mora para tener mejores ingresos y así un mejor estilo de vida  Le gusta salir a jugar fútbol  y  que llegue el carnaval.
texts.en:
Norberto Orlando is 20 years old, he is single and he lives with his mother in San José de Guayabal, a district of Chillanes, a canton in the Bolívar province.

LUZ Y PROGRESO (Light and Progress) is a Community Bank located in San José de Guayabal, a district of the Chillanes canton. The members of this Community Bank engage in short-cycle farming of maize, blackberries and beans.

Norberto Orlando has been engaged in agriculture for three years, growing maize, beans and blackberries. He buys and sells in Chillanes.

The loan he has requested will be used to buy seeds, manure, urea, fertilizers and insecticides to grow maize, beans and blackberries.

The loan has helped him increase his income both for the needs of his family and to make investments. His dream is to increase the blackberries production to earn a better income and consequently improve his standard of living. He likes playing soccer and he enjoys the carnival.

loans.use: To buy seeds, manure, urea, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Benkadi 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Djigonso, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le maïs  avec   KONIBA , 1ere assise de la droite  vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 225.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Benkadi 1 group are married women with an average age of 39, on average 5 children, and who all live in traditional family settings in Djigonso, one of the villages in San, the 4th administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 3rd loan with the institution. The previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Koniba, sitting on the far right of the picture, farms corn. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small agricultural equipment, and to pay for the labourers needed to maintain 1.5 hectares of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in her village and at the San market, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 225 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to pay labour costs and buy agricultural inputs, small equipment and seeds.

loans.name: Ndeye's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été crée le 21 Novembre 2009. Il est composé essentiellement de femmes du quartier ayant de bonnes relations. 

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, Ndeye Touty est âgée de 50 ans. 

Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont 2 garçons et 2 filles. 

Son crédit reçu, elle va acheter 2 paniers de poissons fumés à 15 000 francs CFA l'unité et 20 kgs de fruits de mer à 1200 francs le kg pour revendre dans sa localité. 

Elle utilise les bénéfices pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group was created on November 21, 2009. It consists mainly of local women who get along nicely. 

Ndeye Touty, age 50, is the group member standing on the right with her hand raised. She is a married mother of four children, two boys and two girls.  

She will use this loan to buy 2 baskets of smoked fish at 15,000 francs CFA each, and 20 kg of seafood at 1,200 francs per kilo. She will sell this merchandise in her neighborhood.  

She will use her profits to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish and seafood for resale.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is 23 years old, married, and has two children. He owns a motorbike, which he uses for transport services. He also earns an income by supplying milk and bread. He has been in the transport business for twelve years. Faulu Kenya has helped William to improve his business because he has been trained in business management skills. Someday he hopes to expand his business and have a fleet of motorbikes. He requires a loan of 100,265 KES to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Mahoutondji Group

texts.fr: MAHOUTONDJI est un groupe composé de cinq personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Abêgnonhou Antoinette (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 34 ans. Abêgnonhou Antoinette n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Abêgnonhou Antoinette est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Pascal. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Abêgnonhou Antoinette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Abêgnonhou Antoinette et son mari. Pour cette raison, Abêgnonhou Antoinette vend des friperies et des sacs de charbon de bois à son domicile et de façon ambulante depuis cinq ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Abêgnonhou Antoinette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Abêgnonhou Antoinette sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe MAHOUTONDJI, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des friperies et des charbon de bois.

loans.name: Baraka Women Group(Mtungi Moja)

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Josphine. She is thirty three years old, married and blessed with three children. She is a member of Baraka women group (Mtungi Moja) which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 and has benefited from enterprise development and financial management training.
She does dairy and maize farming. She is borrowing from Kiva to purchase fertilizer and dairy feeds that will consequently increase her produce and income. This will assist her cater for the family needs such as food, medicine and in paying school fees for her children. 
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and dairy feeds hence increase in produce and income to cater for food and medicine for her family and pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add more stock in the business of clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Macias

texts.en: S. has a business where he sells chlorine and bleach. These products are very important to the people in his community due to the lack of infrastructure that breeds unsanitary conditions. They use these products to clean their clothes and homes. S. started off in this business with a loan provided by his sister. He used the loan to invest in the products and sell them to the end consumer, but now he has taken the next step and he is distributing to the small stores and markets in the area. He hopes that with this loan he will be able to invest in different types of cleaning products. He is 52 years old and is a widower. He has one son who is physically disabled. S. depends completely on his business to support his small family.

loans.use: Invest in cleaning products

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa lives in the small Samoan village of Fagalii–uta  with her seven children.  She is 52 years old, and she is the proud owner of a small village shop.  In her small store, she sells a variety of products to the local villagers such as, snacks, mutton, toilet tissue, water and much, much more.  While there are several competing shops in the village, Luisa has a loyal cadre of customers and is committed to expanding her product line and ensuring a consistent supply of goods so that she can ensure her customers are satisfied.  She feels confident that combining the right products with good service will ensure her success.  Luisa’s children help her run the shop, ensuring she can remain open long hours to service the villagers.  Luisa will use a loan to purchase merchandise for re-selling in her store as well as to make some small improvements to better the appearance of the store and make it more attractive and inviting to potential customers.

loans.use: Buy merchandise and materials for renovation

loans.name: Asif

texts.en: Asif H. is only 22, but he is already the successful owner of a barber shop in Sabirabad.  Since he began his small business in 2004, the number of his clients has increased considerably. Now he is planning to enlarge his barber shop  and repair it. For this purpose he has applied for a loan of $1,000 USD from Aqroinvest CU.

loans.use: To repair and enlarge his barber shop

loans.name: Anatila

texts.es:
Business Description

Señora Anatila has 10 years of experience in this business. She began to work when she separated from her husband. She began her diner with money which she received from a job where she worked for eleven years. From this she renovated her house so that the diner could operate from there. She works from Monday – Friday from 6.30am to 3pm selling lunches and on Saturdays and Sundays she sells snacks too. On the weekends her two daughters help her in the restaurant.

Loan Use

She will invest the loan in the purchase of utensils for the diner: she already needs to replace those she already owns because they’re not sufficient to satisfy her customer demand.

Personal Information

Señora Anatila is a single mother: with effort she has helper her children and now all of them are of age and help her with household bills. Her two adult daughters work with her on the weekends. Her house is made of cement and is two stories high, although is is currently under construction and not yet finished. She has always acted as both mother and father to her children. Señora Anatila’s ambition is to establish another restaurant site in an area further away from her house so that one of her daughters could work there too. She works everyday with great effort in order to better herself and her children.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Anatila tiene 10 años de experiencia en esta actividad. Ella empezó a trabajar a raíz que se separó de su esposo. Inicio el comedor con un dinero que recibió de un trabajo donde ella laboró por 11 años. Desde entonces acondiciono su casa para que funcione allí el comedor. Ella trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 6:30am hasta 15:00pm vendiendo almuerzos y los sábados y domingos vende meriendas también. Los fines de semana sus 2 hijas le ayudan en el negocio.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra utensilios para el comedor ya que tiene que renovar los que ya tiene porque no son suficientes para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

Información Personal

La Sra. Anatila es madre soltera, con el esfuerzo de ella ha ayudado a sus hijos y ya todos son mayores de edad y le ayudan con los gastos del hogar. Sus dos hijas mujeres son quienes los fines de semana trabajan con ella. Su casa es de 2 pisos de cemento. Aun esta construyéndola ya que no esta acabada. Ella siempre ha sido padre y madre para sus hijos. El deseo de la Sra. Anatila es poner otro local de comida en un sector mas alejado de su casa para que una de sus hijas trabaje también allá. Ella cada día trabaja con mucho esfuerzo para superarse ella y sus hijos.

loans.use: Improve her resaurant with utensils and other repairs.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela, 29 years old, is married, with three children (a girl and two boys). The two elder children go to the primary school. The youngest one is just two years old. Carmela's husband works in a construction company in Santo Domingo, the capital.

Carmela started her business eight years ago. She sells women's and children´s shoes, skin care and hair treatment products, women´s handbags, wigs, belts, and so forth. With the loan requested, she will increase her inventory in order to satisfy her customers´ needs. She will also introduce gold-filled jewelery so as to diversify her inventory and carry a wider range of products for her clientele.

loans.use: To purchase skin care and hair repair products and wigs for her business  Also introduce gold-filled jewelry to diversify inventory

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en:
Mr. Sophoin Tep married in 1987. He has three children, one son and two daughters. He learned the skill of repairing motorbikes from his friend in Phnom Penh back in 1988. He began his business repairing motorbikes and selling motorbike spare parts in the village one year later. His spouse is at home and sells cooked food. Their eldest daughter is working at a garment factory in Pon-nhea Leu district. Other two children are studying in the local school.

Mr. Tep has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times already. Now he is requesting another loan in the amount of US$ 1,000. He will use this loan to purchase more motorbike spare parts for expanding his business.

loans.use: Purchasing more motorbike spare parts for expanding his business

loans.name: Halima's Group

texts.en:
Halima N. is requesting a loan in order to invest in her retail shop and restaurant business as well as to increase her business’ inventory.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To restock her business

loans.name: Nankulabye A(Iii) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for seven months. Hadijah and Gladys sell used clothes. Prossy has a retail shop business. Eva has a grocery store while Macksensia has a hotel business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To add in cloth business.

loans.name: Khikmat

texts.en:
I. Khikmat is 27 years old and married with two adorable children aged 1 and 2.

Khikmat is a cattleman, purchasing young cattle, raising and then selling them in the local market. He has been in this business for 7 years. Khikmat is working hard to make his business thrive, as it is the main source of income for his family for whom he is trying to ensure adequate living conditions.  Currently Khikmat has 2 cows and is requesting a loan of $600.00 for the term of 6 months to purchase 2 more. This is the first loan for Khikmat; he thanks all for their trust and promises to repay the loan without violations.

loans.use: To purchase 2 cows.

loans.name: Abed

texts.en: Abed is a 28-year-old man who lives  in Tripoli, in northern Lebanon, with his family. Abed has 1 child. He sells and repairs car air conditioners. This is the first time he is applying for a loan at A. Majmoua. He wants to move his business to a bigger location.

loans.use: to move his business to a bigger location

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 32 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 13 and 9 years old. She and her husband also take care of 4 other children. Anna owns a small grocery store, which she started in 2005. Every day she works from 6am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more grocery items (beer and soda) for her business.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items (soda and beer) for her business.

loans.name: Kin

texts.en:
Mrs. Kin C. is a grocer and a farmer in the Prey Rongeang Village of Kampong Speu Province. Mrs. Kin C. is a 37-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are enrolled in school. Her husband, Mr. Thy Kong (pictured on the left), is a farmer and a construction worker in the village. Previously, Mrs. Kin C. obtained a loan from AMK to buy fertilizers for her field and pigs for breeding purposes. Last year, her youngest child contracted typhoid, so Mrs. Kin C. incurred $75 of expenses to cure that disease. Recently, the same child fell ill again, and Mrs. Kin C. will surely need to spend additional money on unforeseen expenses.

Despite her two business activities, she is unable to support her family in a meaningful way. Thus, she is seeking to start another husbandry business. Unfortunately, Mrs. Kin C. does not have enough money to attain this goal, so she is seeking a loan to buy cows and pigs for breeding.

loans.use: To better support her family by starting yet another business and, more specifically, by purchasing cows and pigs for breeding.

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.es:
Joaquina is married and her husband works as a waiter in a restaurant. They have a 4 year old daughter. She started her business by helping a friend who could no longer tend to it. The friend sold the merchandise to Joaquina at a very low price so that she could start her own business. Joaquina's principal motivation was to help her husband with the household expenses since his salary was not enough to cover all their needs. She launched her stationary store a year ago and so far she has been doing really well because her store is always well stocked.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $250, to be paid in 3 months. She will use it to purchase merchandise and in this manner, offer more variety of products to her clients. With your help Joaquina can grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Joaquina es casada su esposo trabaja como mesero en un restaurante. Ellos tienen una niña de 4 años. Inició el negocio para apoyar a una amiga ya que ella no podia seguir atendiendolo, por lo cual le vendio la mercancia a un costo muy bajo para poder iniciar su propio negocio, lo inicio principalmente ante la necesidad economica que tenia ya que el sueldo de su esposo no alcanzaba para los gastos del hogar. Comenzó su papeleria hace un año y hasta ahora le ha ido muy bien debido a que tiene muy surtido el negocio.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para adquirir mas mercancía para ofrecer mas variedad de productos a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Joaquina consolidara su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Pach

texts.en: Mrs. Pach R. is a stove maker in Tie Prumpie Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 55 years old and a widow, with two children who are construction workers. Her children always spend a lot of money on transportation to work. In order to improve their lives, Mrs. Pach R. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for them. Previously, Mrs. Pach R. had obtained a loan from AMK to buy clay to make a stove, and she has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children for traveling to work.

loans.name: Chhim

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhim S. lives in Kralanh Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a garment factory worker who earns a small income to support her family.

She also is a vegetable farmer when she has free time from her work. Her plantation soil is infertile, so Mrs. Chhim S. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer to increase production. Mrs. S. is a 36-year-old widow without any children.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to increase productivity of her fields

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Mrs. Phan S. is a villager in Tatai Village in Takeo Province. She is a pig breeder and her husband, Mr. Neav Sophorn, is a farmer. Since Mrs. Phan S.'s pig breeding is going well, she wants to expand so she decided to ask for a loan to buy five more pigs, which cost $87.50. With the rest of the loan she would use to buy more pig food to feed them. Mrs. Phan S. is 36 years old and she is married without any children. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy five more pigs for breeding.

loans.name: Roidith

texts.es:
La Señora Roydith, socia del Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de El Dorado, distrito de Agua Blanca. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y comida tipo menú. Su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Miguel Grau Nº 214, lugar donde acuden diariamente a comprar sus clientes, que son mayormente los moradores de su comunidad.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 6  meses, comprará  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, leche, aceite, conservas en cajas de diferentes tamaños, papel higiénico en paquetes, detergentes, jabones de diferentes marcas y tamaños, entre otros, además va a implementar su venta de comida y comprará vajilla de vidrios como jarras, vasos, cucharas y platos para surtir bien su negocio y sus clientes encuentren lo que buscan, así como también brindarles una buena atención,  y darle una mejor presentación de su negocio. 

Roydith tiene 44 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos quienes son la razón de su lucha constante. Es una mujer trabajadora y su meta  es la  de contar con un restaurante bien implementado de comida criolla.
texts.en:
Roydith is a member of the "Las Margaritas" [Daisies] Community Bank. She lives in San Martin region, El Dorado province, in the Agua Blanca district. She owns a neighborhood convenience store and sells prepared foods. Her business is located in her home at Jirón MIguel Grau, no. 214, where her clients -- many of whom live in the neighborhood -- come to make their daily purchases. With this loan of 1,500 soles [approximately US $ 500] -- which will be paid back in six months -- Roydith plans to purchase basic cooking supplies and other items, such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, canned foods in different sizes, toilet paper, cleaning detergents, and various brands and sizes of soap, among others. In addition, she plans to establish her food sales business. To do this, she will purchase dishware such as pitchers, glasses, spoons and plates to sufficiently stock her business. These purchases also will help ensure her customers can find everything they're looking for and receive good service, as well as improve the look of her business. Roydith is 44 years old. She lives with her husband and their four children, who motivate her to keep working hard. Roydith is a hard-working woman. Her goal is to own a successful Criolla restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic goods (rice, sugar, milk, canned foods, etc.)

location.town: Agua Blanca - El Dorado - San Martín

loans.name: Maritza

texts.en:
Maritza is a member of the Gracias Morenita Village Bank. She is 25 years old and is married with three children. She used to sell anticuchos (beef-heart kabobs) from a mobile cart at night, but she stopped because she has small children.

Maritza and her husband operate a locksmith shop in a rented space. Maritza needs a loan of 600 soles (US$200) to buy iron rods for her husband to work with. She dreams of owning her own home, of expanding her workshop, and of buying all of the necessary equipment for her business. Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer Maritza es socia del Banco Comunal Gracias Morenita. Maritza es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 3 hijos, Maritza vendía anticuchos por las noches de manera ambulatoria en las nazarenas, actualmente dejo de realizar su negocio por que sus hijos son pequeños. Maritza junto a su esposo tienen un taller de cerrajería en un local alquilado. Maritza necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de fierros. Maritza sueña con tener una casa propia, ampliar su taller y equipar con todo lo necesario.

loans.use: Buy iron rods for locksmith workshop

loans.name: Ierb

texts.en:
Ierb S., 38, is married and lives with two of her children in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$ 2.70 each day and are supported by one child working in a garment factory.

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Ierb S. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$ 500 to purchase a horse and a cart to transport goods and villagers. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family. (Her husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To purchase a horse and a cart to transport goods

loans.name: Jany Isabel

texts.en:
Jany Isabel T. P. is 23 years old.  She lives in Pucallpa, Peru – a major city in the eastern jungle region of the country.  This steaming, humid city is situated on the banks of the Ucayali River, a tributary of the Amazon River.  Jany is a member of the Las Heroinas communal bank and has been taking out small business loans for 3 years to support her hammock business.  

Jany weaves and sells hammocks for a living.  Hammocks are a popular purchase of travelers leaving on riverboats headed to other port towns along the Ucayali.  Riverboats often do not have beds for passengers to sleep in, so everyone must bring along their own hammock.  Jany sells to these travelers and also to people who would like a hammock for their own home.

Jany is currently requesting a Kiva loan of 2,000 Nuevo Soles to purchase cloth, thread and other materials used in making hammocks.  She will repay the loan in monthly installments.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase cloth, thread and other materials for making hammocks to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther O. is forty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, three boys and a girl. Currently, Esther says three of her children have completed junior high school, while the last is still in elementary school. She is also taking care of her late sister's three children. She lives with her family in a family house in Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Offinso is a farming and commercial community.

Esther works hard to support her husband in taking care of the family. Her husband is a farmer. He cultivates maize, plantains and other food stuffs in the community where they live. Esther sells fresh yam in the local market square. She procures the tubers of yam from the farmers in the surrounding villages. Esther has been in this business for eight years now and is full of experience. She also distributes the yam to some food vendors in her community. She wants a loan to buy tubers of yam on a large scale so that she can distribute to more customers and so increase her profit margin. Esther wants to help her children and those of her late sister to further their education after completing junior high school.

loans.use: To procure tubers of yam

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana E. has been engaged in growing rice for 13 years. She and her husband work together to sustain their farm. Their children help them by removing weeds and snails, which improves the yield.

Rosana is 36 years old. Her 3 children all study in school. She mainly depends on the rice harvest to pay the children's school fees. Now, Rosana is trying to develop business opportunities to earn more for her family. In the past, she worked as a fish vendor. She was not happy selling fish because she only earned a small amount; there was too much competition in the market.

She now is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and insecticides for her farm. She believes that a loan will help to bring her a good harvest. Therefore, she will have more to give to her children.

CEVI provides its clients the credit assistance that they need. Clients also receive trainings and insurance coverage from CEVI to help their small businesses grow.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Djidja (Courage) Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées, les quatre femmes du groupe Djidja ont en moyenne  32 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles traditionnelles à Gongebougou, un des villages de la sous préfecture de Loulouni, cercle de Kadiolo, 3ème région administrative du Mali (Sikasso). 

Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la restauration, la vente de beurre de karité et de couscous.  Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur deuxième  prêt solidaire et le précédent a été remboursé sans difficulté. 

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter 1 sac de 100 kg de noix de karité pour en faire du beurre de karité, 2 sacs de 100 kg de sorgho pour en faire du couscous afin de le revendre et 1 sac de 100 kg d’haricots plus 1paquet de condiments alimentaires pour faire la restauration. Elles s’approvisionnent à Gongebougou, dans les localités avoisinantes et à Loulouni. Les marchandises sont vendues au marché de Dallen, Nimbougou et Loulouni les jours de foire à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.

Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 7.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités. Certaines femmes du groupe Djidja souhaitent être un jour  grossistes,  d’autres avoir de petits restaurants dans les différents marchés qu’elles fréquentent.
texts.en:
All married, the four women of the Djidja group have an average age of 32 and on average, 2 children. They live in traditional families in Gongebougou, one of the villages of the Sous-prefecture of Loulouni, Kadiolo circle, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali (Sikasso).

They have various businesses, among others selling cooked food, karité (shea) butter, and couscous. They work together with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to satisfy the needs of their clientele, and they are on their second group loan, the preceding loan having been repaid correctly.

With this new loan, they intend to buy 1 sack of 100 kg of karité (shea) nuts to make into shea butter, 2 sacks of 100 kg of sorghum to make into couscous for sale, and 1 sack of 100 kg of dried beans plus one package of condiments for their catering. They do their buying in Gongebougou and the surrounding area and at Loulouni. The merchandise is sold in the markets of Dallen, Nimbougou and Loulouni on market days, to a clientele composed of men and women.

They each expect to make an average monthly profit of 7,500 F CFA of which part will be used for family needs and the rest will be reinvested in their businesses. Some of the women of the Djidja group would like to become wholesalers one day; others hope to have little restaurants in the various markets where they do their selling.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of karité (shea) nuts, sorghum and dried beans

loans.name: Benkadi  (L’Entente) Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Benkadi sont toutes mariées, la moyenne d’âge des femmes du groupe se situe autour de 38 ans  et elles ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Les membres du groupe Benkadi vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au village de Soloso  préfecture de San (Région de Ségou, République du Mali).
 Elles se sont  connues   à travers des liens   de voisinage et de parenté.
L’activité  principale de ce groupe est la fabrication  et vente des articles en terres cuites (canaris, jarres, fumoirs, encensoirs etc.) Elles ont appris ce métier à bas âge avec les parents. En plus de l’artisanat, elles font le commerce des articles tels le beurre de karité. Elles sont très sollicitées dans cette activité. 
Pour satisfaire  le  besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Benkadi a décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son troisième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, du beurre de karité en grande quantité  et  des chargements de charrettes de bois de chauffe (pour la cuisson des articles en terre glaise). Le beurre est vendu au comptant en détail à la maison et au marché de San, quant aux articles de l’artisanat, ils sont  vendus en gros au comptant dans le village aux autres femmes qui ne le font pas. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 65 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The five women in the Benkadi group are all married and average 38 years of age and 4 children. The members of the group live in large extended traditional families in Soloso, a village in the San Prefecture (Ségou Region, Republic of Mali). They got acquainted through bonds of neighborhood and kinship. The main business of the group consists in manufacturing and selling various terracotta pots (canaris, jars, thuribles, etc). They learned this business at a young age with their parents. In addition to handicraft, they also sell products such as shea butter. They are very much in demand in this business.

To meet the needs of its ever-increasing demand, the Benkadi group decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, from which it is seeking its third solidarity loan (group loan). All previous loans were repaid without problems.

The women intend to use this loan to buy a large quantity of shea butter, and cartloads of firewood (to cook terracotta items). The butter is retailed for cash, at home and at the San market. Handicraft items are sold wholesale and for cash, to the other women in the village, who do not make them.

During this loan cycle, they hope to turn an average profit of XOF 65'000 (ca US$ 130) each, to be used to repay the loan, and to provide for their extended families. The remainder will be invested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shea butter and firewood

loans.name: Tuwewakweli Group

texts.en:
Bimtoro owns a small charcoal store, and she has also sold clothes in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $80. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.  

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal and clothes for resale, to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.  

Bimtoro is forty-six years old, married, and has two children, ages twenty-three and twenty-two. She also cares for two additional dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Aziza, who also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en: Purevsuren M. is 39, married and the mother of three. All her children are attending a local elementary school. Her family lives in a 'ger’ (traditional nomadic tent) district in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia’s central provinces. Together with her husband, she has been running a small cafe since 2002. Her cafe is located in the center of the province and meals are sold at a cheap price. One meal is around $2 USD because local residents cannot spend a lot to eat out. However, she has many repeat clients. Besides running a cafe, she also runs a retail business selling meat. She buys whole animals from the local herders at a wholesale price and cuts them up to resell. Purevsuren is a warm and friendly person who is well respected. She requests a loan to purchase more food products and beverages for her cafe and whole animals to sell the meat. She says "from now on, I will start saving for my two eldest children's future university tuition."

loans.use: to purchase food products and beverages for her cafe.

loans.name: Saut

texts.en: Saut H. is 56 years old and a resident of the Pursat Province, where she has owned a plot of land since 1979. She grows rice and some vegetable crops, which she plants twice a year. She is a widowed mother of five children, all of whom are single and help her with the farm work. Saut H. and her children work hard at their farming activity every day and never waste time. She is a sacrificing lady who tries to earn money to sustain her family and desires that all her children attain suitable jobs. To assist her with the hard physical labor required in farming, Saut H. is applying for a loan to buy a water buffalo for plowing the fields and to buy more fertilizers to grow crops.

loans.use: To buy a water buffalo for plowing the fields and buy more fertilizers to grow crops

loans.name: Esmelda Maria-

texts.es: La señora Esmelda Maria Benavides,  de 45 años de edad, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, casada y con dos hijos de 8 y 14 años de edad, los dos estudian,  su esposo labora como cadete de taxi, y ella vende mariscos desde hace cinco años, anteriormente vendía en su casa refrescos pero luego inicio la venta de mariscos rico en comida, y es un producto rentable. Con este crédito es su noveno ciclo que va invertir en la compra de mariscos variados como: camarones, conchas, pescado, ostiones para hacer sus ricos cócteles que son comprados por muchos nicaragüenses. Sus planes es mejorar el tramo donde vende para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ms. Esmelda Maria Benavides is a 45-year-old woman who lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. She is married and has two children ages 8 and 14. Her husband is a taxi cab driver, while she has been selling seafood for five years. She used to sell beverages, but she then started a seafood business because it is more lucrative. This is her ninth loan that she will invest in purchasing various types of seafood, such as: shrimp, clams, fish, and oysters to make her delicious seafood cocktails that many Nicaraguans love to purchase. Her plan is to improve her stall so that she can offer better customer service.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shrimp, clams, etc.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is a 55-year-old widow and the mother of four children. Two of her children are in school but the other two are independent, easing the burden on her. Georgina lives at Sefwi with her family. She is a food vendor, selling kenkey in her neighborhood. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. Georgina has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey for breakfast, lunch and supper.

Georgina wants to use her loan to buy more raw materials such as bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise more income to support the growth of her business.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials such as bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa R.'s dream is to be successful in her "sari-sari" store business. She started it nine years ago. Her ambition was to have a stable income for the family so that she would be able to carry out her responsibilty as a mother to her six children.

When she learned about Community Economic Ventures, She never hesitated to access its credit services. Now, she would like to ask again a loan worth Php 18,000 to make her business flourish by buying additional groceries.

Never losing hope, Ninfa is doing her best in her business because the income from her store has been helpful for her children's educational needs. Now, she still connected with CEVI's credit program and receives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase assorted groceries

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora C. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old. Leonora is single. To make a living, Leonora buys and sells bananas in the local community. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Leonora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Leonora from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rafiki Group

texts.en:
Saida is a member of the Rafiki borrower group In Msamvu,Morogoro,she is 42 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.her children are aged 17,7,6 years.

Saida started her own business selling clothes 2 years ago.she works 6 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Saida`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzani,she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Saida hopes to save money and expand her business.

Farida,Sikujua,Turia are also the member of the same borrower group,they also requested the loan  in order to expand their business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Benkelema Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkelema sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 40 ans et 2  enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des familles traditionnelles  dans le quartier Banankabougou de la ville de Fana, Région  de  Koulikoro  République du Mali. 
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers relations professionnelle et d’amitié. Elles font des activités diverses qui sont entre autre l’habillement, la nourriture etc, et sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement rembourses. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt elles veulent acheter des articles divers tels les pagnes, du savon,  des céréales et condiments alimentaires pour la restauration au niveau de Fana. Leur clientèle est diverse et variée.
Elles comptent obtenir 15.000FCFA de bénéfice mensuel chacune. Les bénéfices seront réutilisés dans l’activité et serviront à subvenir à quelques dépenses familiales.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers.

loans.name: Peter Ndegwa

texts.en:
Peter Ndegwa is 40 years old and married to one wife with three children. He lives within the Muthure area on his own farm. He is a farmer who grows vegetables, including cabbages, and supplies them to clients within the same area. This has been providing him and his family food and income to run their home. He has been running the sustenance farming business for the past two years and from this he earns a profit of about 59,600 Kenyan shillings (about $797) per month.

KADET is the first MFI he has borrowed from. He was introduced by a friend. He has applied for a loan, which he plans to use to buy more seedlings for planting.

His future hopes are to improve his farm and to have more supplies of his agricultural products.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Buy more seedlings for planting

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia tiene 53 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. El negocio de venta de zapatos y zapatillas de Florencia está ubicado en la mina La Rinconada (Provincia de San Antonio de Putina, distrito de Puno), ella tiene muchos clientes, ya que el calzado que vende es de muy buena calidad y duran mucho, lo cual es perfecto para la zona tan agreste donde trabajan.

Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y recomendarles los mejores zapatos, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el intenso frío que hace en la mina, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y tiene que realizarlo. Para más adelante espera tener una tienda muy grande de zapatos donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes.

Este es el primer préstamo de Florencia con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que quiere acceder a otros préstamos posteriormente, en su banco comunal es una de las socias más responsables. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más zapatos y zapatillas para implementar mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Florencia is 53 years old and a very hardworking and responsible woman. She lives in her own house and hopes to have a peaceful retirement. She sells shoes and slippers in the mining town of La Rinconada (located in the Province of San Antonio de Putina, Puno District). Florencia has many customers because the footwear she sells is of good quality and very durable, which is perfect for this region of wilderness where many people work.

What Florencia enjoys most about her job is conversing with her customers and recommending the best shoes for them. She has been in business for 20 years and considers the most difficult challenge to be enduring the cold weather in this region, yet she knows that there is work for her to do. In the future, she would like to open a large shoe store where she can better serve her customers.
