This is Florencia’s first loan with MFP. She is willing to make her payments on time because she wants to be able to access subsequent loans. Florencia is one of the more responsible members of her Communal Bank. With a loan of 1000 soles, she plans to purchase more shoes and slippers in order to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of footwear

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha tiene 35 años, es madre soltera y trabaja arduamente para satisfacer las necesidades de sus pequeños hijos, quienes siempre le brindan momentos agradables en su hogar.

Sus estudios de contabilidad le ayudaron a conseguir un empleo para una empresa, pero su remuneración no alcanzaba para solventar sus gastos. Por tal motivo, adicionalmente, decidió comenzar a vender ropa y son sus compañeras de trabajo sus principales clientes.
Esta actividad la viene realizando desde 4 años, tiempo en que también viene disfrutando de la amistad de sus clientas. Pero lo difícil del negocio es realizar las compras en el centro de la ciudad, pues la delincuencia amenaza con hacerle pasar un mal momento, por lo que siempre trata de ser prudente en las zonas peligrosas. 
Para el futuro, Martha desea instalar un stand y vender ropa de primera calidad, así como diseñar sus propias prendas, las cuales tengan la  oportunidad de ser aceptadas en el mercado tan competitivo.

Este es su noveno préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y sabe que su responsabilidad y puntualidad dentro de su banco comunal es indispensable, para seguir desarrollándose como una comerciante exitosa. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más prendas acorde a la última temporada y aprovechará algunas ofertas en los supermercados.
texts.en:
Martha is 35 years old, a single mother, and she works arduously in order to satisfy the needs of her small children, who always provide her with enjoyable moments in her home. Her studies in accounting helped her get a job for a company, but her salary wasn't enough to cover her expenses. For that reason, additionally she decided to begin selling clothing, and her coworkers are her main clients. She has been doing this activity for 4 years, in which time she has also enjoyed the friendship of her clients. However, the difficult part of the business is making purchases in the center of the city, because delinquency threatens to give her a hard time. Therefore, she always tries to be wise in the dangerous zonas. For the future, Martha desires to set up a stand and sell high quality clothing, as well as design her own garments, which will have the opportunity to be accepted in such a competitive market. This is her ninth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she knows that her responsibility and punctuality within her communal bank are indispensible, in order to continue growing as a successful merchant. With the money that she is requesting, she will purchase more garments according to the latest season and will take advantage of the sales in the supermarkets.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 32 years old and married with three school-aged children. He hawks (goes door-to-door) various items, like radios, calculators, rechargeable flashlights, and padlocks. He has been making his living this way for five years and previously worked for a large company. He is now requesting a loan of Kes 20,000 to add stock that is targeted for the festive season in December.

Joseph describes himself as a humble, understanding, social businessman and family-man. Since joining Faulu, he says that he has become empowered, especially in terms of saving money. In the future, he hopes to be established, experienced and able to import his own goods.

loans.use: To add stock for the festive season

loans.name: Lawranta

texts.en: Lawranta sells soup ingredients like crayfish, dry pepper and cooking oil at retail prices to her customers in the market. She sells for long hours to enable her to meet the basic needs of her family. She is 45 years old and married, with 5 children. She is requesting a loan of 80,000 NGN to  purchase more soup ingredients to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more soup ingredients to sell

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji G. is currently in the business of selling tea and bread in her restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock soft drinks like sodas, packed juice and water.

Keji is 40 years old and is divorced. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a bigger restaurant.


About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock soft drinks like sodas, packed juice and water

loans.name: Phạm's Group

texts.en:
T. Phạm Thị B. (20211030016) is a 33 year-old woman, living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T. is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Phù Lưu 1 nhóm 03 (2).


T. is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, T. operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not her only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for her business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  T. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2.500.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.808.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.496.000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by her from SEDA.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị C. (20211030009) is a 62 year-old female who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Nguyễn Thị D. (20211030014) is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  Nguyễn Thị S. (20211030007) is a 30 year-old female who is requesting a 7.840.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


4.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20211030011) is a 30 year-old female who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Phạm Thị B. (20211030016) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Phù Lưu 1 nhóm 03 (2).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND.  Vào 2007, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.808.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.496.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị C. (20211030009) là 62 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nguyễn Thị D. (20211030014) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Nguyễn Thị S. (20211030007) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.840.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


4.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20211030011) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: David

texts.es:
Nuestro socio es el señor DAVID, ella pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”, el socio es  natural de la provincia de Sicuani ubicado en el departamento del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 40 años de edad es casado, tiene 4 hijos (18, 14, 12, 5) años de edad, el socio trabaja hace 11 años como guardián en el área de educación y hace 4 años decidió abrir su propio taller de carpintería, nuestro socio realizó su sueño de apertura su taller y lo fue haciendo poco a poco con las herramientas justas pero es tan bueno e su trabajo que ahora le dan trabajaos mas laboriosos para lo cual el socio necesita de algunas maquinarías para hacer su trabajo eficiente, ahora nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para poder comprar su maquinaría.

El socio  agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago  de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner is Mr. David, he belongs to the "Mujeres Unidas" communal bank. The partner was born in the Sicuani province located in the Cusco department. Our partner is 40 years old and is married with 4 children aged 18, 14, 12 and 5 years old. He has been working for over 11 years as a guard in the education industry and 4 years ago decided to open his own carpentry shop. Our partner fulfilled his dream of opening the woodshop and was able to do it slowly with the right tools, but he is so good at what he does that now he gets more laborious jobs for which he needs some machinery to make his work more efficient. Our partner is now requesting the loan to be able to purchase the machinery. The partner is grateful and expresses his satisfaction to be able to continue growing his own business and is committed to fulfill the payment of the debt in the established period.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of carpentry machines

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores, D. 64 años, vive feliz en su casa propia en compañía D. su madre, su hijo Javier, su nuera y su pequeña nieta.
Anteriormente tenía un restaurante donD. preparaba y vendía diversas comidas, pero tuvo problemas D. salud y decidió cambiar el rubro D. su negocio. Es así que desD. hace 2 meses empezó a vender muebles D. madera; como estantes, vitrinas, camas, etc., ya que  la zona por donD. vive es muy comercial y además este negocio no le demanda mucho esfuerzo que pueda poner en peligro su salud. Aunque Dolores extraña su restaurante, sabe que su nuevo negocio también les es muy rentable, a pesar D. su avanzada edad tiene un espíritu joven por lo que planea seguir progresando en su negocio ofreciendo mayor diversidad y cantidad D. muebles.

Este es el 8vo préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser responsable en el pago D. sus cuotas, ya que no quiere quedar mal ni con la institución, ni con sus compañeros D. grupo. Dolores tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra D. colchones para empezar a venderlos junto con sus muebles, así implementará mejor su negocio y obtendrá mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Dolores is 64 years old and happily lives in her own home in the company of her mother, her son, Javier, her daughter-in-law, and her young granddaughter. She previously had a restaurant where she prepared and sold a variety of foods, but she had health problems and decided to switch to a new business. Two months ago she began selling wood furniture like shelves, cabinets, beds, etc. since the zone where she lives is very commercialized and this business does not require a lot of exertion and she does not put her health in danger. Even though Dolores misses her restaurant, she knows that her new business is also profitable. In spite of her advanced age she has a young spirit and she plans to continue progressing in her business offering a greater diversity and quantity of furniture.

This is the eighth loan she has had with MFP and she promises to be responsible in her loan payments, since she does not want the bank nor her group members to look poorly upon her. Dolores plans to invest her loan money in buying mattresses to begin selling them with her furniture. This will improve her business and help her obtain higher earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Cely

texts.en:
Cely T. is from the village of Banquero. She is 27 years-old and married with three school-aged children. Cely raises crops and her main source of income comes from planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Cely has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Cely joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cely is requesting a first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and North-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas makes lovely Nigerian and western hair styles for her customers. She also sells hair extensions and creams. She opens her salon daily from 8 am to 7 pm. She hopes to own a world class salon in the future. She loves her business because she makes her customers look beautiful. 

Dorcas hopes for the loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell. Dorcas is 38 years old and married with 3 children. Her eldest child is 10 years old while the youngest is 3 years old. Her children are doing well in school. Her husband repairs refrigerators and he also supports their home. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a 49-year-old married man with six children. Two of the children are in school. He has been selling charcoal and cattle for ten years. He buys cattle from farmers at a lower price and sells them to butchers. He has one employee to assist him in his businesses. He was previously employed as a driver. He describes himself as hardworking and honest. 

Since he became a member of Faulu Kenya, his business has grown and his profit margin has increased. He hopes to expand his charcoal business to a wholesale and to improve his standard of living in the future. He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a cow. 

In the photo are Elijah and his wife.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional bags of tomatoes and onions for her business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites G. is from the village of Barangay 25, Pandan, Gingoog City. She is 25 years old. Marites is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns & operates a specialized retail store selling electronic cellphones in the local community. Marites has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marites joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional working capital. Marites is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovating the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Marites from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in renovating the business.

location.town: Barangay 25, Pandan, Gingoog City, Mis. Or.

loans.name: Omowumi

texts.en: Omowumi sells sarongs in Ibadan, Oyo state. She is a hard working woman and she is so determined to excel in her business and family life. She is married with 3 children and she is 45 years old. She sells sarongs to make a living. She hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger in the future.  She is requesting for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Mochama

texts.en:
Mochama is 61 years old and married, with 7 children aged between 26 and 40 years old. One of his children is currently attending school. 

He is a farmer from the area near Kisii town in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last 30 years. His main products are milk, maize, beans and millet, which he sells to the local market. He also produces tea, which he sells to the Kenya Tea Development Authority. His main challenges are lack of farming equipment, transportation problems and lack of training in dairy farming and animal husbandry. 

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo/Kiva for 30,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The income from this loan will enable him to cater to his family's needs. In the future, he hopes to expand his dairy farming and acquire high yielding dairy cows. 

He appreciates the work done by Juhudi/Kiva and looks forward to more assistance. He is asking Juhudi to include training on dairy husbandry in their program.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La señora Rosa forma parte del Banco Comunal Mujeres del Futuro, en la ciudadela las Orquídeas en la ciudad de Portoviejo. las reuniones se realizan cada quince días en casa de una de las socias.
 
La señora Rosa es madre de 4 hijos, casada desde hace 40 años, sus hijos son mayores y tienen sus propias familias. La actividad que viene realizando nuestra socia es la venta de productos de belleza como Avon y Esika, se encarga de  visitar a sus clientes en sus casas, con este negocio lleva 3 años y le va muy bien, esta muy contenta pese a que es un poco difícil tener que salir a vender, trasladándose de un lugar a otro en buses, ella no desmaya sus fuerzas  para salir adelante.

El esposo de la señora  Rosa se dedica por entero a su taller mecánico, es poco lo que se gana en el negocio pero han podido ahorrar y tienen su propia casa.  Con este nuevo crédito podrá hacerle unos arreglos que le hacen falta a su casa.

 El mayor sueño de la señora Rosa es poder comprarse un vehículo para poder trasladarse de un lugar a otro con sus ventas, ha pensado pedirle ayuda a una de sus hijas que vive en Estados Unidos para que le envié mercadería como brasieres para surtir su negocio, nuestra socia esta segura que le ira muy bien.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa belongs to the Mujeres del Futuro (Women of the Future) Communal Bank in the Las Orquideas (The Orchids) zone of Portoviejo City. They meet every 15 days in the home of one of the members. Rosa, mother to 4 children, has been married more than 40 years. Her children are grown now and have their own families. The activity she pursues is selling beauty products such as Avon and Esika, which she does by visiting clients in their homes. Rosa has been doing this for 3 years and it's going well. She is very content, though it is a little difficult having to go out to sell, traveling from one location to another in buses. But she hasn't diminished her efforts to get ahead. Rosa's husband is a full-time auto mechanic who earns little but has managed to save and they have their own home. With this new loan they will be able to make some improvements that are still lacking to their house. Rosa's biggest dream is to be able to buy a vehicle and drive from one place to another for her sales. She is considering asking one of her children who lives in the United States to send merchandise such as brassieres in order to expand her business. She is certain that this would do well.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: FOR NEEDED HOME IMPROVEMENTS

loans.name: Merna

texts.en:
Merna L. is from the munipality of Naawan, Misamis Oriental Province. She is 54 years old. Merna is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Merna owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood including fish and shrimp in the local community. Merna has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Merna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merna is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Merna's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Marcia Del Rocio

texts.es:
Marcia de 36 años, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil( zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas en disolución),  ella vende productos naturales, como medicina para las dolencias del cuerpo, y otro tipo de síntomas.

Ella vende productos naturales desde hace años atrás, con la ayuda de una amiga que le hablo para que venda productos naturales para poder mantener a sus tres hijos ya que se separo de su esposo. Poco a poco con esfuerzo ella pudo vender los productos, trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días.

Para poder construir mejor su casa y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento, piedras y arena. En el futuro quiere tener otro punto de venta de productos naturales.
texts.en:
Marcia is 36 years old and she lives in Fortín de Guayaquil (a semi-urban area, with dirty paths, and deteriorating hills). She sells natural products like medicines for body pains and other kinds of symptoms. She has sold natural products for several years, with help from the friend who told her to sell natural products to support her children since she separated from her husband. Little by little, she has be able to sell her products. She works from eight in the morning until seven in the evening every day. In order to build a better house, and provide better service to her customers, she wants to buy cement, stones, and sand with the loan. In the future she wants to have another place to sell natural products.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement, stones, and sand.

loans.name: Nabingola Dembe Group, Mubende

texts.en: J. Stephan is the leader of his lending group in Mubende. He is 35 years old, married and has 5 children, 4 of whom go to school. He also takes care of dependants. Stephan sells maize, beans and cassava from Nabingola and Kibaale in a roadside market. Stephan is committed and honest and in a month he is able to make a profit of 360,000/=. Stephan is also a farmer and he needs a loan to support his business of 10 years that has been a family venture from the very start. He needs a loan to buy more beans and maize for resale.

loans.use: to buy more beans and maize for resale.

loans.name: Hassin

texts.en:
Hassin is a married woman and has four children who are between 5 and 15 years old. One of her children is in the secondary school while the rest are still in primary school. Her husband is an agricultural officer in the district.

Hassin trades in peas, wheat, beans and soybeans. She plans to use the loan to increase her inventory of grains and vegetables so that she can meet the demands of her clients. With the help of her husband and this loan, she intends to at least buy and sell one ton of food products per month.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of grains and vegetables

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.fr:
Ferdinand I. est un homme  de 26 ans, marié, née à Gahanga district de Kicukiro province ville de Kigali, son niveau d’étude est primaire. Il a trois enfants, le plus âgée a 6 ans et son cadet a 3 ans. Ils ne vont pas encore  à l’école.
Il est employé d’une entreprise de constructions des routes comme aide maçon. Son compte d’épargne est ouvert dans Amasezerano Community Banking   depuis avril 2007, il contracte un prêt, une partie pour le finissage de maison une autre partie pour payer le minerval de petit frère. Son ambition et son souhait et que dans l’avenir et d’avoir une maison à louer et qui sera l’héritage de son fils ainé. La maison va  verser pour l’épargne éducation des enfants. Il compte aussi améliorer les conditions  de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ferdinand I. is a 26 year old man who was born in the Gahanga district of Kicukiro province, city of Kigali. He has completed elementary school. He has three children, the oldest is 6 years old and the second is 3 years old. The children do not go to school yet. Mr. I. works as a mason's aide in a roadway construction company. He has had a savings account with Amasezerano Community Banking since April 2007. He is seeking a loan, partly to finish the house and partly to pay tuition fees for his younger brother. Mr. I.'s wish and ambition is to have a rental house that will be the inheritance for his eldest son. The house's rent would generate income for the education of his children. He hopes to also improve living conditions for his family.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying tuition fees for his younger brother

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. is a married woman with a child. She is into the sale of ladies shoes and lining materials in Elmina. She sells by moving from one area to another. She has been through junior high school. Ama uses her income to help her husband with the general upkeep of the home. Ama will use this loan to purchase more ladies shoes and lining materials for sale. Ama plans on reinvesting the new profits from her expanded business back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase extra goods for sale

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: Carolina tiene 42 años, su actividad es la venta de cosméticos, tiene 2 hijos menores a su cargo, esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para  su negocio, por lo que ha deducido que son importantes, tiene más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que sale todos los días a visitar a sus clientes ya que tienen que realizar los diferentes pedidos. Ella sueña con terminar de proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda. El financiamiento es para la compra de perfumes, tratamientos, pintura de uñas, pintura de labios entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Carolina is 42 years old and works selling cosmetics. She has two children in her care. This isn't the first time that she has asked for loans for her business, because she realizes that they're important. She has worked at her business for more than four years. She goes out every day to visit her customers so she can fill all the different orders. She dreams of making improvements to her home. This loan is for the purchase of perfumes, treatments, nail polish, lipstick, and other cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: James Mutua

texts.en:
James is single and he supports his family. He was introduced to KADET by a friend who is a member of KADET. He is applying for his first loan from KADET.

James has been in the business of repairing electronic machines like computers,laboratory machines, for six years and makes good profit. James business is located in town where there are all types of people in the society and, indeed, he has many customers. With this loan he will purchase more stock of spare parts for the computers that needs to be maintained for this will improve the services he offers to his customers. James will use the profits to plough back into business to grow and have stable source of income. James believes that he is hardworking.

loans.use: To add more stock

loans.name: Silverio

texts.es:
Silverio es un hombre de negocio, hoy en día se dedica a la venta de productos básicos, siendo ya varios años en este negocio, iniciando con poco, y aumentando su actividad en el comercio con financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado.
Su esposa ha sido una ayuda siempre ya que también invierte para un mejor vivir de su familia. Dedicándose a la  venta de tortilla.
El señor Silverio quiere hacer mejora a su casa, siendo muy baja, lo cual quiere levantar un poco la pared, en la parte de enfrente y techo, lo que no había hecho antes por aumentar su inventario en granos básicos, pero que le es de importancia hacer esta construcción ya que le provoca mucho calor porque es muy bajo su techo.
Para esto comprara: bloques, arena, cemento, hierro para hacer la obra. Lo que está contento por el apoyo financiero de la institución.
texts.en:
Silverio is a businessman.  He currently sells basic foodstuffs, having been in this business for a number of years.  He started out with very little and has increased his business activity with the financing which Afodenic has given him.

His wife has always been a help since she also invests in a better life for their family.  She works selling tortillas.

Silverio wants to improve his house.  It is very low and he would like to raise the wall a little in the front part and the roof which he hadn't done before as he wanted to increase his inventory of bulk grains.  This building work is very important to him, however, because it gets very hot as a result of the low roof.

For this work he will buy blocks, sand, cement and iron.  He is very happy with the financial support given to him by the organization.

loans.use: Purchase of blocks, sand and cement in order to raise the roof of his house since it is very low down. He would like to make this improvement and thereby reduce the heat in his home

loans.name: Jose La Rosa

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el sector Muy Finca del distrito de Mórrope. Un distrito agrícola que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo

José se dedica  a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde que era más joven. Por un lado cría animales menores, especialmente ovejas, en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio. El los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente trabaja como peón agrícola en los diversos campos de cultivo de la zona.

El desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

José es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José is a 32 year old father who lives with his family in the Muy Finca sector of the District of Mórrope. This agricultural district is part of Lambayeque Province and located more than an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

José has been performing farm work since he was a young man. He raises small animals, especially sheep, in a few pens near his house. Their food consists of grains and natural grasses. When the animals reach the proper level of development, he offers them for sale to the merchants who frequently visit the area where he lives. In addition, he works as a laborer at different farms in the area.

José wants to acquire more animals and balanced feed in order to expand his business and generate additional income. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN to help him achieve his goal.

Jóse is an earnest and hardworking person. His greatest wish is to continue growing as an entrepreneur so that he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: Acquire more animals & purchase animal feed

loans.name: Patouani

texts.fr: Elle a 37 ans et est mariée. Elle a en charge 3 enfants. Elle est née à Tchitchao mais habite hedzranawoe.  Pour pouvoir  aider au foyer, elle exerce comme activité la vente d’alimentation générale. Son activité est    tellement rentable qu’elle a parfaitement remboursé plusieurs prêt  déjà. Elle cumule aussi 8 ans d’activité. Elle achète au grand marché de Lomé et expose ses différents produits à la devanture de sa maison. Elle espère  grâce à ce nouveau crédit accroitre sa marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en:
This lady is 37 years old and married with three children in her care. She was born in Tchitchao but currently lives in Hédzranawoé. 

To help support the family, she sells general food items. Her success in this activity has already enabled her to repay several loans. 

She has eight years experience in this business. She buys her stocks at the big market of Lomé and displays the merchandise in front of her house. She hopes that this new loan will help increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy general food products

loans.name: Erick Ricardo

texts.es: Erick Ricardo tiene su actividad que es una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio, vive en una zona rural pero cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Por la necesidad de tener dinero para su familia el invirtió sus ahorros en estos productos que son necesarios. Poco a poco con esfuerzo y ayuda y la buena administración de su negocio. Con el préstamo quiere comprar golosinas, refrescos, pan y detergentes para tener más surtida su venta. En el futuro quiere terminar de arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
Erick Ricardo is a grocer.  He has had this business for over four years.  He lives in a rural zone but has all basic utilities.  In order to have money for his family he invested his savings in necessary products.  Gradually with effort, support and good administration, his business grew.  

He will use the loan to buy sweets, soft drinks, bread and detergent to have a better selection of goods.  In the future he’d like to finish fixing up his house.

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Mr. Samat Nget Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty people are members of a village bank loan group located in Pump Edth Village, in Takeo Province. Mr. Samat N. was selected by the other members to be the village bank president. Each member of the group will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose, but all hope to improve their families' living standards.

Mr. Samat N. is a village chief. He is a cow middleman (a broker between farmers and wholesalers) who earns money to support his family. He is the father of two children, a farmer and a student. His wife, Mrs. Lorn Chan, is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) plot of land. She grows and sells rice to support her family. Although they try to work hard, they earn little income. So to improve their family's living conditions, Mr. Samat N. is seeking a loan to buy three piglets and pig food to start a new pig-breeding business.

loans.use: To buy three piglets and pig food

loans.name: Mohammadi

texts.ar:
محمدي في عمر 26 سنة يعمل في نقل الخضار الى الاسواق متزوج يريد ان يزيد من مدخوله وتحسين وضعه المادي والاجتماعي وخاصة انه 
في طور تامين مستقبله ما يميزه هي الدقة في العمل والالتزام يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة
الى شراء بيك اب جديد لنقل الخضار وتحسين وتوسيع رقعة العمل له يحلم دائما بتأمين العيش الجيد له ولزوجته
وعائلته وان يصبح من اصحاب العمل الخاص
texts.en: Mohammadi is 26 years old and dreams of securing a good future for his wife and family and of becoming self-employed. He is distinguished by his thoroughness and commitment in his work as a vegetable distributor. Mohammadi is now asking A. Majmoua for a loan to purchase a new pickup truck to expand his zone of distribution.

loans.use: To purchase new pickup truck for vegetable distribution business

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
From the province of Kompon Thom, Chin R., aged 27, owns and operates a handicraft business with the core activity being the sale of rattan cupboards and beds. She sells rattan cupboards and beds that her husband makes, or she orders from other weavers who live in the village. She uses her horse cart for transportation and it takes a week to sell all her products. She is a good mother to her two children who are still living under her care. 

In order to increase her income, Chin R. has applied for a loan to buy more beds for resale, and to purchase a piece of farmland that she can rent out to her neighbors for a fee. Note that Chin R. and her young child are shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more beds from neighbors for resale, and to purchase a piece of farmland that she can rent out to her neighbors for a fee

loans.name: Nget

texts.en:
Nget M. is 58 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh. Nget M. was married but her husband died years ago. She stays at home to do housework and take care of her family. Nget M. says that she depends on the income from her daughter and son-in-law who are garment factory workers, and earn a monthly salary. 

Nget M. has been repairing her old house but hasn't had the money to finish it yet. To solve this problem, Nget M. is asking for a loan of $700 from Kiva’s field partner, HKL, to be used to finish fixing her house.

loans.use: To make final repairs on her old house.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira C. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Elvira is widowed and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Elvira owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snacks & candies in the local community. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elvira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvira has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snacks. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elvira from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snacks

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 42-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and four school-aged children. He has owned a small grocery store since 2010. With his business income, he is able to satisfy the high expenses of the family in collaboration with his wife who works in a bakery. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his store’s inventory.  In the future, he expects that his business will continue to grow. It is very common in Lebanon to find small supermarkets selling perishable and non-perishable goods. As members of the communities themselves, store owners have a deep understanding of local consumer needs and can offer products that meet local demands. The strong network of community relationships are an important component of life in Lebanon, especially in smaller towns and villages.

loans.use: to increase his store’s inventory

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a 33-year-old married man with 4 children. His oldest child is only 9 years old.

Alex is a farmer. He tills his own land in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. Alex has been growing rice for more than 5 years and earns 20,000 PHP every harvest.

Alex's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. He wishes for his children to be successful someday.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia is 46 years old and has six children. She is married and two of her children are in school. Amalia is in the business of culturing oysters in the Philippines. Amalia has been in this business for 27 years now and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She requested a 13,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase bamboo and net for her oyster culture. In the future, Amalia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo and net for culturing oysters.

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is a single woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing. For the past six years, she has operated a food stall business cooking chapati, beans, peas and rice for sale at home to sell to her neighbors and passers-by. 

She faces a major challenge of high competition from other food stall operators and the seasonality in her business. Bakari dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future. With the Kshs 40,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and cooking fat oil. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Jeje May

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jeje May works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-dealing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling Avon and Natasha products. Jeje May is borrowing 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase an additional fish cooler and fish to sell for her fish-dealing business.

Jeje May has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish and a fish cooler.

loans.name: Feruza

texts.ru: Феруза проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 32 года. Замужем, имеет двоих детей. Муж находится в Российской Федерации. Сама она арендует участок земли, где выращивает овощи и сеет рис. Этим видом деятельности занимается 8 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян и топлива.
texts.en: Feruza lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 32 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is in the Russian Federation. She rents a plot of land where she grows vegetables and rice. She has been doing this work for eight years.  She is taking out a loan to buy seeds and fuel.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fuel.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married with a grown daughter. She is an entrepreneur from Melitopol who sells women’s footwear in the central marketplace of her home town. She offers a nice selection of inventory for sale in her kiosk. Natalya started this business nine years ago. Currently, she has 10,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her net profit amounts to 8,000 Grivnyas per month.
Natalya is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase seasonal footwear so that she can better present the benefits of her products and services to her customers. She always tries to offer a nice variety of stylish shoes and sandals for ladies and avoids copying the products of other market vendors. Natalya has built a good reputation for the quality of her products and support services.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal footwear.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu has been cooking for six years. She cooks food such as wakye, jollof rice, and plain rice at Abura, near nyame bekyere. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a mason. Salamatu supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more rice and beans to cook and sell. Her ambition for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more rice and beans to cook to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Marivit

texts.en:
Ma. Marivit is 36 years old and married with three children in school. Ma. Marivit works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Marivit runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Ma. Marivit has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, shampoo etc. 

In the future, Ma. Marivit would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Sop Serigne Babacar Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Babacar est créé le 14 mai 2010, il regroupe quinze femmes qui sont unies par des liens d'amitié, elles mènent diverses activités le petit commerce, l'artisanat et l'élevage.

Khady la responsable est âgée de 47 ans,mariée elle est mère de six enfants, elle mène une activité de petit commerce et a une expérience moyenne.Elle est debout tout à fait à droite sur la photo habillée en robe jaune bleu.

Elle s'approvisionne en habits, chaussures, poisson au marché central de la ville et revend sur place.

Son prêt lui servira d'acheter plus de marchandises afin de gagner beaucoup de revenus.

Elle souhaite avec ses bénéfices prendre en charge la scolarité de ses enfants et investir pour la construction d'une maison.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Serigne Babacar was created on 14 May 2010 and consists of fifteen women united by friendship. They are engaged in various activities such as small retail businesses, handicrafts, and livestock farming.

Khady, the group leader, is 47 years old, married, and has six children. She runs a small retail business and has gained some experience. She is standing all the way on the right in the photo, with the yellow and blue dress.

She gets her supplies of clothing, shoes, and fish at the central market in the city and re-sells them locally.

With her profit, she hopes to take care of her children's education and invest in building a house.

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes, and fish for resale.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto, es casado y tiene un hijo de 8 años de edad, él es agricultor, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 15 años, su padre le enseño todo el proceso de siembra y cuido del cultivo, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 3:00pm.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de abono y pesticidas, para aplicarlos al cultivo, este préstamo le ayudara a que Rigoberto tenga todo lo necesario para sus cultivos y le ayude a mejorar la producción.
El objetivo de Rigoberto es ayudar a su familia, con su hijo que tengan la oportunidad de finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is married and has one 8-year-old child. He is a farmer and has made his living at farming for 15 years. His father taught him the whole process of planting and tending crops. He works every day from 6:00am to 3:00pm.

He is requesting a loan to purchase manure and pesticides for his crops. This loan will help Rigoberto acquire everything necessary for his crops and will help him improve his production.

Rigoberto’s goal is to help his family and give his son the opportunity to finish his studies.

loans.use: to purchase manure and pesticides for his crops.

loans.name: Katambo

texts.en:
Katambo is a married man with five children:  two sons and three girls. He owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 15 years, he has operated a workshop business, selling furniture to his neighbors and passersby. Katambo also operates a retail shop, which contributes to his other source of income. He faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. His dream is to establish a real estate houses in the future.

With the KSHS 100,000, he wants to purchase a power saw, timber and diesel. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase a power saw, timber and diesel fuel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies and to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Sira Diawara Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sira  a été créé le 04/01/2010.IL est composé de 32 femmes issues du même village.Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Sokhna en position debout, habillée en écharpe jaune sur la photo et à l'extreme droite , est responsable du groupement,elle est âgée de  56 ans,elle est veuve et s'occupe de 06 enfants.
Son activité à elle est l'agriculture,elle cultive de l'arachide qu'elle revend par la suite.

Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience de ce type d'activité pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis sa jeunesse.

Son pret lui permettra de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante de semences d'arachide pour préparer son champ.

Son objectif est d'assurer la prise en charge familiale en assurant la scolarité de ses enfants et leur santé.
texts.en:
The Sira D. solidarity group was created on January 4, 2010. It consists of 32 women from the same village who mainly conduct trade.

Mrs Sokhna, standing on the far right-hand side of the photo and wearing a yellow scarf, chairs the group. She is 56 years old, widowed and has six children in her care. She is a farmer, growing and selling groundnuts. After having been in this activity since her youth she has a lot of experience. She will use her loan to buy a sufficiently large quantity of groundnut seeds for her field. Her objective is to care for her family, providing education and healthcare to her children.

loans.use: to buy groundnut seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seafood: shrimp, lobster, and different types of fish.

loans.name: Vitalis

texts.en:
Vitalis is 36 years old and married with one child, age 2. Vitalis runs a fishing equipment and spare parts business in Goderich, located in the Western Area of Sierra Leone. He has been in this business for 14 years and sells PE ropes, fishing nets, bearing rings, and connecting rods. He also earns income from his two shops in Lungi and Tombo. He says that the main challenge to his business is lacking enough capital to invest more into his shop. 

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more fishing nets, connecting rods, and PE ropes. Vitalis says that the extra income from this loan will help improve his family’s welfare. In the future, he would like to improve his shop and open additional branches.

loans.use: to purchase more fishing nets, connecting rods, and PE ropes

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es: El señor Eusebio es médico y trabaja en un centro medico particular y su esposa es empleada. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de instrumentos médicos (estetoscopios, aparato para chequear oídos, pesa), ya que quiere abrir un consultorio particular para mejorar sus ingresos y ofrecer una mejor vida a sus hijos. Vive en  alquiler en una casa  la misma queda  ubicada en la zona de Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz, es casado y tiene seis hijos. Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un crédito en IMPRO a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Eusebio is a Doctor working at a private medical center; his wife’s employed.  He needs the loan to buy medical equipment (stethoscopes, otoscopes, scales) because he wants to open his own private medical office to improve his income and provide a better life for his children.  He lives in a rented house located in the city of La Paz’s Miraflores zone.  He’s married and has six children.  This is the first time the client has obtained an IMPRO loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy medical equipment to open his own doctor's office.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba is a married woman with 2 children and both are enrolled full-time in school. Habiba operates a sunflower stand, also selling her goods from home and door-to-door. She's worked in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are neighbors and local residents. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. Habiba's other sources of income include several side businesses selling storage containers, cakes and charcoal. She describes her greatest business challenges to be thieves and accessibility during the rainy season. Her family’s highest monthly expense is food. 

Habiba will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more sunflowers and supplies for her side businesses. Habiba aspires to open a salon in the future as she also braids hair for additional income. She joined Yehu because they understand their clients.

loans.use: To purchase more sunflowers and supplies for her side businesses.

loans.name: Ammie

texts.en: Ammie is 38 years old, married and has three grown children. For the last 10 years, she and her husband have run a motorcycle transport service where they earned enough money to send all of their children to school. Her children all now have good jobs and are occasionally able to help their parents. Ammie is applying for a loan for PHP 27,000 to improve her motorcycle by buying new tires, mirrors and paint.  Her goal is to become financially independent by increasing her income.

loans.use: to buy tires, mirrors and paint for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Elpedia

texts.en:
46-year-old Elpedia makes a living through food vending. She makes rice and banana cakes, camote cue (sweet potato) that she sells to the people in her community. Her husband works as a driver and farmer. Elpedia also helps in planting rice on their land.

Elpedia has requested a loan to purchase farm fertilizers, and ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil and rice. Elpedia hopes to earn more and be able to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizers, and ingredients, such as flour, sugar, oil and rice

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is from the village of Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 41 years old. Lorna is married and has five school-aged children. 

To make a living, Lorna owns and operates a pedicab transport service. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. 

In 2009, Lorna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase spare parts for the pedicab. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the pedicab.

loans.name: Exaltacion

texts.en:
This is Exaltacion, 62, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jose and is the mother of six children, all of whom are already working. At this time she is working hard to be able to support their daily expenses.

Exaltacion has operated a rug-making business for almost six years. She mainly offers rugs from those round palm-sized ones to the much larger doormats, and other crafts that most rug-makers come up with every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney (a small bus) down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Exaltacion dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 
 
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials like fabric and thread needed in her business

loans.name: Polly

texts.en: Polly is a single woman. She is a determined woman. She operates a grocery stall where she sells kale. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her primary customers are frequent and new. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the increased price of kale when buying them. She will use the loan to purchase more kale. Her business goal is to run a bigger grocery store and a retail shop within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more kale.

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her milk-selling business. With the loan investment, she will buy a buffalo that will help her get a larger quantity of milk and sell more for higher profits. She is very active and operates her business with great dedication and hard work. She gets up early in the morning, takes the milk from the buffalo and sells to her community clients to earn an income.

She has given birth to 3 sons and 2 daughters. Her eldest son operates a paint business, while the 2nd one operates a grocery selling business. Azra is very confident that an investment will help her add an asset to her business and will also increase her income.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Azra.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN COPACABANA DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladys; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cds de música y películas, ella vende en el mercado desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local  donde pueda vender cds y películas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cds y películas al por mayor. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Señora Gladys is a member of the communal bank "Virgen Copacabana de Ollantaytambo" located in the district of Ollantaytambo, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

Gladys, aged 36, lives in a common-law marriage and is the mother of two children. She alternates her daily chores with her activity in her stall at the market, where she sells music CDs and films from 8 am to 5 pm. This business enables her to provide for her children. Her dream is to have her own premises to sell CDs and films. She applies for the loan to buy CDs and films wholesale.

Gladys is happy for the loan and promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy CDs and films wholesale.

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en:
Otgonbayar is 35 years old. She lives with her husband and 3 kids in a ger, a national Mongolian yurt, in Govisumber province of southern Mongolia. Her husband works as a butcher, and the 3 kids attend schools. 

Otgonbayar started her meat retailing business by renting a shop counter in 2009. Even though she is new to the business, she already has gained  many regular customers and trusted suppliers. Due to the approach of the Traditional festival, the need for meats is increased. In order to meet the demand, she needs financial support. She is a sharp and diligent woman who says "Our kids have come to their age of entering college. So I need to act aggressively to send my kids to college." She is requesting 564,000 MNT to buy more meat at wholesale and purchase new supplies such as dairy products.

loans.use: to buy more meat at wholesale and purchase new supplies such as dairy products

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 59 years old. She is married and blessed with 4 Children. She is a farmer and has been growing cash crops for sell for the past 20 years. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for planting in her farm and hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce for sell. She will use the anticipated profits to provide food for her family.

Her future hopes and dreams are to grow her farming business by growing more cash crops and be successful.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for planting in her farm and hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce for sell.

loans.name: Keefa

texts.en:
My name is P. Keefa and a married man with four children. I joined life in Africa in january and also work with the Invisible children's bracelet project as a sander. From the wages makes, he supports and maintain them all. I also live in rented house and the money he payS for rent is really my biggest expense and makes life very difficult. I would really dream of having a house of my own. I already have a good sized piece of land on which to build my own house. This house means total security to my children and wife ven when am gone from this world. This is why am seeking a loan in the amount of 800,000/= to help me achieve this dream. He is ready to pay this loan within 10 months. Loan use: Build family house

Loan term: 10 months

Loan payment; 80,000/=

Below is his budget:

Labour 100,000/= Cement 9 bags @ 17,000 153,000/= Nails 20,000/= Bricks 5,000 @45/= 225,000/= Timbers 12 @ 500/= 6,000/= iron sheets 18pcs @11,000 198,000/= Sand 3 trips 30,000/= Transport 3 trips 30,000/= Water 30,000/= Communication 8,000/=

Total 800,000/=

WE Team to benefit: Education

loans.use: Building a family house

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with one son. She is a Technical school graduate and worked for a while as a design engineer, but was unable to earn a stable salary. Seeking another source of income, Ludmila decided to start her own small business. She rented a kiosk and began selling household chemicals. Recently, however, Ludmila decided to make a change in the type of products she offers and start selling knitted wear and caps. She believes this new area of trade will help her generate additional profit. Ludmila is very responsible and determined. She’s been in business for 11 years and can easily guess the preferences of her clients which helps build customer loyalty. Her integrity and perseverance have helped Ludmila keep her business stable allowing her to pay back 11 loans she has received from “Nadiya Ukraine”. Presently, Ludmila has around $1,000 of working capital. Ludmila would like to get a loan for $800 to buy more clothing products. She is planning to purchase knitted wear and warm caps that always sell well in Ukraine in the winter and spring. Her first month of sales with the new products was very successful which has encouraged Ludmila to proceed with this trade and expand her clothing sales business. This loan will help Ludmila’s business continue to grow ensuring the well-being of her family and helping to provide an education for her son at a good college.

Людмила – одружена, в неї один син. Вона закінчила технікум та певний час працювала інженером-проектувальником. Однак, зарплатню вона отримувала дуже нестабільно. В пошуках інших джерел заробітку Людмила вирішила почати власну справу. Вона орендувала кіоск та почала торгівлю побутовою хімією. Нещодавно Людмила вирішила змінити тип товарів та продавати трикотажні вироби. Вона вважає, що ця нова сфера торгівлі допоможе їй отримати додатковий прибуток. Людмила – дуже відповідальна та наполеглива. Вона займається цим бізнесом вже 11 років, може легко передбачити побажання клієнтів, що допомагає їй зберегти постійних покупців. Чесність та відданість своїй справі забезпечили стабільність бізнесу Людмили та допомогли їй вчасно сплатити 11 позик, які вона отримала від „Надії України”. В товар в неї вкладено 1000 доларів. Людмила просить про позику в 800 доларів для того, щоб купити більше одягу. Вона планує закупити трикотажні вироби та теплі шапки, які завжди користуються попитом в Україні під час зимового та весняного періодів. Перший місяць продажу виявився дуже успішним. Отже, Людмила вирішила продовжувати торгівлю та розширити бізнес з продажу одягу. Ця позика сприятиме подальшому зростанню бізнесу Людмили, а також забезпечить добробут її родини та навчання сина в гарному навчальному закладі.

loans.use: To increase clothing inventory

loans.name: Talafaaiva

texts.en: Talafaaiva is 45-years old and lives in a small Samoan village.  She has seven children and runs a taro plantation in order to provide for the basic needs of her family.  The entire family helps Talafaaiva with her taro plantation.  Her husband and her children help with the brush clearing and weeding.  Talafaaiva hauls a taro crop to the local market every day to sell.  Taro is a staple of the Samoan diet, and she has no trouble finding demand for her product.  Customers even come by her home asking to buy taro.  Her family is confident that growing the taro crop is the key to raising their standard of living, and so Talafaaiva is applying for a loan to purchase time-saving equipment to that they can expand their plantation.

loans.use: Buy equipment such as bush knives, gloves, shovels

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her used clothing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a classroom  for a computer

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
8 years ago when she went to the first group meeting of TYM fund, Ms Nguyễn Thị Tuyết was a shy woman. She did not have a chance to go to school so she is illiterate, for this reason she was afraid of meetings. With the love and support from her group, she applied for and received a loan. She invested the money into raising pigs and poultry. It was a success, the business grew and grew so she was successful in securing bigger loans in later rounds. She had overcome her shyness and became an active member of TYM branch 3 in the village of Nam Viêm, Phúc Yên where she lives with her husband and 3 children. Ms Tuyết requests a loan of 575 USD to buy food and more ducks for her paddling of 60 + ducks. At 46 years old and in good health, she feels that she would be able to continue working and hopes that she would be able to qualify for more loans to expand her poultry business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Cách đây 8 năm khi lần đầu tiên đi sinh hoạt cụm tại Quỹ Tình thương, chị Nguyễn Thị Tuyết còn là một phụ nữ nhút nhát. Không có điều kiện học hành nên chị Tuyết không biết chữ, do đó chị rất ngại có mặt tại các cuộc họp đông người. Được cán bộ Quỹ Tình thương cùng chị em vận động chị đã tham gia vay vốn về đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, gà, vịt. Công việc kinh doanh ngày càng mang lại hiệu quả cao, mức vốn vay qua các vòng càng lớn, chị Tuyết dần làm quen với việc đi sinh hoạt cộng đồng và trở thành một cụm trưởng nhiệt tình của chi nhánh 3 Quỹ Tình thương. Hiện tại chị Tuyết đang sống cùng chồng và 3 người con tại xã Nam Viêm, Phúc Yên. Chị vừa làm dự án xin vay 575 USD để mua thức ăn và phát triển đàn vịt hơn 60 con của mình. Ở độ tuổi 46, chị cảm thấy mình vẫn còn nhiều sức lực để lao động sản xuất và mong muốn trong tương lai sẽ được vay mức vốn tối đa từ Quỹ để phát triển mô hình chăn nuôi của mình.

loans.use: Buy chicken-feed and more ducks

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a small entrepreneur who owns a shop selling cold drinks and snacks. She is not married and has three children aged 4,11 and 15 years. Mariam is in a battle against poverty so she is a very hard worker and this is her second loan. She is asking for a loan to buy tables and chairs and an electronic calculator. She is proposing to repay the loan in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, and they are thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

loans.use: BUY TABLES, CHAIRS AND ELECTRONIC CALCULATOR

loans.name: Resty's Group

texts.en:
Resty N. is a 30 year old married mother of 3 (11,14,and 9) who sells clothing. With her loan she will buy a motorcycle to rent to a driver (“boda-boda” taxi). With the payments from him, she will pay her loan and add stock to the store.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 29-year-old Stella L., who is married with one child, aged 5. In 2002 Stella established a beauty salon business. Stella has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a loan of $700 in order to purchase additional haircare products and hairdressing equipment.

The photo features Stella (on the far left), with a very happy customer!

loans.use: To purchase additional haircare products and hairdressing equipment.

loans.name: Yermahmad

texts.ru:
Yermahmad A. lives in the region of Khuroson. He is 50 years old, married and has five children. He is a barber by profession and owns a barber shop in his kishlak (village). He has been in this business for the past ten years. Yermahmad wants to improve the quality of his services by purchasing new equipment and appliances like a blow drier, hair trimmers, mirrors and such and that is why he needs the loan. There are no other barber shops in the kishlak and that is why his services are in such high demand among the residents. His business also helps to support for his family as Yermahmad is the sole provider. He plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Аюбов Ермахмад житель района Хуросон. Возраст 50 лет. Женат имеет 5 детей.Образование средне специальное . По профессии парикмахер.Имеет частную парикмахерскую в своем кишлаке.Занимается этим видом бизнеса около 10 лет. Хочет улучшить качество обслуживания путем приобретения новой технологии. Хочет приобрести парикмахерские наборы(фен, машинки ,зеркала идр.) Поэтому планирует получить кредит.Его парикмахерская является единственной в данном кишлаке, поэтому продаваемые им услуги пользуются спросом у населения.Кроме того его бизнес позволяет обеспечивать семью, т.к. клиент является единственным кормильцем . Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy new equipment

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is a fifty-five year old mother of three children and one grandchild.  She has operated a clothing stand in the Adehyeman market in central Kumasi for seven years.  This is her first loan through Sinapi Aba Trust.  She would like to use the proceeds of her loan to increase her inventory of clothing.  She is currently participating in Sinapi's pre-loan business training and remarked that this is the first time she has ever received any formal business training.   

She hopes that this loan will increase her standard of living by giving her more disposable income.  She has yet to register with Ghana's National Health Insurance Scheme but would like to use her planned additional income to register.

Afia is a member of the trust group Genesis.  The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral to ensure that each member repays his or her share of the loan.

Afia is pictured in the center.  To the left is Joshua, the Kiva Coordinator at Sinapi Aba Trust.  To the right is Annastasia, her loan officer.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of clothes

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 29-year-old Eliza M., who is single with one child, aged seven. She also has two other dependents, her nephews, who live with her.   Eliza established her clothing business in 2004, and now requests a loan in order to expand her range of clothing.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand her range of clothing.

loans.name: Peurn

texts.en:
Mr. Peurn P. lives in the Trapaing Lompeak Village of Cambodia, where he works as a farmer. Mr. Peurn P. is a 53-year-old married man, and he is the father of two children.
