One of his children is employed in a garment factory, while the other one assists with his father’s business. His wife, Mrs. Kong Khim (pictured on the left), is a rice farmer.

In addition to his farming operation, he is also a bed-maker in the local village. Unfortunately, in this bed-making business, Mr. Peurn P. has encountered numerous difficulties as of late because he has insufficient money to buy wood to make beds to re-sell for a profit, so he is requsting a loan for that purpose.

loans.use: To improve his bed-making operation by purchasing additional wood in order to make beds for resale.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen is a young married woman who does not as yet have any kids. She owns her own business selling plants, fertilizers, plant pots and other garden items. Her business is located in one of the neighbourhoods which houses a lot of garden nurseries of the Cabañas de Caacupé company.

Carmen adds that apart from just selling plants, she also sells jewellery like chains, bracelets and rings. With previous loans that Fundacion Paraguaya have got for her she has been able to bulk buy plants, fertilizers, seeds and accessories like hoses, bags and pots. She was also able to buy silver jewellery and other things; all this helped her to obtain an increase in her earnings and clientele.

Her main clients are businesses that resell her plants, i.e. they buy them in bulk and then sell them on to other businesses in the city. She inherited this business from her parents and she is very happy that she has this responsibility to continue with this small business that her parents left her in charge of.

She would like to expand her store and incorporate cabinets to showcase her silver jewellery so that potential clients will be more comfortable. This is why she would like a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Carmen, es una señora joven casada que no tiene hijos aún, ella es propietaria de un negocio que se dedica a la venta de plantas, abono, macetas, entre otros productos para el jardín, su negocio esta ubicado en uno de los barrios dónde es la cuna de los viveros (negocios que se dedican a la venta de plantas e insumos para jardín) en la compañía Cabañas de Caacupé.

Carmen comenta, que aparte de la venta de plantas también vende productos de platería como cadenillas, pulseras y anillos. Con los préstamos anteriores que le otorgo la Fundación Paraguaya pudo comprar gran cantidad de plantas abonos, semillas y accesorios como mangueras, bolsas, maceta, y una parte lo invirtió en la compra de joyas de platas entre otros artículos; todo esto ayudó a que ella obtenga un gran aumento de ingresos y clientes en su negocio.

Sus principales cliente son los comerciantes que vuelve a revender las plantas, es decir, compran en gran cantidad y posteriormente lo vuelven a vender en negocios de otras ciudades. El negocio lo heredó de sus padres y afirma que se siente muy satisfecha por el hecho de que tiene la responsabilidad de continuar la microempresa que sus padres le dejo a cargo.

Tiene pensado ampliar su salón e incorporar muebles para exponer sus joyas de platas y así ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes potenciales es por ello que está solicitando un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To expand the business and to buy display cabinets/ampliación del negocio y compra de muebles como exhibidores.

loans.name: Jorge Marcos

texts.pt:
Jorge Marcos J. was born in Maxixe in the province of Inhambane. He is married and the father of 2 children aged 15 and 12. Both children go to school. Besides supporting his family, he also supports a stepson and a nephew. Jorge is in his second year of college, studying social sciences. In 1982 he joined the armed forces that defended Mozambique and moved from the province of Inhambane to Nampula. He lived there for 5 years.

Jorge works for the Ministry of Defense. His workday begins at 7:30 a.m. and ends at 3:30 p.m. He receives a monthly wage of 13,400.00 MT and puts some into savings at the end of each month. He learned his profession at the military school in Nampula.

This loan of 20,000 MT is Jorge’s second. His first was for 12,000.00 MT, which he used to enlarge the living room and bedroom in his house that is still under construction. He found out about Hluvuku through friends from work. His future goal is to buy a vehicle and to build a security wall.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer.

Jorge Marcos J. é natural de Maxixe Província de Inhambane. É casado maritalmente e pai de 2 filhos. Com idade entre 15 e 12 anos de idade todos vão a escola, para alem da sua família sustenta duas pessoas que é um enteado e um sobrinho.

Jorge é estudante do segundo ano da faculdade de ciencias sociais e em 1982 mudou se da Província de Inhambane para Nampula quando ingressou na Forças Armadas de defesa de Moçambique onde viveu 5 anos.

Jorge é funcionário do ministério da defesa e tem um horário das 7:30 às 15:30h e tem um salário mensal de 13400,00mt e poupa algum no fim de cada més. Aprendeu o trabalho na escola militar em Nampula.

O empréstimo de 20.000,00MT é segundo para Jorge e o primeiro foi de 12000,00mt que usou para ampliar a sala e quarto na casa que ainda está em construção. Conheceu a Hluvuku atraves dos colegas de serviços.

Constitui seu plano para o futuro a compra de viatura e construção do muro de vedação.

loans.use: To buy materials to build family house

loans.name: Nasrullo

texts.ru:
Джалолов Насруло родился 20 сентября 1955 года, женат и у них 5 детей. Он является мастером по ремонту радио-телеаппаратуры. Свою трудовую деятельность начал в 1980 году в качестве ученика. Постепенно набирая опыт в этой деятельности, Насруло стал самостоятельно принимать заказы и ремонтировать радиоприемники.  Теперь его знают во всей округе как мастера своего дела. Любой клиент, который приходит к нему с просьбой о починке аппаратуры, уходит с улыбкой на лице. Для оказания своих услуг Насруло ездит в город Душанбе, где в фирме ООО «Голубой экран» закупает запчасти и комплектующие к аудио и видеоаппаратуре. 
Насруло мечтает расширить свой бизнес, построить собственный цех и воспитывать учеников. Узнав о программе Кива решил участвовать в ней и получить займ на сумму 4100 сомони для воплощения в реальность своей мечты.
texts.en:
Nasrullo J. was born on September 20, 1955, is married, and has 5 children. He is a specialist in radio and television equipment repair. He began working in 1980 as an apprentice. As he gradually amassed experience in this area, Nasrullo began to independently accept contracts and to repair radio receiver sets. Today he is known across the district as a master of his trade. Any client who comes to him with equipment to be fixed leaves with a smile on his face. To provide his services Nasrullo travels to the city Dushanbe to buy spare parts and accessories for audio and video equipment from the company Goluboy Ekran, LLC.

Nasrullo dreams of expending his buisness, building a private shop and mentoring apprentices. When he found out about Kiva he decided to take part and take out a loan of 4100 somoni ($1200) to bring his dreams into reality.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts

loans.name: Houn

texts.en:
Mr. Houn S., 22, and his wife, Mrs. Ret Pal, 22, live on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married for four months.

Mr. Houn has been a silk weaver for four years, a skill he learned from his sister, while Mrs. Ret has been a silk weaver for four years as well. She learned her skill from a villager. The couple sells their finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. 

Houn is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk materials for his weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Ylsa Maria

texts.es:
La señora Ylsa María, socia del Banco Comunal “La Libertad”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Bellavista, Centro Poblado Menor de La Libertad. Se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y frutas como aguajes y piñas. El negocio está ubicado en su casa en la Carretera Marginal, facilitándole las ventas la construcción de la carretera por la cantidad de trabajadores que hay en la zona, los cuales son sus clientes y también ayuda el clima caluroso de la zona. Se inicia en el negocio porque tenía la necesidad de generar sus ingresos para solventar los gastos de sus hijos, sobre todo los gastos escolares.  

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará agua mineral, gaseosas en paquetes de diferentes marcas y tamaño personal, mediano y familiar, así como aguajes en sacos y piña, para poder vender al menudeo. Estos son productos muy requeridos por sus clientes. 

Ylsa María tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su esposo y con sus 04 hijos. Es una mujer muy perseverante y responsable, con ganas de sacar adelante su negocio y a sus hijos. Más adelante desea implementar su negocio con abarrotes.
texts.en:
Ylsa María, a member of the Communal Bank "La Libertad," lives in the region of San Martín, province and district of Bellavista, the less inhabited town in La Libertad. She sells soft drinks and fruits like pineapples and palm. The business is located in her home along the highway, due to road construction the number of workers in the area facilitate sales because they have become customers. She helps these customers during times of warm weather in the area. She began the business because she needed to generate income to cover the costs of raising children, especially the cost of school fees. With the loan of S/.1000, which will be repaid within 6 months, she will buy mineral water, different brands and sizes of soft drinks, as well as bagged palms and pineapples, in order to sell at retail. These are products that are highly requested by her customers. Ylsa Mary is 36 years old, lives with her husband and their 4 children. She is a very persistent and responsible woman, pushing the success of her business and children. In the future, she would like to establish a grocery store business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase mineral water, soft drinks, and fruit.

loans.name: Natalia Eleuteria

texts.es: La Sra Natalia es muy trabajadora, hace poco tiempo que se ha divorciado de su esposo, y ahora mantiene sola a sus tres hijos y tambièn a su madre, toda la familia se dedica a la atenciòn de un pequeño restaurante que tienen, durante todo el día, trabaja mucho con el sueño de poder construir su casa propia. El crédito que solicitó servirá para la compra de insumos de cocina, asi como para la compra de arroz, fideo, papa, sal, etc. Actualmente solicita el sexto credito teniendo un historial de credito impecable.
texts.en:
Natalia is a very hard worker. A short while ago, she divorced her husband and she is currently responsible for supporting her three children and her mother. The whole family dedicates itself to running a small restaurant. All day, Natalia works in the hopes of being able to build her own house. The loan she is requesting will go towards the purchase of ingredients for the restaurant, such as rice, pasta, potatoes, salt, etc. This will be her sixth loan and she has a perfect credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of ingredients

loans.name: Nkemchob

texts.en:
Born in 1960, E. is married to Nkemchop Mathias with six children.   She is a hard working woman with six children to look after. She says being a mother of six is more difficult than being a spinster. The death of her supportive parents kept her in the cold.  She now has to start doing some of those things her parents would always do, which she took for granted,  with her husband. Challenged by these realities she has double her effort towards meeting the needs of his children. This made her to join GHAPE. 

Given a loan, she plans to expand her business and pay school fees for her children. Her community will also  benefit from her activities as she will have to provide them with necessary food items. She plans to repay the loan in 24 months.

loans.use: To purchase of corn, beans, groundnuts oil and firewood

loans.name: Kattia

texts.en:
Kattia D. Z. is a member of the Talented Women communal bank and has taken out loans to support her business over four years. She lives in the department capital, Pucallpa, in the eastern Amazon River basin region of Peru. Kattia is twenty-nine years old and single. She cooks and sells meals for a living in her own restaurant located near the regional hospital. Many of Kattia´s customers are people working or visiting families in the hospital.

Kattia is requesting a loan of 1,500 Nuevo Soles to purchase new tables, chairs, and tablecloths for her establishment. She also plans to use her Kiva Loan to buy foodstuffs with which she will prepare the meals she sells.

loans.use: to purchase new tables, chairs, and tablecloths for her establishment and foodstuffs to prepare meals

loans.name: Rosa Martbel

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Bancomunal Los Cipreses. 
Rosa es conviviente, tiene 28 años dos hijos de 4 y 6 años, quienes están en la escuela.
Rosa llegó hace dos años del norte del Perú, Piura con su esposo y dos  hijos; aquí en Lima tiene familia que la animó a entrar en el negocio de compra y venta de antigüedades. Consiguiendo un capital decidieron entrar al negocio, ahora trabaja junto con su esposo, su puesto queda en un campo ferial se llama “501”, le gusta su negocio porque las personas le cuentan cómo adquirieron sus muebles. Conoce muchas cosas, el mueble mas antiguo que ella pudo comprar para después venderlo fue de los años 40 que llegó un poco deteriorado, pero su esposo se dedica a resanar cuando llegan muebles magullados.
Desde que esta en Finca tienen para invertir y valerse por si solos, ellos viven en casa alquilada, aprendió en el Bancomunal cómo administrar su negocio.
Rosa necesita un crédito de 1200 soles, para la compra de muebles antiguos.
Rosa y su esposo tiene una meta que es tener un local mas para seguir vendiendo antigüedades, y le gustaría estudiar cosmetología.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of The Cypresses (Los Cipreses) Village Bank. She lives with her husband and is 28 years old; she has two children (4 and 6 years old) who are in elementary school. Rosa came from Piura in the north of Peru with her husband and two children; here in Lima she has family that encouraged her to start a business selling antiques. She was able to obtain enough capital to start the business which she now runs with her husband. Her antique stand is in a fairground called "501;" she likes her business especially for the stories the people tell her of how they obtained their antique furniture. The oldest piece of furniture she purchased was from the 1940s and arrived somewhat deteriorated, but her husband is able to fix furniture that arrives in bad shape. Since she became involved in Finca, they have been able to invest in their business and take care of themselves; they live in a rented home. She has learned how to better manage her business through the Village Bank. Rosa needs a $400 loan to purchase more antique furniture. Rosa and her husband have the goal of expanding to a larger locale to sell more antiques, and someday she would like to study cosmetology.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase antique furniture

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is managing a small variety store to help her husband, who is a farmer, augment their family income. Farming alone is not enough to provide for their basic needs, and all the more that they have three children to send to school. Thus, Jocelyn was very thankful to HSPFI as she was able to access a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 that she used to start her variety store business. She aspires to further increase the stocks for her variety store, and so she needs an additional capital amounting to PHP 8,000.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for her variety store

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Andokul

texts.en:
S. Andokul has dedicated himself to working in agriculture. He grows onions, watermelons, and wheat on his land. His family is made up of his wife and his three children whom he provides with the education that they deserve. It is important to point out that this gentleman has succeeded in this business and has been able to improve the conditions of his business thanks to his sacrifices and great efforts.

IMON International has been an important factor in his business's growth as it has given Andokul three loans which he has used to purchase supplies for his crops. Today he needs a loan to provide technological assistance to his crops which is why he confidently waits the approval of this loan knowing that it will be of great use in this business and that his family will greatly benefit. Andokul and his family sincerely thank you!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds, fertilizer, fuel, and lubricants

loans.name: Elizerbeth

texts.en:
Elizerbeth S., currently in the business of selling smoked fish, is requesting a loan to buy more smoked and fresh fish to sell.  Elizerbeth, a 45-year-old widow,  has three children, all attending school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay their school fees.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members

loans.use: To buy more smoked and fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: An's Group

texts.en: An T. A. D. was born in 1983. She lives with her husband and two children. Her husband is a driver. They have a monthly income of about 3,500,000 VND ($196 USD). She is asking for a loan of 1,972,000 VND ($110 USD) to buy flowers and fruits to sell. The other group member is Lan N. T., who was born in 1978. She hopes to borrow 2,204,000 VND ($124 USD) to be repaid in six months. She will use the loan to buy food for pigs and chicken.

loans.use: to buy flowers and fruits to resell

loans.name: Tsendsuren

texts.en:
Tsendsuren T. is 18 years old and lives with her brother in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Tsendsuren has a small retail business selling religious articles. The religious products are mostly of Buddhist origin. The main religion in Mongolia is Buddhism. Mongolia reclaimed its Buddhist religion after the collapse of the Soviet Union in the 1990s. Under the control of the Soviet Union, Buddhism was banned. Buddhism quickly regained its popularity in the last two decades.

Tsendsuren started her business in 2003 by selling religious products to locals. She travels to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and purchases religious articles from Gandantegchilen Monastery, the largest and most popular monastery in Ulaanbaatar. Since the start, her business capital has increased from 500,000 ($1 = 1,400 MNT) to 2,000,000 MNT. Her motto in business is an old Mongolian proverb, "If one works hard, destiny follows." She requests a loan to purchase more religious products from Ulaanbaatar.

loans.use: To purchase religious products from Ulaanbaatar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds for his farm

loans.name: Elgen

texts.en: Elgen L. is from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 24 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Elgen owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste and some variety products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Elgen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Elgen is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and to support the needs of the family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offerings

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en:
Fernanda M. G. is a 37 year-old mother of four who runs her own retail store in the town of El Seybo, Dominican Republic.  She is hoping to take out her third loan of 15,000 pesos to buy additional pants, blouses, and other men's and women's clothing for her small business.

Since becoming a client of Kiva and Esperanza International, Fernanda reports that her life has changed significantly for the better. Revenue from her clothing store provides an additional source of income to what her husband earns selling bananas, yucca, and other food products on the streets of El Seybo.  Most importantly, Fernanda's income helps support her four children (ages 17, 15, 13, and 11), the oldest of whom has had chronic health problems. Fernanda must make frequent trips to the hospital in San Pedro de Macoris, a larger town about an hour away, to care for her oldest son. 

A loan to Fernanda's business represents an investment in her entrepreneurial endeavors and in her family's well-being.  Thank you!

loans.use: Cuy clothing for retail store.

loans.name: Jennebby

texts.en:
In 1973, Jennebby P. started acquiring land that is 1 hectare in size. She is married to Generoso P. and has 10 children. From her farm, she is able to earn an income to support the education of her children. 

She would like to ask for a loan worth Php 12,000. She will use the loan to purchase farming products, such as fertilizers, and other farm necessities.

She is happy that she took part in the CEVI micro-credit program. Now, she doesn't have to worry about the capital. CEVI provides her not just credit, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase farming products such as fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор является нашим старым партнером. Ей необходимо расширить ассортимент своего товара.  Ее старший сын в этом году  поступает в Университет. Для этого она хочет за этот месяц получить от продажи хороший доход. Имея свой капитал также от продажи заплатит за обучение сына. Ее магазин находиться в центре района Явы. Среди нескольких магазинов -конкурентов ее магазин как маленький универмаг. Там она продает и продукты питания и одежду , а также моющие средства.  Кредит получает для покупки моющих  средств и женской одежды.

loans.use: расширение ассортимента

loans.name: Sixto

texts.en:
Sixto V. is from the village of Lombo, Lagonglong Misamis Oriental. She is 54 years old. Sixto is married and has 7 children. To make a living, Sixto owns and operates a 'sari-sari' (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Sixto is just starting this business.

In 2009, Sixto joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sixto is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Sixto from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Manuela Beneilde

texts.pt:
Manuel Benilde L. nasceu na cidade de maputo, tem 45 anos de idade, casada e mãe de três filhos com idades compreendidas entre 11 e 21 anos. Todos os filhos freqüentam escola. Manuela fez a formação media de docência no Instituto de Magistério Primários da Matola no ano de 1996. Vive na casa própria com seu marido e filhos, mas também envia algum dinheiro para os seus pais que vivem noutro bairro do mesmo distrito.

Cresceu na companhia dos seus progenitores na cidade de maputo e mais tarde mudaram se para boane, deixando a casa de aluguer. O seu marido faz negocio de venda de madeira que adquire na província nortenha da Zambezia (a 2.500km de Maputo). Trabalha para o estado como Professora há mais de oito anos de experiência e com salário de 4.069,00MTmais uma parte dos 10.000,00MT de aluguer da casa da família deixada na cidade de Maputo.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos e com a hluvuku vai ser o primeiro credito no valor de 15.000,00MT para compra de material de construção (cimento, areia, blocos e outros) com objectivo de continuar com a construção da casa de alvenaria. Teve informações através de amigas e colegas de serviços que já beneficiaram de empréstimos com a instituição.
Propõe se a pagar o credito sem problemas para poder a ceder a mais empréstimos com objectivo de terminar a obra. Sonha ver a casa concluída para posterior apetrecha mento.
texts.en:
Manuela Benilde L. was born in the city of Maputo. She is 45 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 11 and 21. All of her children attend school. Manuela completed studies in education in the Instituto de Magistério Primários (Institute of Elementary Education) in Matola in 1996. She lives in her own home with her husband and children. She also sends money to her parents who live in another neighborhood in the same district. She grew up with her parents in the city of Maputo and the family later the moved to Boane, renting out their house. Her husband sells wood that he acquires in the northern province of Zambezia (2,500 km from Maputo). She has been working as a teacher for the state for over 8 years and earns a salary of 4.069,000 MT plus a portion of the 10.000,00 MT from the rental of the family home in the city of Maputo. She has never had a loan with another bank. This will be her first loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 15.000,00MT for the purchase of construction materials (cement, sand, blocks, etc. ) with the goal of continuing work on the construction of her concrete block home. She learned about Hluvuku through friends and colleagues who had received loans through the organization. Manuela plans to pay the loan without any problems in order to have access to future loans to finish her home. She dreams of seeing her home finished and later equipped.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cmeent, sand, etc.)

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Zeballenzes” cumple actualmente su 1º ciclo y se formó gracias al espíritu emprendedor que las mueve para cada jornada laboral, sus integrantes ya realizan una actividad productiva, por lo que ya se desenvuelven cada una en su propia microempresa. 
Utilizan su crédito para  fomentar y variar la actividad que ya están realizando como ser: compra de insumos para la fabricación de comestibles harina, carne, aceite, huevos, condimentos compra de leche azúcar, yerba, harina, sal panificados y verduras para su posterior venta, compra venta de bebidas como refrescos , gaseosas, cervezas, vinos, compra de artículos de ocasión como ropas , guantes ,bufandas, gorras etc. redoblan esfuerzos tratando de mejorar sus ingresos y así poder ofrecer a sus hijos la posibilidad de acceder a una buena preparación académica y por consiguiente una buena opción laboral.    
Compra-venta de ropas de ocasión (camperas, pulóveres, poleras, guantes, medias, remeras, jeans, gorras, bufandas etc.), compra-venta de joyas artesanales (collares, tobilleras, anillos, aros, amuletos, etc.)  compra-venta de  leche, compra-venta de azúcar, compra-venta de verduras y frutas, compra-venta de vino, aceite, arroz, fabricación y venta de comestibles artesanales como ser: butifarra, morcilla, tortillas, empanadas, croquetas, etc.

loans.use: compra de mercaderias varias como harina, carne, aceite, huevos, condimentos compra de leche azúcar, yerba, harina, sal panificados y verduras al igual que ropas y calzados.

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Yin P., 36, is a professional craftswoman from Takeo province. Since 2005, she has been using beads and other materials to make flowers on women's clothing. Typically, she makes $3 USD each day. The decorative dresses Yin makes are a kind of Khmer traditional dress worn during Water Festival, P’chum Ben or Khmer New Year. It takes around seven to ten days to complete each dress and each one is expensive. Most people prefer this type of dress to be handmade rather than machine-made. Yin knows how to decorate as she learned from her mother and started in the business before she was married. Her husband, pictured here, is a worker who is able to make a living of $1 USD per day. Yin P. is asking for a loan of $500 USD to purchase silk and beads.

loans.use: To purchase silk and beads

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Our client is Margarita.  She is part of a communal bank consisting of fifteen neighbors in Ccorao, a town thirty minutes from Cusco.  The group is called Reynita de Belen de Ccorao, named after a virgin of Peru. She is from Yerna but lives in Cusco. She is 30 years old and is married with a 2 ½ year-old son.

This is her second loan from Arariwa.  She prepares refreshments for students in first and second grade. She sells approximately 100 plates per day for 2 soles each. She earns about 50 soles a day, which is the equivalent of $17.50.  She will use this loan to buy ingredients for her student meals.

Margarita appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to make the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy ingredients (oil, arroz, etc) for her student meals

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es:
Agustín es un hombre muy jovial de 44 años, es padre soltero y tiene 4 hijos. Cuando aun vivía con la madre de sus hijos sembraba en la chacra de sus suegros, pero desde hace tres años que vive solo y viene sembrando sus plantas de café y plátanos en chacras alquiladas, donde paga entre 600 a 800 soles por año. 
Con tranquilidad y muchas esperanzas, Agustín cultiva sus chacras, pero no por ello, olvida su responsabilidad como padre. Por el momento piensa sacarle provecho a las chacras que alquila, por ello le presta toda su dedicación a sus cultivos, sólo así está seguro de obtener mayores ganancias y con ellas comprarse sus propias chacras. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y ya se ha hecho rápidamente amigo con los demás integrantes de su banco comunal, asimismo hace compromisos de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y de asistir a las reuniones del cada mes. El dinero que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Agustín is a very cheerful 44-year-old man. He is a single father of 4 children. When he still lived with the mother of his children, he had a farm on his in-laws' land. For 3 years, he has lived alone and grows coffee and plantains on rented land, where he pays between 600 and 800 PEN. Calmly and with a lot of hope, Agustín farms his land, but he doesn't forget his responsibilities as a father. At the moment he plans to benefit from the land that he rents, and he has dedicated everything to his crops. This is the only way he will be sure to obtain better profits and that he will be able to buy his own land. This is his first credit with Microfinanzas Prisma, and he has made friends very quickly with the other members of his communal bank. He promises to make his payments on time and to attend the bank's monthly meetings. He plans to invest the money that he is requesting in the purchase of chemical fertilizers for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Shehu

texts.en: Shehu is 25 years old and married without children. He hopes to get married very soon. He sells clothes to make a living, and hopes to own a boutique in the future. He sells for long hours to enable him to meet the needs and necessities of his aged parents. He hopes for a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more clothes to sell. This is the high season for sales and he hopes to meet the demands of his customers. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.en:
Prudencia G. is from the village of Manolo, Fortich Bukidnon. She is 47 years old. Prudencia is widowed and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Prudencia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Prudencia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Prudencia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Prudencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Prudencia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Prudencia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily Cervas is 38 years old and a corn farmer. She has four children. Her eldest is 18 years old and was not able to go to college because the family has financial difficulties. Enrolling her child in college was postponed because of their limited budget.

Emily would like to expand her business. She is applying for a loan of 8,000 PHP from the Kiva field partner, Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies, and this will augment her income toward enabling her to send her children to school.

loans.use: farm supplies

loans.name: Marta Maria

texts.es: En el municipio de Somotillo la señora Marta M. imparte clases en la escuela Rubén Darío ella empezó a trabajar con Ceprodel siempre para la mejora de su casa iniciando con ahorros y el aporte de su esposo. Hoy en día solicita un nuevo crédito el cual será invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción como arena, piedrín, cemento entre otros, con el propósito de continuar mejorando su vivienda y así garantizarle un techo digno a su familia.
texts.en:
In the town of Somotillo, Sra. Marta M. teaches classes at the Rubén Darío School. She began working with CEPRODEL in order to make improvements to her home, begin saving money, and help her husband in providing financial support. Today she is requesting a new loan in order to purchase construction materials such as sand, gravel, cement, and other items. She plans to continue making improvements to her home by providing a proper roof for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: N. Betty is a 42-year-old businesswoman who has owned and run a salon for the last ten years. She is requesting a loan to purchase salon items such as hair chemicals, hair food, hair relaxers, combs, and so forth to boost her salon. Her hope is to attract more customers into her business so that she can generate more profit to boost and expand her salon. Her future plan is to see her business develop to a very high level.

loans.use: To purchase salon items such as hair chemicals, hair food, hair relaxers, combs, etc.

loans.name: Valentina Da Conceicao

texts.pt:
Valentina Da Conceição D. M. nasceu na cidaD. D. Maputo, sul D. moçambique tem 44 anos D. idaD., separada e mãe D. 3 filhos D. 21, 17, e 14 anos D. idaD., todos vão a escola. Fez somente 8ª classe não continuou devido a gravidez precoce e não lhe foi permitida o regresso a escola pelo marido depois do parto. Vive na casa própria com a sua sobrinha porque os filhos ficaram com o pai após a separação, sustenta sua mãe que não vive com ela enviando dinheiro e bens alimentícios.
Saiu da cidaD. da Matola para Boane a 7 anos depois da separação, continua vivendo neste distrito com a sua sobrinha. Tem um negócio próprio a mais D. 7 anos, faz cerca D. 12 horas D. trabalho por dia, venD. mais cerveja e refrescos e não possui nenhum empregado. Aprendeu esta actividaD. com as suas amigas que viviam no mesmo bairro da cidaD. da Matola. Consegue um rendimento D. cerca D. 5.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas D. casa e ainda poupa algum em casa para responder a eventual despesas que possam surgir.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor D. 15.000.00mt com o qual pretenD. comprar produtos (refrescos, cerveja, vinho e outros) para aumentar a quantidaD. da sua mercadoria. Os empréstimos anteriores foram D. 9.000.00mt, 14.000.00mt e 10.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividaD..
 No futuro gostaria D. solicitar mais empréstimos para construir um estabelecimento comercial fixo e D. material convencional para satisfazer a demanda da sua clientela.
texts.en:
Valentina Da Conceição D. M. was born in the city of Maputo, in southern Mozambique. She is 44 years old, is separated from her husband and is the mother of 3 children aged 21, 17, and 14. They all attend school. Valentina only completed eighth graD.; she did not continue because of an early pregnancy. Her husband did not allow her to return to school after the baby's birth. She lives in her own house with her niece because her children stayed with their father after their separation. She supports her mother, who does not live with her, by sending her money and food. She left the city of Matola to go to Boane seven years after the separation. She is still living in this district with her niece. She has had her own business for more than seven years. She works about 12 hours per day selling beer and soft drinks, and she has no employees. Valentina learned this job with some friends who lived in her neighborhood in Matola. She makes about 5,000 MZN per month, which she uses for household expenses while saving some money at home for unexpected expenses. Valentina has never taken out loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client here. This is Valentina's fourth loan. She is asking for 15,000 MZN, which she will use to buy products (soft drinks, beer, wine and other products) to increase her inventory. The other loans were for 9,000 MZN, 1,000 MZN, and 10,000 MZN. The other loans were used for the same purpose. In the future, she would like to ask for more loans in order to build a shop.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of beverages

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 21-year-old single man living with his parents. In 2008, he decided to open a small mini-market in his town after seeing a need for such services in the region. His mini-market is situated in a busy area, so he has been able, during this short period, to have a growing number of customers pass by his shop and buy all types of food products. 

Today, Hussein is requesting to borrow US$ 1,000 to increase his purchases of such items as food products, soft drinks, juices etc. to increase his sales and make a good income for his family.

loans.use: increase his inventory

loans.name: Waly Daan 3 Group

texts.fr: Waly  Daan 3 est un groupe de 6 femmes domiciliées  au quartier Noflaye  a Bambilor et qui évoluent dans le secteur du commerce depuis plus d’un an. Pour ne pas rester inactives ces femmes ont choisi de s’occuper en vendant des draps, tissus, de l’huile de palme, des parfums, des œufs et du miel. Cette activité les aide a subvenir a leurs besoins quotidiens. Elles sollicitent un crédit de 600 000 frs destine a l’achat de produits commercialisés  en vue de renforcer leurs activités. L’objectif vise par ce groupe est d’accroitre l’offre et  par conséquent  mieux développer la clientèle. Le femme dont le visage n'est pas visible n'est pas membre du groupe et c'est pour ca qu'on a couvré son visage.
texts.en:
Waly Dann 3 is a group of six women who live in the Noflaye district of Bambilor. They have been involved in the business sector for more than a year. To remain active these women have chosen to sell sheets, fabrics, palm oil, perfume, eggs and honey. This work helps them to meet their daily needs. They are requesting a credit of 600,000FRS to buy merchandise in order to strengthen their business. The goal of this group is to increase their supplies, which will allow them to further develop their client base. The woman whose face is covered is not a member of the group, which is why her face was covered up.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to build capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase rice, wheat flour, and maize flour

loans.name: Pilipina

texts.en:
Pilipina G. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 55 years old. Pilipina is single. To make a living, Pilipina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells both food & daily use products in the local community. Pilipina has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Pilipina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Pilipina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Pilipina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Liliana Isabel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Umiña se reúne en la localidad de Manta, uno de los puertos más importantes del Ecuador y situado a orillas del Pacifico, al visitar este banco comunal conocimos la historia de la señora Liliana es socia  desde hace 8 ciclos y tiene buenas experiencias.

Es una mujer de múltiples ocupaciones nos comenzó  contando que tiene una cevicheria en su domicilio desde hace 4 años que atiende únicamente los sábados y domingos, se le ha facilitado este negocio ya que el esposo trabaja en el sector pesquero de Manta y además vende por libra el pescado fileteado, los otros días los dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y cuidado personal  como los son  Avon y ropa por catalogo con el crédito ella se ayuda para comprar al contado lo que los clientes le encargan y así ella poder dejarles más tiempo de pagar.

La señora Liliana con este nuevo crédito invertirá en la cevicheria, comprar bebidas y pescado y unas cuantas cosas útiles para el negocio. 

Nos comentaba que a pesar de tener mucha competencia por el lugar los clientes le buscan por su sazón, cuenta con el apoyo del esposo,
Nuestra socia tiene 13 años de casada a procreado 4 hijos, está muy agradecida con la Fundación por la oportunidad que le brinda con los créditos.
A lo largo de estos ciclos que lleva en el banco comunal ha podido mejorar su condición de vida y de su negocio ha podido comprarse un congelador que lo ha podido terminar de cancelar con los créditos obtenidos.
texts.en:
The Umiña Community Bank is located in the city of Manta, one of the most important port cities in Pacific shores of Equator. When visiting this community bank, we heard the story of Liliana, a partner for 8 terms that has had a great experience in this process. She is a very busy woman who started telling us that she has owned a cevicheria (raw fish store) for 4 years ran at home on weekends. This business was and easy call for her because her husband works in the fish industry in Manta. She also sells fish in fillets by the pound. She sells Avon beauty and personal care products and clothes by catalog the rest of the week. She uses the loans to buy in cash the products her customers order, and therefore allow them some time to pay her back. Liliana will invest this new loan in her cevicheria to purchase drinks and fish and other items useful to her business. She has her husband’s full support. She also told us that in spite of the competition, her customers come to her for her marinates. This partner has been married for 13 years and she has 4 children. She is very thankful with the Foundation for the opportunity they give her every time she gets a loan. Throughout the different payment terms with this community bank, she was able to improve her living conditions and her business. She was able to purchase a freezers, which she finished paying using the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase drinks, fish and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es: Néstor tiene 67 años, vive en su propia casa con sus dos hijos mayores, quienes tiene su propia familia, es por eso que Néstor de velar por si mismo. Su fuente de ingreso económico es una tienda, negocio que lleva por más de dos años, en donde pone todo su esfuerzo y dedicación para salir adelante. Es así que todas las mañanas abre su establecimiento y termina alrededor de las 9 o 10 de la noche. Pues la zona en la que vive solo existen dos tiendas una de las cuales es la de Néstor, siendo muy visitado por la clientela. En ocasiones la ayuda su hija cuando él tiene que ir a la ciudad a conseguir más mercadería para abastecer su negocio, asimismo su hijo ha decidido apoyarlo comprando  a su negocio comprándole una refrigeradora para que pueda conservar sus alimentos y en el verano, ofrecer bebidas heladas. Por tal motivo Néstor se siente muy contento porque cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos, lo cual le da las esperanzas de salir adelante al lado de su familia. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP prometiendo ser muy puntual en este ciclo como lo fue en el anterior. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería y así poder abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Néstor is 67 and lives in his own home with two adult children, who have their own families. Néstor supports himself by running a small store, a business that he has maintained for two years with great effort and dedication. Every morning he opens the store and keeps it open until 9 or 10:00 at night. In his neighborhood, there are only two stores (one of which is Néstor's), so the business is well-visited by local residents. At times his daughter helps out when he has to bring inventory from the city, and his son has assisted him in purchasing a refrigerator to keep food items and cold drinks fresh. Nestor is very thankful to his family for their support. This is his 2nd small loan from MFP and he intends to repay it punctually as was the case in the prior loan. With these funds, he plans to buy more product inventory to better stock his store.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Cassetta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy product inventory for store

loans.name: Hin

texts.en: Mrs. Hin P., age 35, has three children, all of whom are still young. She was married for a year, but divorced her husband. Presently, P. works as a sewing laborer in the garment industry and receives a formal salary to feed her children. P. has requested a loan to buy a small plot of farmland where she will plant rice crops for family to eat. The loan she pursues will help support P. and her family.

loans.use: To buy a small plot of farmland.

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.en:
52-year-old Saturnino D. is from the town of Guitas. He is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Saturnino owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Saturnino has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Saturnino joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Saturnino has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Saturnino is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Saturnino from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children's school fees and improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, the organization has numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients, but also savings, insurance, and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame P. sells soap, washing powder, toothpaste and other items at Abura by travelling from one house to another.

Maame has been through senior high education. She is married and has a child. Her husband is a plumber and she supports her husband in providing the basic needs of the family.

Maame has been in this trade for two years. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to sell. She anticipates using the new profits from her business to save to buy a shop for her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Sainte Jeanne D'arc Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SAINTE THÉRÈSE fait partie du Banc Villageois des femmes Catholiques de la Paroisse de LOUGA. Il est créé depuis trois ans. Il est composé de 12 femmes toutes issues de la même communauté ecclésiale de base. Elles sont très engagées dans les activités de la Paroisse.
Madame Élisabeth S., à droite de la photo est la présidente du groupe. Elle est âgée de 40ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois depuis son inauguration à l’instar de ses camarades
Elle fait un petit commerce de produits halieutiques, d’huile de palme et de jus de citron. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 5ans.
Son lui permettra d’acheter des poissons séchés et/ou fumés, des huitres séchées, de l’huile de palme et du jus de citron.
Son objectif est de renforcer son activité. Elle prend l’entière charge de la nourriture, la santé et le payement de la scolarité de ses enfants
texts.en:
The solidarity group, Saint Therese, is part of the Village Bank of the Catholic women of the Louga Parish. It was created three years ago. It is made up of 12 women all coming from the same basic church community. They are very involved in the activities of the parish. Mrs. Élisabeth S., to the right of the photo, is the president of the group. She is 40 years old. She is widowed and the mother of 4 children. She has been a member of the Village Bank since its opening, following the example of her friends. She runs a small shop of fishing products, palm oil and lemon juice. She has run this business for more than 5 years. Her loan will allow her to buy dried and/or smoked fish, dried oysters, palm oil and lemon juice. Her goal is to strengthen her business. She is fully in charge of the food, health and school payments of her children.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy palm oil and lemon juice

loans.name: Andrea Concepcion

texts.es: Andrea De La Concepción tiene 47 años, su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de tortillas. Hace más de 23 años, que tiene este negocio por lo que su esposo no tenía trabajo una fuente de ingresos necesarias para su hogar, esto fue lo que la motivo a salir adelante con su pequeño medio de vida siempre se ha preocupado por su hijo para que pueda estudiar y proporcionarle lo más necesario. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima como cal, maíz, leña y bolsas. Sueña con mejorar su vivienda e incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Andrea de la Concepción is 47 years old. She makes and sells tortillas. She has owned this business for more than 23 years. Her husband doesn’t have a job, so this business is her family’s only source of income. As a result, she is motivated to go forward with her business. She has always concerned for her son, and she wants him to continue in school and will support him more if necessary. She will use this loan to buy raw materials, such as lime, corn, firewood, and bags. She dreams of improving her home and growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raw materials to make tortillas

loans.name: Patrique

texts.en:
Patrique is 28 years old and single. He is commonly known for selling spare parts.  He has been in this business for about two years and his business hours are from 8 am to 8 pm every day.

Patrique would like to expand his business by purchasing more spare parts to sell.  To this end, he needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With these additional spare parts for sale, Patrique will hopefully earn more profits and these profits will be used to create some other sources of income for better financial stability in the future.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 36 year-old married man living in Bint Jbeil with his wife and five children. Hussein has owned a floor tile factory since 1999. Hussein wants to secure his family's way of living. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua so he can buy a generator to provide his factory with the necessary electricity, because electricity is a major problem in his region. This new machine will provide him with the necessary electricity, which will improve his work and increase his production. 

Hussein is ready for any additional business that can improve his living conditions. His clients are his neighbors, villagers, and neighboring villages.

loans.use: To buy a generator

loans.name: Carmen Cecilia

texts.es:
Carmen T. es una mujer muy emprendedora que le gusta el negocio, trabaja la línea D. muñequería y también venD. mercancía variada en la ciudad D. Montería donD. viaja con mucha frecuencia. Ella es viuda y tiene 5 hijos  en las edades D. 36 a 42 años. 
En la actualidad solicita su credickiva que invertirá en la compra D. materias primas para fabricar muñecas, como telas, rostros hilos y también quiere comprar mercancía como ropa para vestir elegante a sus clientes el fin D. año en la ciudad D. Montería lugar donD. venderá estas mercancías y comprará derivados lácteos como crema D. leche, mantequilla, suero, queso y bollos limpios, para venderlo en la ciudad D. Cartagena.
Inicialmente vendía mercancías a través D. catálogos, pero   gradualmente le agregó ropa traída D. la ciudad D. Medellín, donD. hay muy buenas confecciones, así mismo fue adicionando todo lo que los clientes le pedían como prendas D. oro, calzado fue  como conoció todos los pueblos D. la sabana D. Córdoba y viajó por toda Colombia, comprando y vendiendo mercancía y aprendiendo en cada lugar. Este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el anterior logró aumentar su capital D. trabajo y con esta organización se siente muy agradecida porque ella dice que “la poyó mejor que un banco” Su sueño es mejorar la calidad D. sus productos D. muñequería y tener algún día un restaurante  porque le encanta el tema D. la comida.
texts.en:
Carmen T. is an enterprising woman and she loves commerce. She works sells toys and she also sells other various types of merchandise in the city of Monteria. She travels there with frequency. She is a widow and she has 5 children between the ages of 36 and 42. She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of materials to make her dolls, such as fabrics, faces and threads, as well as to purchase merchandise such as clothing to ready her clients for the end of year holidays. She will make her sales in the city of Monteria but there she will also purchase milk products such as cream, butter, whey, cheese, and white corn cakes to resell in the city of Cartagena. She started out selling her merchandise through a catalogue but gradually she started selling clothing imported from the city of Medellin where the quality of clothing is excellent. She started adding more items to sell based on customers' requests, including gold jewelry. But it was though her shoe sales that she became known in all the villages in the Cordoba region and throughout all of Columbia. She purchased merchandise in each place she visited. This is her second loan through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. With the previous loan she supplemented her working capital and she is appreciative of the support, indicating that it was better than going to a bank. Her dream is to improve the quality of her dolls and to one day have a restaurant because she loves to cook.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to make dools and to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Paul Wambua

texts.en:
Paul is married and supports three children.

Paul was introduced to KADET through a credit officer. He is on his first loan and has not joined any other MFIs yet. Paul has been in the hotel and general store business for eight years.  With the loan he will add stock in the hotel, buying more tables and seats, and re-stock the general shop.

Paul's business is located in a busy open air market. The population is large so there are many customers. With the extra profits from this loan, Paul will open a restaurant and build a makuti garden.  He hopes to open a big hotel as he believes he is hardworking and ambitious.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur REVIEW PAUL  from  Kenya

loans.use: To add stock for the hotel (e.g. tables) and more stock for the general store

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan José es un señor de 55 años de edad, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de Usulután, donde vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos de 24, 23 y 21 años de edad todos trabajan y colaboran con los gastos del hogar, Don Juan se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura trabajo que por años a realizado con la ayuda de sus hermanos quienes antes que él ya desarrollaban actividades agrícolas y ganaderas. Hoy don Juan José solicita un préstamo pues le hace falta recursos económicos para comprar los materiales agrícolas y empezar la siembra, además de invertir también en compra de más ganado, este préstamo le permitirá contar con las herramientas necesarias para las labores agrícolas y aumentar el número de ganado.
Él sueña con atender más ganado para el comercio, seguir con las labores agrícolas y con el fruto de este trabajo poder dar a su familia el bienestar que necesitan.
texts.en:
Juan José is 55 years old and lives in San Rafael Oriente, department of Usulutan, where he lives with his wife and three children, ages 24, 23, and 21.  They all work and collaborate with household expenses.  Don Juan has worked in livestock and agriculture for years with the help of his brothers, who developed agricultural and farming activities before him.  Today, Don Juan José is applying for a loan because he needs funds to purchase agricultural materials and start planting.  In addition to investing in buying more cattle, this loan will allow him to have the tools necessary for farming.

He dreams of bringing more cattle to trade and continuing farming so that he will be able to give his family the comfort they need.

loans.use: To buy cattle and fertilizer to grow corn.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Nazario

texts.es:
Nazario is thirty-seven years old.  He lives along with his wife and three children in a home in which they own.  Their home is located in the Valle de los Incas in the district of Tambogrande in the Province of Piura.  It is a lovely region with a large number of small farms of fruit trees and animal raising.

Nazario is owner of a 1.75 hectare property on which he raises mango and limes.  His wife is the owner of a 1 hectare property which is also used for farming.  Nazario works the fields and his wife cares for a number of animals near their home.  The have a number of sheep and two cows.

This is Nazario’s first loan from Edpyme Alternativa.  He plans to use the funds to purchase additional fertilizer for his farm and additional feed for the animals.  He dreams of expanding the family’s herd over time and purchasing additional land.  He hopes to be able to provide for his children education and provide them with more opportunities than he and his wife have had.
texts.en:
Nazario is thirty-seven years old.  He lives along with his wife and three children in a home in which they own.  Their home is located in the Valle de los Incas in the district of Tambogrande in the Province of Piura.  It is a lovely region with a large number of small farms of fruit trees and animal raising.

Nazario is owner of a 1.75 hectare property on which he raises mango and limes.  His wife is the owner of a 1 hectare property which is also used for farming.  Nazario works the fields and his wife cares for a number of animals near their home.  The have a number of sheep and two cows.

This is Nazario’s first loan from Edpyme Alternativa.  He plans to use the funds to purchase additional fertilizer for his farm and additional feed for the animals.  He dreams of expanding the family’s herd over time and purchasing additional land.  He hopes to be able to provide for his children education and provide them with more opportunities than he and his wife have had.

loans.use: Purchase additional fertilizer for his farm and additional feed for the animals

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladis; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ropa para niños, ella vende chompas, pantalones, polos y blusas, ella tiene un pequeño puesto en un centro comercial llamado el molino, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería de ropa.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This communal bank member belongs to “Las Leonas de San Jeronimo” communal bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, which is part of the Cusco province in the Cusco department.  Gladis is 30 years old, lives with her partner and has one child.  

Gladis alternates between her daily activities and her business of buying and selling children’s clothes.  She sells jackets, pants, polo shirts and blouses.  She has a small stand in a commercial center called El Molina.  She works from 8am until 7pm.  Gladis wants to improve her clothing sales business.  She is asking for a loan for the purchase of more merchandise.

She is grateful to those that will become part of her dream in this way.  She promises to fulfill her payments on time.

loans.use: For the purchase of clothing merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Karina Victoria

texts.es:
Karina de 29 años, se dedico a trabajar desde muy joven para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de sus 5 hijos de 14, 10, 8, 6, 4 años de edad. Debido a que a los 15 años tuvo su primer hijo tuvo que ir a vivir con su esposo a una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso en una casa de caña y que solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico ya que el agua la vende por barril a $ 1.50. 

Trabaja sola recorriendo las calles y casa de sus conocidos vendiendo los perfumes para hombres y mujeres que comprar a un bajo costo. Una de las formas de trabajar es que los perfumes lo hacen por pedido y ella los vende a crédito para tener una mejor ganancia. 

Su casa es de caña y el piso es de tierra por eso ella quiere darle una mejor vida a sus hijos y quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento, bloques, arena para construir mejor su casa. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su cas ay tener un negocio.
texts.en:
Karina, 29, has worked since she was very young in order to help her husband with the expenses of raising their five children, who are 14, 10, 8, 6, and 4. Because she had her first child when she was 15, she had to go and live with her husband in an outlying area of Guayaquil called Paraíso in a wooden shack, where there is only basic electricity and where water is sold for $1.50 a barrel. 

She works by herself in the streets and houses of her acquaintances selling women and men's fragrances, which she buys cheaply.  One way in which she works is by taking orders for the perfumes and selling them on credit in order to increase her sales.

Her house is made of reeds, and the floor is earthen, but she wants to give her children a better life and will use the loan to buy cement, breeze blocks, and sand so as to build a better house.  She hopes in future to finish building her house and to have her own business.

loans.use: cement, breeze blocks, sand

loans.name: María Jessica

texts.es:
María Jessica es una madre de familia que tiene 29 años de edad y que reside junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el sector Fundo Los Ayala, uno de los anexos que conforma el caserío Punto Nueve, una zona agrícola que pertenece al distrito de Mochumí, provincia de Lambayeque, se encuentra ubicada a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar la crianza y venta de animales menores. Ella cría pavos, patos, cerdos y gallinas en la parte posterior de su domicilio, los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta en el mercado Moshoqueque de la ciudad de Chiclayo. El negocio le permite ayudar a su esposo, que es agricultor, con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

María desea adquirir alimento para sus animales, su objetivo es verlos desarrollarse rápidamente para obtener mayores ingresos por sus ventas. Para lograrlo se ha propuesto solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Maria Jessica is 29 years old and the mother of a family. She lives with her husband and their three children in the Fundo Los Ayala sector, one of the annexes that forms the village of Punto Nueve, an agricultural zone that belongs to the district of Mochumi in the province of Lambayeque. It is located half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She raises and sells small animals. She raises turkeys, ducks, pigs, and hens in the area behind her residence. She feeds them natural grains and foods. When they have reached a good level of development, she offers them for sale in the Moshoqueque market in the city of Chiclayo. This business allows her to help her husband, who is a farmer, in sustaining the family economy.

Maria wants to buy food for her animals. Her goal is to see them develop rapidly so that she can obtain better income from her sales. To accomplish this, she decided to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 PEN.

loans.use: Buy feed for her animals.

loans.name: Hortencia Simona

texts.es: La Sra. Hortencia es una cliente que recién esta trabajando con emprender en el poco tiempo que trabaja con nosotros demostró ser una cliente puntual y responsable en sus pagos, la Sra.  Hortencia vive en la casa de sus padres, tienen dos hijos pequeños una de diez años y un pequeño de año y medio, trabaja en las casas de la zona cocinando y lavando ropa es así como ayuda  en el mantenimiento de  la casa, Su esposo el Sr. Ricardo  es transportista desde hace dos años don Ricardo también trabaja además como ayudante de construcción con su primo,  La Sra. Hortencia y el Sr. Ricardo trabajan desde la mañana y están incursionando en la venta de poleras en Copacabana, el crédito que están solicitando es para realizar el mantenimiento de la movilidad y compra de llantas ya que esta presentando algunas fallas y esto no le permite realizar un mejor trabajo, son una pareja muy unida y muy trabajadora y están agradecidos con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Hortencia is a new client of Emprender.  During the short time that she has been working with us, she has shown herself to be a client who is punctual and responsible in making her loan repayments.

Hortencia lives in her parents' home.  She has two young children: a 10 year old and an 18 month old.  She works in local houses cooking and washing clothes.  This is how she helps support her household.  Her husband, Ricardo, has been a driver for two years.  He also works as an assistant builder with his cousin.

Hortencia and Ricardo work from early in the morning and they are starting to break into the market selling t-shirts in Copacabana.  The loan she is requesting will be used to pay for maintenance work on her husband's vehicle and to buy spare tires since the vehicle has some mechanical problems which prevents him from doing a better job.  Hortencia and Ricardo are a very close couple and very hard working.  They are grateful to the institution for the support that they have been offered.

loans.use: To buy new tires and to pay for maintenance work on her husband's vehicle

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn C. is from the village of Binakalan, Gingoog City. She is 23 years old and married. To make a living, Ailyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. She is also making and selling homemade sausage or longganisa. Ailyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ailyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ailyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Ailyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Ailyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Phoeurk

texts.en: Mrs. Phoeurk N. who was born in 1964 is living in Krang Touch village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Soeun Sin, are farmers who own 3-hectare plot of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family and he owns a rice mill in the local village. They try to work hard, but their income is meager. So Mrs. Phoeurk N. is asking for a loan to buy ducks and duck feed for breeding to start a new business. Through this activity, they support two children, one of whom is a laborer, but the other is attending local public school.

loans.use: To buy ducks and duck feed  to start a new business

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa M. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 47 years old. Elisa is married and has nine adult children. 

To make a living, Elisa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and coconut wines. Elisa has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Elisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Elisa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Elisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 22-year-old Lebanese single woman. She lives with her parents and five siblings. She started her career at a very young age. She has been working for severA. years as a beautician. She also works as a hairdresser, receiving clients at her home. Her work is very important because she helps her father with the family expenses.

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new hairdressing tools and beauty products. In the future, she is planning to open a formA. beauty salon in order to expand her business level.

loans.use: to purchase new hairdressing tools and beauty products.

loans.name: Hourt

texts.en:
Hourt P. resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. P. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of about USD 2 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 40 on food and USD 80 on other necessary expenses.
