P. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Lina works hard to support her family. She has a home products sales business in the Philippines. Lina is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional home product items for her business.

Lina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional home products to sell

loans.name: Adolat

texts.en:
S. Adolat is married and has one child. She lives in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. Her son (who is in this photo) helps her in this business. She has two working places in the market of Shohmansur and that’s why she needs a wider assortment of more goods. Two years ago, during a fire in the market, her goods were burned and she left without capital. With the help of IMON International, she started her business again. Now she plans to purchase a new assortment of goods and for this she has requested a loan of 3,000 USD. 
   
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy women’s underwear and children’s clothes for sale

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna B., 51, is married and has five children, two of whom are in school. 

Lorna has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Lorna requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her tailoring business.

 In the future, Lorna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Cerelina

texts.en:
Cerelina, age 53, earns a living by preparing and selling cooked meals in the village of Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She buys and prepares a variety of viands for different meals such as afritada, pancit bihon, and fried chicken. Cerelina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. She and her husband have two school-aged children.

In 2007, Cerelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Cerelina has successfully repaid her most recent previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional ingredients and was employed as working capital. Cerelina is now requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to prepare her meals, such as meat, spices, and vegetables. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Cerelina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to prepare her meals, such as meat, spices, and vegetables

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es: Florencia, de 31 años de edad, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri, esta casada con Filomeno de 37 años, fruto de  esa relación tiene 03 hijos y juntos viven en su propia casa situado en la comunidad de Bethel. El trabajo al que Florencia se dedica, es el labrado de tierra; por el cual posee su propia parcela y sobre ella están sembradas las plantas de cacao, café y frutas de la zona. Es así que todos los días, desde muy temprano por la mañana, sale a trabajar en sus fincas en compañía de su pareja, pues ambos saben que el dinero que obtenga podrá salir adelante y cubrir las necesidades de su familia. Por tanto, lo productos que recolecta son vendidos en los centros de acopio ubicados en las ciudades de San Francisco y Quimbiri, lugares donde pagan muy bien los granos y las  frutas que vende. Lleva 08 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar, ya que así ve la recompensa luego de tanto tiempo y dedicación sobre sus plantas, sin embargo para ser llevados a los tendales para el proceso de secado, le resulta muy difícil y cansado. En adelante espera adquirir nuevas tierras para así aumentar su productividad. Este será su octavo crédito con MFP, por tal espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para que pueda concretar sus objetivos. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá comprar sacos de  abono natural como estiércol de animales para fertilizar sus tierras y que sea más productivas sus granos de cacao y café.
texts.en:
Florencia, 31, is originally from the city of Quimbiri. She is married to Filomeno, 37, who she has three children with. They all live together in their own house, which is located in the community of Bethel.

Florencia works the land. She owns her own parcel, which is planted with cocoa, coffee, and regional fruits. This is where she spends all of her days. Early in the morning, she goes out to work the fields alongside her husband. They both know that the money they earn will help them to get ahead and to cover their family's needs. They sell what they produce in the central markets of San Francisco and Quimbiri, places where they earn a good profit on the grains and fruits they sell.

She has been doing this work for eight years and her favorite thing about it is the harvest, since it is when all of the time dedicated to her crops pays off. Nevertheless, carrying the harvest to the area where it is dried is very difficult and tiring. In the future, she hopes to acquire more land in order to increase her production.

This will be Florencia's eighth loan with MFP. She hopes she can count on the support of each one of you to help her realize her goals.

Florencia is well loved by the other members of her communal bank. She will use the requested loan to buy sacks of natural fertilizer (animal manure) to fertilize her fields and make them produce more cocoa and coffee.

loans.use: to buy sacks of natural fertilizer

loans.name: Adiatou

texts.fr: Revendeuse de bonbons, de cigarettes, des biscuits en gros et détails, Adiatou  a 54ans. Malgré son âge, elle ne baisse pas les bras et assure son devoir de femme au ménage. Elle veut un avenir meilleur à ses enfants, ajouter d’autres activités complémentaire à la principale. Son approvisionnement s’effectue au Grand marché de Lomé et la revente à domicile.
texts.en: Reseller of candy, cigarettes, cookies, wholesale and retail, Adiatou is 54 years old.  Despite her age, she doesn’t let up and ensures her work as a cleaning lady. She wants a better future for her children, adding other complimentary activities to her principal one.  She stocks up at the main market in Lome and resells at home.

loans.use: to buy candy and cigarettes.

loans.name: Cristina Del Carmen

texts.es: Cristina del Carmen reside en su casa con su compañero de vida. Hace Ya varios años que Cristina se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en una pequeña tienda que posee en su hogar de residencia. Es una mujer emprendedora y no deja escapar ninguna oportunidad de negocio. Últimamente ha notado que su negocio es muy frecuentado y cuenta con buena clientela, toda esto es gracias a su carisma y amabilidad a la hora de atender su negocio. Esto la ha impulsado a querer aumentar el inventario de su tienda con el fin de atraer a más clientes y mantener satisfechos a los que ya tiene. Solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder cumplir su sueño de ver su negocio florecer y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su esposo. Con el crédito piensa comprar variedad de insumos como: huevos, aceite, arroz, azúcar, leche, café, dulces, bebidas, detergentes, y otros productos que los clientes encuentren atractivos a la hora de realizar su compra. De esta manera espera mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Cristina del Carmen lives at home with her life partner. It has been many years since Cristina has been selling essential goods from a small store installed in her house. She is an enterprising woman and she never passes up a business opportunity. Lately she has noticed that her business is highly frequented and she has a good clientele. This is all due to the charisma and kindness she demonstrates when attending her business. This has motivated her to increase her store's inventory. Her goal is to attract new clients and to keep her current clients satisfied. She requests a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner) to achieve her dream of seeing her business flourish and to improve the quality of her life and that of her husband. With the loan she plans on purchasing a variety of products, such as: eggs, cooking oil, rice, sugar, milk, coffee, sweet, drinks, detergents, and other products that are attractive to her clients at the time of purchase. This way she will be able to improve the quality of her life.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products such as eggs, cooking oil, rice, sugar, milk, coffee, sweets, drinks, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 30 years old and married with two children. He has been farming on his piece of land for the past five years.

Samuel is requesting a loan with KADET LTD to purchase supplies such as seed and fertilizer and to buy more animals. He has been a good KADET LTD client and this will be his second loan. 

Samuel hopes to make a profit with his loan and use it to educate his children and expand his farm. He plans to develop his business and become financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and livestock

loans.name: Jose Marcos

texts.es:
José, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, todos se apoyan en la familia, él desde joven se dedica a sembrar maíz y frijol, de esta actividad ha logrado mantener a su familia y sobre todo de la misma producción se han alimentado.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos y pago de mano de obra, pues dentro de los insumos esta el muy importante abono, que sirve para fortalecer la planta.
Su objetivo es que con su trabajo logre mejorar e incrementar los ingresos cada día, ayudando a su a sus hijos a que cuenten con lo más necesario para subsistir.
texts.en: José is a farmer.  He lives with his wife and children.  The entire family helps each other out.  From a very young age he’s been growing corn and beans.   This activity has made it possible for him to support his family and, more importantly, this same production has fed them.  He is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies and to pay for labor costs because among the supplies is manure which serves to strengthen the plants.  His goal is that his work will lead to improved and increased income every day helping his children to have everything they need to subsist.

loans.use: to buy supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Koken

texts.en:
Koken is 51 years old and a married  woman. She has eight children who depend on her. She has been a farmer for six years.

She heard about KADET from other women registered in her area. This is her second loan from KADET LTD, and she wants to use the loan to buy farm supplies such as seedlings and fertilizer. 

She hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco, de 52 años, es un hombre alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Paulina y 2 de sus 7 hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos y a los que cuidan en la comunidad nativa de Alianza. Se siente feliz por todo lo obtenido hasta el momento, sus hijos y sus nietos son su razón de vida y trabajo. La actividad a la que se dedica es el cultivo de plátano, café y cítricos. Las extensas tierras que posee, lo han convertido en uno de los principales productores de la zona. Sus productos los lleva a vender hasta la ciudad de La Merced, donde ya tiene compradores esperándolo, ya que sus cultivos son de muy buena calidad y en tiempos de buena cosecha los mismo comerciantes lo visitan, ya que sabe de su buen trabajo. Lo que más le gusta es cosechar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho empeño, lleva 28 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus plantaciones de las plagas que pueden afectarlas. En el futuro, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para ampliar su producción y así continuar con el trabajo que lo apasiona, la agricultura. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Alianza al progreso” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está dispuesto a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y para eso ya está empezando a ahorrar. Además agradece al apoyo brindado. Francisco de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de plantitas de café y plátanos para comenzar a renovar sus plantaciones, además de fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlos posteriormente.
texts.en:
Francisco, 52, is a cheerful man living in his own house with his wife, Paulina, and two of his seven children who are the motivating force behind all his efforts and who he cares for in the indigenous community of Alianza.  He feels happy about everything he’s accomplished to date; his children and grandchildren are his reason to live and work.

The activity he’s involved in is growing bananas, coffee and citrus fruit.  The extensive fields he owns have turned him into one of the area's main producers.  He takes his products all the way to the city of La Merced to sell where he already has buyers waiting for him because his crops are very good quality.  During times of good harvests the merchants actually come to visit him because they know about his good work.

What he most enjoys is planting his fields; something he’s done with much dedication.  He’s been in this line of work for 28 years and considers the most difficult part protecting his plants from infestations that can affect them.  In the future, he’d like to buy new lands to expand production and continue with the work that he’s so passionate about: agriculture.

He belongs to the “Alianza al Progreso” (Alianza toward Progress) communal bank and this is the second MFP loan where he’s willing to make his installment payments punctually; he’s already started to save up to do so.  In addition, he gives thanks for the support provided.  If Francisco were to receive your support, he’ll use the requested money to buy coffee and banana seedlings to renew his plantations as well as to buy natural fertilizer to spread among them later on.

loans.use: to buy coffee and banana plants as well as fertilizer.

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a food vending business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, charcoal and utensils. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, charcoal and utensils.

loans.name: Cristian Alejandro

texts.es:
Cristian es un hombre soltero de 24 años que vive en el barrio "20 de Octubre" del cantón Santo Domingo de la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas. Casi toda la provincia goza de un clima tropical húmedo, su cabecera provincial es una de las más densamente pobladas del Ecuador. 

Desde los 18 años el decidió trabajar para poder costear sus estudios. Cristian se ha esforzado mucho para llevar ambas actividades. El es un vendedor puerta a puerta de calzado, tiene ya conformada su cartera de clientes pero ahora quiere ampliar su zona comprando más mercadería. Además necesita completar el pago que debe hacer por concepto de su matrícula de estudios. Para esto el solicitó a Fundación Alternativa un crédito. Cristian comenta que le agrada mucho la atención que su asesor de crédito le brinda ya que la información es clara.

Su gran meta es concluir sus estudios y ser un profesional para ponerse al servicio de la comunidad. Sueña también con tener su empresa propia.
texts.en:
Cristian is 24 years old and single. He lives in a neighbourhood called "20 de Octubre" in the canton of Santo Domingo in the Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas Province. Almost the entire province has a humid tropical climate all year round. Its provincial capital is one of the most densely populated in Ecuador.

From the age of 18, he decided to work to pay for his studies. Cristian has worked hard to do both. He is a door-to-door salesman of shoes. He has already built up a customer base but now wants to expand his territory by buying more merchandise. In addition, he needs to complete the payment of his tuition fees. For this he asked Fundación Alternativa for a loan. Cristian says that he likes the attention his credit counsellor offers him alot as the information is clear.

His goal is to finish his studies and become a professional in order to serve the community. He also dreams of owning his own business.



.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition fees and buy merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Nanah

texts.en:
Nanah is 37 years old and married with two children, ages 4 and 13. She also supports 3 relatives at home. 

She runs a cooking and food items shop in Goderich, Sierra Leone, and has been in this business for 8 years. Nanah sells food products such as canned goods, pop drinks, rice, and spices. Her husband is a taxi driver and businessman, and helps the family generate more income. She says that the main challenge to her business is the rise and fall in goods that affect her monthly turnover. 

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more food products, drinks, and seasonings. Nanah says that the extra income from this loan will help her add more goods to her store and support her family. In the future, she would like to extend her business to different parts of town.

loans.use: to purchase more canned goods, oil, flour, and pop drinks

loans.name: Veronica De Los Angeles

texts.es: Verónica es una mujer incansable que nunca se ha rendido ante las dificultades, a sus 28 años de edad se considera una soñadora, pues desde que sus hijos nacieron se ha preocupado por brindarles estabilidad y armonía en el hogar y para ello ha tenido que enfrentar grandes retos. Ella se dedica a una pulpería donde ofrece productos como granos básicos, pan, refrescos, galletas, sopas, enlatados y otros productos de primera necesidad. Sueña con que este progreso sea continuo, es por este motivo que solicita un préstamo, ya que él no cuenta con el capital necesario para comprar todo lo que necesita.
texts.en: Verónica is a tireless woman who never surrenders when faced with difficulties. At 28 years old, she considers herself a dreamer. Since her children were born, she has worried about giving them stability and harmony in the home. For this reason, she has had to face great challenges. She has a grocery store and sells grains, bread, soft drinks, cookies, soups, canned goods and other necessities. She dreams her progress will continue. This is her motive for requesting a loan because she does not have the capital necessary to purchase everything needed.

loans.use: purchase grains, bread, soft drinks, cookies, soups and canned goods.

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en: Hiyam is a 51-year-old widow, working in selling men's, women's and children's underwear and sleeping suits since 2009, to make her own living. Hiyam insisted to improve her living since her husband passed away. She is a hard-working woman with a very good reputation. Her shop is attracting customers, since she presents her merchandise in a talented way. Hiyam is requesting a loan from Kiva partner "Al Majmoua" in order to increase her autumn/winter sleeping suit collection highly requested at this time from her customers. Hiyam  is experiencing micro credit for the first time and hopes that it will help in expanding her business more and more in the future.

loans.use: To increase her autumn/winter collection

loans.name: Aliya

texts.en:
Aliya, 26, is a resident of Ananievo – a small village in the Isykul region. Her husband works in Kazakhstan, so she brings up her seven-year-old son, by herself. Her son goes to school. Aliya sells clothes as her livelihood. She started this activity two years ago with an initial investment of 20,000 soms. She earns about 6,000 soms per month. This profit enables her to purchase household appliances to improve their living conditions. With the money received from the loan, Aliya wants to purchase more clothes for trade. She plans to increase her turnover and improve the selection of clothing which she sells. In the future she wishes to expand her business and save money to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for trade

loans.name: Riva

texts.en:
Riva is 28 years and married to his wife Asha. They have two boys, both of whom attend school. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 12 years, he has operated a fish selling business, selling at the market and in a shop to restaurant operators and town residents. He faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during the month of June and July. Riva dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With this loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), he wants to purchase fishing rods and a freezer to store fish. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing rods and a freezer to store fish.

loans.name: Kunihira

texts.en:
Kunihira is a 42-year-old married woman with eight children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her family goal is to educate her children to higher levels. 

She sells old clothes and has been in this business for 18 years; she started with 200,000 shillings but now it's worth 1,500,000 shillings as working capital. She faces a challenge of seasonal changes in the weather. 

Kunihira needs the loan to buy women's clothes for selling this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes for selling this Christmas season.

loans.name: Solaua

texts.en:
Solaua is 59 years old and has six children.

Solaua owns and operates a business planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Solaua needs a loan of WST 1,250 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Solaua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Solaua's fourth loan with SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score." For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  PBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Marie Beatrice

texts.en: Marie Beatrice, aged 52, is a widow with 8 children who are between 14 and 27 years old. Three of her children attend school.  She has been selling foodstuffs for 10 years.  She has requested a loan to buy more foodstuffs such as cassava, rice, cooking oil, and peanuts. With the profits, she will make savings. She would love to see the business expand in the future.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 41 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling clothes in Buluk South Sudan for two years. 

Julia is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue una de las miembros, quién  invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la fundacion paraguaya.  Actulamente trabajan todas juntas, para que por medio del trabajo de todas ellas puedan salir adelante.
La sra. Marlene esta casada con el Señor Ramon hace 7 años, tienen un hijo pequeño que criar. Ella cuenta que se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, tambien vende juguetes de toda variedad. Cuenta que por medio de su trabajo ella puede ayudar a su marido con los gastos y de esa forma compartir los gastos.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de ropas en general para niños adultos. Marlene sueña con abrir un salon de venta de ropas y articulos de merceria en su casa. Y lograr asi brindar un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
One of the members was the initial contact to form this committee; she invited and organized her girlfriends to join Fundación Paraguaya’s Enterprising Women’s Committee.  They are currently working together so that all of them can get ahead by means of their work.

Marlene has been married to Ramón for 7 years; they have a little boy to raise.  She relates that she sells all sorts of clothes and also a variety of toys.  She relates that by means of her work she’s able to help her husband cover expenses and share costs.

She requested the loan to buy clothing in general for children and adults.  Marlene dreams with opening a clothing and miscellany store at home to provide her family with a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is a 46-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has one son. Her husband is a driver. Loan earns a living running a general store, which she has done for 20 years. 

Loan would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as milk, soft drinks, snack foods and confectionery to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as milk, soft drinks, snack foods and confectionery.

loans.name: Julie Augustine

texts.fr:
Julie femme active et dynamique de 30 ans. Elle est mariée à un agent de sécurité. Le couple a 3 enfants, dont 2 sont scolarisés.
Elle est dans la vente de chaussures pour enfant depuis 2008 et elle en est à son 3eme prêt au niveau de CEFOR. Cette mère de famille est très enthousiaste pour son travail, elle ne se contente pas de l’aide venant de la famille de son mari.
 Elle a pour objectif, l’achat d’un terrain en 2016 pour pouvoir y bâtir une maison et ainsi elle n’aura plus à payer le loyer. Mais à part cela, elle espère aussi diversifier ses produits selon les tendances de la période.

loans.use: acheter divers chaussures pour petites filles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Alice wants to buy first class used clothes to sell with the new clothes she makes.

loans.name: Anna Abanji

texts.en:
Anna is one of five wives and mother of five children. Her goal in life is to see her children graduate from college or vocational training and become independent. She has had training in business techniques, credit and management skills, and has experience-sharing sessions at Center meetings organized by GHAPE. She was given a loan of $40 in 2005 and $130 in 2006. She is proud of having succeeded in selling foodstuff like vegetables, cocoyam, and pepper to the people of her immediate community, and for having paid her children’s tuition.

With a loan of $800, she plans to increase her stock by buying cocoyam, yam, ibo-cocoyam in bags from the “bush market” (farmers’ market); buckets for measuring and bags for parceling; and setting aside money for transportation. She is optimistic that her business will succeed as she will be able to supply different types of customers daily 24/7. With the experience each member of the household has in this business, her children will sell from the house and she will sell in the flea market.

She plans to pay her loan in 18 months. The first repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Selling raw food items for humans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Khakverdi

texts.en: Q. Khakverdi runs his small business, which consists of a herd of sheep.  He would like to build a good place with normal conditions to keep his animals.  He is requesting a loan of $1200 to build a shed for his herd.

loans.use: Build a shed for his sheep

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is married and has three sons; the oldest is 23 and is also married. The younger sons are 20 and 14 years old and still live at home. His wife helps run their small grocery store. It was her idea that he start this business to supplement the income he earned as an electrician, as that job was of a seasonal nature and not very steady. He started out running a small snack stand with very few products but has since been able to expand his offerings.

Pedro is requesting a loan of $925 to expand his business and purchase more inventory, as this will help him attract and retain more customers. He will repay this loan over a period of 6 months. Pedro and his family thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Pedro esta casado y tienen tres hijos, de los cuales uno, el mayor de 23 años de edad ya está casado, los otros dos tienen 20 y 14 años de edad respectivamente y dependen de él; su esposa lo ayuda en el negocio, que es de venta de abarrotes en general. Él inicio con su negocio por sugerencia de su esposa para poder mejorar sus ingresos ya que el trabajaba como eléctrico y muchas veces ese trabajo es muy variable y por temporadas no tiene trabajo. Empezó con su negocio hace 5 años atrás, empezando con muy poca mercancía pero que con el paso del tiempo a podido ampliar sus productos a ofrecer, ya que inició como un tipo snack (dulces y refrescos).

Pedro está solicitando un préstamo por US $ 925 para poder ampliar su negocio y surtirse de mercadería para así poder mantener y atraer más clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Él y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que le brindas para continuar creciendo con su negocio y así poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: To buy inventory

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela is an artisan who embroiders cloth blouses and sells them in the city's artisan market. She is 32 years old, has three children, and belogs to the group called Alvaro Obregón 2 together with Veda Esperanza Hernández Felipe (who sells footwear). Manuela will envest her loan in the purchase of fabric and thread in a variety of colors, and Veda Esperanza will buy a large variety of shoes in many sizes in order to have more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

MANUELA es artesana, borda blusas hechas de tela de manta y los vende en el mercado de las artesanías de la ciudad. Ella tiene 32 años, tres hijos, pertenece al grupo llamado Álvaro Obregón 2 junto con doña Veda Esperanza Hernández Felipe (venta de calzado). Manuela invertirá su préstamo en la compra de tela e hilos en su variedad de colores, y Veda Esperanza comprará gran variedad de números de zapatos para tener más clientes.

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread and shoes.

loans.name: Luisa María

texts.en:
Luisa sells women’s clothing and shoes. She sells also plastic jewels. She has been operating this business for six months. Luisa has three children, two girls and a boy. Her husband is working as watchman.

Luisa says that business has been getting results. Even though she hopes she can improve the way she is doing business and increase her income. Currently, she has a weekly profit of USD 115.00.

The entrepreneur is requesting a loan to purchase clothing in bulk and other goods in the capital. That way, she will reduce costs of trips she makes outside her town to get products. Luisa is very responsible and has a good credit history. She has already taken a loan from FSMA and she repaid it successfully.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Surayya

texts.en: Surayya M. lives in Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan. She is 52 years old, married, and has seven children. She is selling women's clothes with her son in the Beylagan city bazaar. She wants to buy more kinds of goods, and because of this, she needs a loan in the amount of $600.

loans.use: To expand her clothing sales business

loans.name: Gulu C 2001(I) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year and six months. Mary is 45 years old and married with five children. She runs a butcher shop. With the extra business profits, Mary intends to pay school fees for the children. Gertrude and Mary have piggery businesses. Specioza has grocery store.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand the butcher business

loans.name: Nasim

texts.en:
N. Nasim, 26 years old, is married and the father of a one year old child. 

Nasim has run his business of office supplies sales for more than 11 years in the central market. He competes effectively with big stores by offering prices that are lower and more attractive. This has helped him to succeed in his business.

Nasim requests a loan of $1000.00 for the term of 9 months to expand the business and purchase more office supplies to sell.

loans.use: To expand the business and purchase additional office supplies to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and fix his motorbikes

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Mrs. Elena L. lives in her own home, in the Llojeta lader West zone in the city of La Paz with her husband, Mr. Gregorio Vargas and their two children. Mrs. Elena dedicates herself to the decoration of large pillow cushions that she sells to the merchants in the market and her husband is a building worker in private constructions. With previous loans, found through Kiva, she was able to purchase fabric for the decoration of the pillow cases, increasing her capital. The loan that she is soliciting will be invested in the construction of a new room in her home that will be a bedroom for her younger son. This is the sixth time she has requested a loan and the socioeconomic analysis favorably qualifies her and to be granted the loan. Her previous loans have been completely paid back to Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elena L. vive en casa propia, en la zona de Llojeta ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo, el señor Gregorio Vargas y dos de sus hijos. La señora Elena se dedica a la elaboración de fundas de almohadones, que vende a los comerciantes de mercados, y su esposo es albañil en construcciones privadas. Con el anterior crédito, conseguido a través de Kiva, pudo comprar tela para la elaboración de las fundas, aumentando su capital de trabajo. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de una habitación nueva en su vivienda, que será el dormitorio de su hijo menor. Esta es la sexta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. El crédito anterior ha sido cancelado a Kiva en su totalidad.

loans.use: The construction of a new room in her home that will be a bedroom for her younger son.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Jewelry is a precious substance to all. Ghanaians have beads carved from stones, very precious stones that every woman would want to adorn herself with. Faustina A. has been selling jewelry such as beads, necklaces, bangles and earrings for 20 years now. She has seven children, three of whom are in school.

Faustina wants to use her loan to buy more beads and other jewelry to expand her operation and to increase her income. She is a member of the group called Stewards. Members agree to guarantee loans for each other.

loans.use: To buy more jewelry including beads, necklaces, bangles and rings.

loans.name: Verónica's Group

texts.en:
Veronica and July belong to the Los Jazmines Village Bank in San Juan de Lurigancho in the east of Lima.

Veronica is married and has a 14-year-old child who will finish secondary school next year. She has been selling Omnilife products by mail order for 4 years. She sells those products from house to house, but she also has some permanent clients. She also opened a bookstore with her husband 3 months ago.

July lives with her common-law husband and has a 4-year-old son who is still in nursery school. With her common-law husband, she has been selling wholesale lingerie for 3 years and makes home deliveries.

Veronica and July are soliciting loans of 1200 soles (about US$ 425) and 1000 soles (about US$ 350) respectively. Veronica wants to invest in her bookstore and July wants to buy more merchandise.

Veronica and July have a lot of plans, such as growing their businesses and helping their children who are still school age.

loans.use: invest in their respective businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of jewelry and clothing.

loans.name: Umarhuja

texts.ru: Зиеев Умархуджа проживает в городе Яван.Возраст 31 год, женат и имеет троих детей. Занимается торговлей . Имеет торговую точку на центральном рынке. Торгует коврами. Хочет получить кредит и добавить в оборотную сумму. Это поможет увеличить товарооборот. Товар он привозит из города Душанбе. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев
texts.en:
Umarhuja Z. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 31 years old, married, and has three children. He works in sales. He has a stall in the central market, where he sells rugs. He wants to take out a loan to add to his circulating capital. This will help increase sales turnover. His goods are brought in from the city Dushanbe. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rugs

loans.name: Alesi D.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 23-year-old Alesi M.. She is married and has one child, age 2. In 2007, Alesi established her retail shop business. She opens her shop six days a week, 9-12 hours a day. She is assisted by her husband. Alesi requires a loan in order to purchase more sugar, salt, rice, and home appliances in bulk. In the future, Alesi plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is genge. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people usually send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don't have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar, salt, rice and home appliances in bulk.

loans.name: Jorge Ernesto

texts.es:
Jorge es socio del Banco Comunal El Roble, es soltero, tiene su negocio de mototaxi, empezó hace 1 año y medio trabajando en compra y venta de autoradios, parlantes.

Jorge desde que recibe los préstamos ha formado un capital. Jorge necesita un préstamo de 1.000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de una mototaxi, con un dinero que tiene ahorrado también va a comprar autoradios, parlantes. Jorge sueña con sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Jorge is a member of El Roble Communal Bank. He has a motor-taxi business. He stared a year and a half ago buying and selling car radios and speakers.

Since Jorge has received the loans he has built business capital. He needs a loan for 1,000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of a motor-taxi. With the money he has saved he will also buy car radios and speakers.

Jorge dreams of his family getting ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a motor-taxi

loans.name: Teresa Natividad

texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the Sonrisa (“Smile”) Village Bank. She is married and has four children. She and her husband are artisans and make sculptures of landscapes, churches, traditional customs and birth commemorations out of Huamanga rock (alabaster). Her workshop is located in her house in Santa Ana, a local artisans’ neighborhood. She sells her pieces to vendors and also does custom orders. 

Teresa needs a loan of 2400 soles (US$800) to buy more alabaster for her sculptures. Her dreams are to help her children finish school, to get ahead in life, and to improve her workshop. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.

Teresa es casada y tiene 4 hijos, Teresa junto a su esposo son artesanos y realizan esculturas en piedra de Huamanga (alabastro), como nacimientos, paisajes, iglesias, costumbres típicas, su taller esta ubicado en su casa en el barrio artesanal de Santa Ana, sus ventas los realiza a los comerciantes y también a pedidos. 

Teresa necesita un préstamo de 2400 dinero que será invertido en la compra de piedra de Huamanga.

Los sueños de Teresa son ayudar a sus hijos para culminar sus estudios, salir adelante y mejorar su taller.

loans.use: Buy alabaster

loans.name: Rosalinda Matea

texts.es: La Señora Rosalinda Matea de 29 años de edad,  casada de oficios Artesana “Elaboración de Fajas Típicas para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 3 telares, habita junto a sus hijos, cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, desde su niñez se dedicaba en la Artesanía gracias a los préstamos  a podido llevar a su familia adelante donde es persona muy conocida, y su residencia en Paraje Chichaclan el Cantón Poxlajuj del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala. Donde ha llegado a Solicitar a la Asociación Asdir un financiamiento para la compra de materia prima de dicha Artesanía; de esa manera facilitar y poder cubrir la demanda a su clientela y así poder darle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Rosalinda Matea is 29 years old. She works as an artisan in the production of traditional women’s sashes. She works in a three-loom workshop with two other employees engaged in the same activity. Since childhood she has been devoted to this craft. Thanks to the loans she has received, she has been able to carry her family forward. She is well known where she lives, with her children, in Paraje Chichaclan, Municipality and Department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Rosalinda has come to the Asociación ASDIR for financing to purchase raw materials for her craft. In this way, she will be able to provide for and meet the demands of her customers, and thus be able to provide better living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raw Materials for Hand Crafts

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther  es socia del Banco Comunal el Triunfo. Esther es casada, tiene  51 años y dos hijos  D. 31 y 26 años.
Tiene su negocio D. venta D. arpillería (chalecos, bolsitas, manoplas, pie D. árboles), productos  artesanales, manualidades, con este negocio lleva veinte años, trabaja en su casa con un grupo D. personas, también venD. productos D. belleza. 

DesD. que Esther  esta en Finca está vendiendo mejor, pueD. invertir en otras cosas. 
Esther necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. productos D. belleza para su stock y la compra D.  materiales para la confección D. sus productos D. arpillería (hilos, lentejuelas, etc.)
Sueña con  seguir surgiendo en su negocio  y ayudar a su hija en la culminación D. su carrera.
texts.en:
Esther is a member of the Triunfo (Triumph) Village Bank. She is 51, and married with two children, who are 31 and 26. For the past twenty years she has been in business selling arpilleras (colorful stitched fabrics such as vests, little handbags, mittens, and decorative patches), products maD. by local artisans, and handicrafts. She works in her home with a group of people, and also sells beauty products. Since Esther has been with FINCA, sales have been growing, so she can invest in other things. She needs a loan of 1000 Soles, which she will invest in the purchase of beauty products for her inventory, as well as materials for making her arpilleras (thread, sequins, etc.). Esther’s dream is to continue growing her business so she can help her daughter realize her own career.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Esther needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she will invest in beauty products.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel A. is 41 years old, married and a father with six children. Right now all his children are in a community school in the town where he lives. Samuel lives in a farming community called Abofour, a suburb of Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Abofour is a forest reserve area and the most popular occupation is farming. Most of the people are farmers and the illiteracy rate there is very high among the adults. 

Samuel is a seasoned farmer and he has been farming cocoa and cereals like maize for more than twelve years, to take care of his family. Through this, he has managed to build a two bed room house in the village. Samuel says he has large acres of cocoa and maize and that he is been facing a problem on the farm as there is a disease attacking his cocoa crops.
.
For this reason, he wants a loan assistance to buy farm items like cocoa chemicals, spraying machines, fertilizers to nurse his cocoa, and agro chemicals etc. With the loan Samuel believes he would have the resources to harvest more this year. 

Samuel would also like to use part of his profit to take care of family expenses, especially in the area of the children's education. Samuel belongs to a village bank called Jabaz. He hope to receive GH¢500 to improve his business by restocking his inventory. This would enable his save more to support his family.

loans.use: To buy farming products like agro chemicals, fertilizers and farm equipment.

loans.name: Ngay

texts.en: Mr. Ngay N. lives in Prey Meas village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. His wife, Mrs. Pech Phea, uses the rice to make rice wine. Mr. Ngay N. is applying for a loan to purchase rice as well as two piglets to start a pig breeding business. He hopes to increase his income and help improve his family's living conditions with this loan. He is 45 years old and the father of five children, one of whom stays at home to help keep house while the others are attending the local school. His wife is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to purchase rice to make wine and two piglets for breeding pigs business.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. is thirty-seven years old. She is married and has five children, four boys and a girl. Currently, Ama says, two of her children have completed junior high school while the rest are still in the basic school and the senior high school. She lives with her family in a family house at Nkwaateng. Nkwaateng is in the Eastern Region of Ghana.  Nkwaateng is a farming as well as a commercial community.

Ama works hard to help her husband take care of the family. Her husband is a farmer. He cultivates maize, plantain and other foodstuffs in the community where they live. Ama sells cooked yam in the local market square. She procures the tubers of yam from the farmers in the surrounding villages. Ama has been in business for over four years now and is full of experience. She wants a loan to buy tubers of yam and other cooking ingredients in bulk so that she can serve more customers and increase her profit margin.

Ama is a member of the Kingdom Trust Bank group. Members of this group guarantee loans for each other and support the other members in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy tubers of yam.

loans.name: Jane Auma

texts.en: Jane Auma A. is a thirty-year-old mother of four children, ages sixteen, ten, nine and eight. She is married to a glass cutter and their combined incomes help pay the school fees for the children. She runs a small kiosk where she sells vegetables, tomatoes and kale that she buys from the Kibuye market in downtown Kisumu. Jane hopes her children become teachers, nurses or police officers.

loans.use: Food Stock

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen is 28 years old and single without any children. She sells medicines. She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She is an active LAPO client. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena M. says that every individual aims to have a successful life. She is a 48 year old single mother to her three children. They live in Barangay Rizal, Santiago City. Her children are Evelyn, a 28 year old college graduate; Christ John, who is 26 years old; and Rafael, who is 24 years old. Two of her children failed to finish their college educations due to a lack of financial resources.

Elena has been managing a rice farming business for ten years. At present, she is seeking financial assistance in order to maintain her farm. She hopes that lenders will entrust her with a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizers, insecticide, and seed variety. She hopes to have a better yield for her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticide, and seed variety.

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Hem S., 49 years old and a resident of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia, earns a living as a tailor, providing her services to neighbors, sewing both traditional and modern clothes. She conducts the business very well and her many customers recognize the good service she provides. From this enterprise, she can earn an average of $9 per day. As well, she has always cultivated a rice crop.

Hem is a widow and the mother of four children; two are married and have already started families, and the others are single and still live in the family home. Hem S. is applying for a loan to purchase a plot of farmland in order to grow a rice crop during the approaching rainy season.

loans.use: To grow a rice crop during the approaching rainy season.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
N. Nguyễn Thị owns and operates a manufacturing business, selling to local businesses and community members. She is a 36 year-old woman, married and has two school-age children. She is from the town of Quảng Xương. N. has been in this business for over 16 years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month.

In 2003, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. N. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase tools and other equipment to expand the business. N. is now requesting a loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. This will be her seventh loan from TYM Fund. N. plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

No. 1403030120.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials

loans.name: Sabanalamarinos Unidos Group 2

texts.en:
Fior is the leader of Sabanalamarinos Unidos 2, which is a group of women looking to take out a group loan. They are from the town of Sabana de la Mar, a coastal town in the northern part of the Dominican Republic.

Fior has been selling women's underwear for five years, but because of an increase in the number of competitors in that market, her business has slowed. Now she would like a loan to start selling used clothing. Fior said she has a contact in the nearby town of Sanchez where she can get a very good deal on loads of used clothing that have been shipped from the United States. With this loan, she will be able to travel to Sanchez and buy those clothes to sell from her house.

Fior and her husband, Manuel, have three children, ages 9, 7 and 4. The two oldest are in school and the youngest one looks forward to starting school next year. Fior hopes that with this new business plan she can save enough money to be able to send all her children to the university some day.

Fior and everyone in the Sabanalamarinos Unidos 2 group are excited at the possibility of starting and growing their businesses!

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a vegetable vendor. She lives in Bonfal West, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Villamore and they work hand in hand to uplift their poor living conditions. They have four children: two are in college and two are in high school. Mercy is doing her best to maintain her business and their farm.

Mercy is requesting to borrow PHP 5,000 from Kiva for her vegetable-vending business. She will use the loan to improve her vending business. She wants the best for her family and that is why she works very hard and patiently to give the best for her family.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Zoila Ester

texts.es: Zoila Ester A. E. vive en Atiquizaya, pequeño municipio en el departamento de  Ahuachapán.  Zoila y su esposo viven con su hijo de 17 años de edad, que estudia su educación básica, y su mama de 75 años, a quien acogieron en su hogar tras quedar ella sola años atrás. Hace 17 años Zoila inició una venta de carne en el mercado municipal de su municipio, donde vende diversos productos de carne roja y blanca. Actualmente Zoila y su familia solicitan un préstamo para comprar nueva mercadería y productos, para hacer mejorar y crecer a su humilde  venta en el mercado.
texts.en:
Zoila Ester A. E. lives in Atiquizaya, a small municipality in the Ahuachapán department. Zoila and her husband live with their 17 year old son, who is in school. They also live with her 75 year old mother, who they took into their home when she was left alone years ago. Zoila started her business of selling meat in her municipal market 17 years ago. She sells different red and white meats. Zoila and her family are currently asking for a loan to buy new merchandise and products to improve and increase her humble sales in the market. .

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine B. is from the village of San Isidro Bajo,Sinacabn,Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Josephine is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 1,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In July 2009, Josephine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Josephine from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Giovanna Melba

texts.en: Giovanna is a member of The Orchid Village Bank. She is married and 51 years-old. She has older children who work. Giovanna is dedicated to buying and selling dress clothes. She purchases her clothes on credit from a workshop. She sells the clothes at companies where her girlfriends and family members work. Giovanna needs a new loan of 1,800 soles to buy sweaters, light jackets, and elegant outfits for women. Her dream is to buy an apartment in another district. She is saving with her husband to fulfill her dream. Click to read about Giovanna's first loan and second loan.

loans.use: To buy sweaters, light jackets, and elegant outfits for women

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua is twenty – nine years old. She is married and has give birth to two children, both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Akosua is a trader. She trades in dried fish. She sells at the local market and supplies to other retailers and food vendors in her community. Akosua buys her goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Glorina

texts.en:
Being a parent, Glorina has a great ambition for her children, she sacrifices everything for the sake of her children.Glorina and Roger D. a husband and wife who have eight children are striving hard to give them a better future. They live harmoniously in a village located at Brgy. Villa Coloma, Bagabag,Nueva Vizcaya.
	The common source of their living is through farming, they till their farm lot for two cropping, by planting variety of vegetables and rice. Furthermore, Glorina engages in duck raising to earn additional income. With her interest to increase the number of their ducks, she wants to borrow additional capital in a Microfinance organization to purchase additional ducks and the needed materials for their maintenance. Finally, she applied an amount of P 5,000.00 to be added in her capital in acquiring the said additional ducks and for their maintenance and also for the improvement of their crop production. They believed that someday, their children will finish their studies and the status of their living will be improve through their patience and sacrifices with the financial support of the said organization. As they have said, “ if there is patience, there is success.”

loans.use: additinal capital for her duck raising business

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan P. C. lleva tiempo elaborando en su domicilio un cuarto y un baño mismo que realizo de ahorros que junto con su trabajo y parte con el negocio de su esposa, ella se encarga de elaborar y vender nopalitos, semillas y donas esto con el fin de tener mayor ingreso y ayudarle a su esposo. El proyecto que ellos tienen en mente es terminar estos cuartos ya que son muy necesarios, comenta la señora Remedios esposa del señor Juan que esta muy contenta con este proyecto ya que ella le pedía mucho a su esposo que le realizara un baño mejor que el que tienen actual mente, actualmente el proyecto esta semi construido pues el material se termino y los ahorros también, por eso solicitan su ayuda para darle a su Esposa ese baño que ella siempre a querido tener y lucir.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan P. C. has worked for some time trying to finish building a room and a bathroom in his home. He has financed the construction with savings from his job and from his wife's business. She works making and selling nopalitos (a dish made with the prickly pear fruit), seeds, and donuts in order to improve the family income and help her husband. They would like to finish the rooms in their home soon as they are needed for the family. Remedios, Juan's wife, is very pleased with the project since she asked her husband for some time to construct a better bathroom than the one they currently have. Currently, the project is half-finished but they ran out of materials and savings; this is why they are requesting a loan in order to finish the bathroom that Remedios has dreamed of.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish building a room and a bathroom

loans.name: Diomith

texts.es:
La señora Diomith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Inmaculada”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 40 años y 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Diomith, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, se siente muy contenta y orgullosa por lo logrado. Anteriormente Diomith, trabajaba en CEPCO (Centro de Estudios y Promoción Comunal del Oriente) donde poco a poco, fue ahorrando y generando su propio capital, así de esta manera se inicio con la venta de cosméticos, nos cuenta que hoy en día le esta yendo muy bien, por lo que ahora, es directora de la Línea UNIQUE, donde cuenta con su propia cadena de consultoras, en diferentes zonas de la Ciudad. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, comprará productos de belleza para su aumentar su stock como: perfumes y colonias para damas, caballeros y niños; cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  Asimismo seguirá formando su propia red de representantes de la línea UNIQUE, la cual esto también genera gastos.

Diomith, es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Diomith belongs to the Virgen de la Inmaculada Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 40, married, and has two children. The children are still dependent upon her, and they go to school. Diomith is a woman who has been able to overcome many difficulties in her life’s path. She feels content and proud of what she has achieved. Diomith previously worked for CEPCO (Center for Studies and Communal Promotion of the East). Little by little she was saving and generating her own capital. This was the way she started with her cosmetic sales. She tells us that things are going very well for her these days. She is now a director of the UNIQUE line, where she has her own chain of consultants in different areas of the city. With this loan for 3,000 PEN she will increase her stock by purchasing beauty products like perfume; cologne for women, men, and children; creams; compact powder; lipstick; and nail polish. She will continue forming her own chain of representative for the UNIQUE line, which also generates income. Diomith is an example to follow for many women who start a business; with perseverance they can achieve their dreams. She is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her start her own business and for helping other women grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
This is Zainab M., a small scale businesswoman in Makeni city, northern Sierra Leone. Zainab sells slippers/flip-flops at Rogbaneh Road, Makeni’s busiest road. Zainab is seeking a loan from SMT/Kiva for the second time in order to help her further improve her business. With her previous SMT/Kiva loan, she was able to improve her business and personal life. Having repaid her previous loan successfully, she is now requesting a new loan of SLL 4,000,000.00.

Madam M. is now age thirty-eight; she was born in a village call Sanda Taindaran, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a businessman and they have seven children plus two foster children. Six of their children are in secondary school and one is in primary school.  Zainab M. has been selling slippers for eleven years now. Zainab will use this loan to buy dozens of different types of slippers – “comfort”, “commot” “puma” and “yeyi”, as they are locally called.

loans.use: Buy additional slippers for resale

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel lives in Agbor, Delta State. She is 37 years old and married with four children. Her youngest child is six years old. Her children are excelling at school. Mabel is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. Kiva field partner, LAPO, is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. 

Mabel sells plastics like chairs, bowls, carpet and kerosene, at retail prices to her customers. Her dream is to expand her business by owning a plastics factory in the future. She is requesting for a loan amount of 150,000 NGN to purchase more plastics and kerosene to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics and kerosene to sell

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en: Dennis, 25 years old, is a rice farmer. He learned farming from his parents and has been helping them till their farm since he was a teenager. He feels blessed to have a source of income. He works hard at the farm to sustain it and make it productive. He joined the Kiva field partner, CEVI, and applied for a loan of 6,000 PHP. He will use this loan for farm supplies like seeds, fertilizers and others. This loan will help Dennis’ farm be more productive.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Monika

texts.en:
Monika is a single mom. She raises her 9-year-old daughter, Dominika, all by herself. She works hard to ensure a decent living for her small family and readily works long hours to make a little extra income. Monika sells women’s clothing and footwear in one of the local marketplaces in her hometown of Beregovo. She has been in this trade for only a year and a half. Presently, she has about 20,000 grivnyas worth of inventory. She makes 4,500 grivnyas in profit each month.  

Monika is requesting a 6,000 grivnya loan to purchase additional merchandise wholesale for retail sale in her vending kiosk. She tries to re-stock her merchandise on a regular basis which helps keep her loyal customers and attracts potential new ones. Monika has proven to be a trustworthy borrower as she has repaid previous loans without any delinquencies.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
Zaituni is 37 years of age, married with four children aged between 13 and 19 years. All her children go to school. The family resides in and owns a six roomed house where she stays with six people. She takes care of additional family members.

The family has access to electricity but has no piped water at home.  The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include paying utility bills, school fees for the children, medication and feeding the family.

Zaituni owns a restaurant in Kisaasi selling all types of food ranging from traditional to western food. She works seven days a week. She receives an average of 50 customers a day. She has had this business for over ten years. She incurs transport costs to and from different markets buying foodstuffs.

Her main challenges are seasonality and the rainy season because she works from a muddy place.  She sells on a retail basis only.  She has been with MCDT for ten years and is servicing her twentieth loan, working with the same group mates all this time. She wants to use this loan to buy more foodstuffs like bunches of bananas, beef and also charcoal. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and own and start doing outside catering.

loans.use: To buy bunches of bananas, beef and charcoal

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia L. is one of the very active members of ASHI. She is 50 years of age and is blessed with four loving and supportive children whose age range is from 11 to 24 years old. Despite poverty and a difficult way of surviving, Sylvia still feels happy and courageous because of the love and inspiration her husband (named Joyce) gives her all the time. He works as a village policeman and is receiving a small honorarium every month. They would not have been able to cover the expenses of their children if not for Sylvia’s small business. She joined ASHI, a Kiva field partner in the Philippines, and thereafter she had the opportunity to request loans which enable her to support and grow her sweetened-peanut and sweetened-cashew nut-selling business. 

Sylvia started with this business by selling the nuts herself in the market, but she was making only a small profit. Her customers were not as regular as before and were not purchasing large amounts of her product. After several times of receiving loans in increasing amounts through ASHI, Sylvia’s volume of production increased and her business became capable of supplying the demands of her customers. 

She wants to expand even further, especially now that she is supplying three stall owners in the market who sell “pasalubong”, which in the English language means a souvenir or homecoming present (a Filipino cultural tradition). Consequently, Sylvia would like to request a much larger loan this time from Kiva through ASHI. 

The proceeds from her business will be spent for her children’s education, which is the only reason for her continued determination. Sylvia believes that through her business the lives of her children will be different from hers and her husband’s.

loans.use: To buy large volumes of peanut and cashew nuts to sell.

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Кутбидинов Дилшод проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 24 года. Холост. Имеет среднее образование. Более 5 лет занимается торговлей. В основном продает запастные части автомашины. Этот бизнес приносит доход. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота. Дилшод хочет увеличить ассортимент, так как спрос на запасные части новых моделей автомашин увеличился.
texts.en:
K. Dilshod lives in the Vahdat region. He's twenty-four years old and single. He has a high school education. For more than five years he has been in sales: in general, he sells automotive spare parts. This is a profitable business. He is asking for a loan to increase his goods turnover. Dilshod wishes to provide more variety in his products, because the demand for spare parts of new models of cars has recently increased.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Restauración Group

texts.es:
El grupo restauración lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, responsables y esforzadas una de ellas es la señora María Luisa Pavón S. quien por medio de una ayuda que le brindaron sus hermanos puso un pequeño caramanchel donde comercializa desde gaseosa, cigarros, comida, CD y DVD.

Desde hace cuatro años tiene este negocio el cual ha ido creciendo y en el que invertirá el crédito para la compra de mercadería.

Uno de sus compañeros de grupo es Eddy José Enríquez C. quien por las mañanas vende de forma ambulante cosa de horno postre nicaragüense a base de maíz y por las tardes comercializa discos. Mientras Ángela María U.  Ramírez quien anhela tener su casa y terreno propio se dedica a la comercialización de tortillas por las mañanas y café, leche y pan por las tardes.
Ellos invertirán los créditos en sus respectivos negocios para acrecentarlos.
texts.en:
The Restroration Group consists of three hardworking, responsible, and strong individuals. One of them is Sra. María Luisa Pavón S. who, with the help of her siblings, built a small covered pavilion where she sells sodas, cigarettes, food, CDs, and DVDs. Her business was established four years ago and has been growing. She will use this loan to buy merchandise.

One of the other group members is Eddy José Enríquez C. who works in the morning as a street vendor selling Nicaraguan baked desserts made of corn. In the afternoons, he sells records. Meanwhile, Ángela María U. Ramírez hopes to have her own house and land. She sells tortillas in the mornings and coffee, milk, and bread in the afternoons. They will invest their loans in order to expand their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Pilly

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 38 years old Pilly Rashid L. from Coastal Region She is single with 2 children, between the ages of 12 and 21. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 2 dependants because are orphan 
Pilly has been running a snack sales since 2004. Client’s business is bites seller, this is the business where by woman are  used to sell snacks such as cakes, bun, chapati etc to their neighborhood when they take tea or coffee in the morning.
She works at the business for 1-4 hours per day, 6 days per week Pilly is requesting a loan of 300,000 TSH in order to buy additional wheat flour, cooking oil and other ingredients for her business. In the future, she plans to start another business. Pilly thanks you for your support!
ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional wheat flour, maize flour for her business.

loans.name: Mallorina

texts.en:
Mallorina C. is a 56-year-old married woman with four children who lives in Sitio Macasayang, Barangay Mabini, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. Mallorina has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon for two years now and earns a living by running a general store business.		
			
She is purchasing a solar lantern with a 3,100 PHP loan from NWTF to extend her productive hours and at the same time cut fuel costs and save money in the long run.		


About NWTF’s Green Loan Products:
Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation believes that the key to poverty alleviation for the poorest is to provide services beyond just credit.  To that end, NWTF offers green energy products designed to save money for its clients.  In a partnership with SunTransfer and Arc Finance, NWTF distributes solar-powered lanterns that also functions as a charging station for mobile phones. These families normally use kerosene lamps to light their homes.  The solar lantern offers a free, environment-friendly renewable source of energy, that allows them to reduce their monthly fuel costs.   
		
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams.
