They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Purchase of a solar lantern

loans.name: Kwagala Development Group, Mpigi

texts.en:
This is the story of K. Hajara, a young, ambitious and married 32-year-old woman operating a twelve-year-old grocery store in Nakasero market, Mpigi. To get started she first had to work as an apprentice at a neighborhood grocery store. She also does some poultry.

Hajara values highly the prospect of seeing all her children through university in her lifetime. It’s for that reason that she has been working hard to make sure all five of her children are in good schools.

With this loan, Hajara is looking at buying more stock that is in high favor for her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: get a motorcycle registration license

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta S. is from the village of Gata Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old, is widowed and has two adult children. To make a living, Antonieta owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products such as rice, some snack food, sugar, shampoo, soap, coffee, noodles, soft drinks, etc. in the local community. Antonieta has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Antonieta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan she has taken out from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Evella

texts.en:
Evella R. is from the village of Mainit, Iligan City. She is 50 years old. Evella is married and has 11 adult children. To make a living, Evella owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling bananas in the local community. Evella has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Evella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evella is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Evella from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alba Lely

texts.es:
Alba Lely tiene 45 años, reside en el municipio de Jucuapa, departamento de Usulután, está acompañada, tiene tres hijos de las edades de 22,18 y 15 años, depende económicamente de Alba, ella se dedica a vender  verduras y frutas.
La señora inicio el negocio hace 20 años y lo maneja sola, trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene un puesto en el mercado municipal de Jucuapa, ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos como son frutas y verduras, (tomates, zanahorias, brocoli, repollo, naranjas, manzanas, uvas, bananas) así mismo invertir en materia prima para hacer pupusas. Esto contribuirá en para mejorar el negocio, generar ingresos y nuevos productos para ofrecer a los clientes, apoyar a la continuidad del negocio de Alba.
Los objetivos son incrementar el negocio, apoyar a los hijos en la culminación de los estudios, ampliar y mejora la vivienda, contribuir para mejora la calidad de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Alba is 45 years old and resides in the municipality of Jucuapa, Usulután Department. She lives with a partner and has 3 children aged 22, 18, and 15, who are economically dependent on her. Alba sells vegetables and fruit. She began the business 20 years ago and runs it by herself, working from Monday through Sunday. She has a post in the municipal market of Jucuapa. Alba is soliciting a loan to buy products such as fruits and vegetables (tomatoes, carrots, broccoli, onions, oranges, apples, grapes, and bananas). She also will invest in basic ingredients to make pupusas, a popular local dish. This will help to improve the business, generating income and new products to offer customers, and aid in sustaining Alba's business. Her goal is to expand the business, help her children complete their studies, and expand and improve their home, bettering the family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING FRUITS AND VEGETABLES TO SELL IN HER PUBLIC MARKET POST

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda P. is from the town of Banga. She is 43 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Nilda owns & operates an agricultural business, planting & harvesting corn for sale. She dreams for her family to have better living conditions. 

Nilda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Nilda is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. This will be the first loan taken out by Nilda from CEVI. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: San Ramón Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Luchadoras nace hace más de dos años mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Este comité es de San Lorenzo, en estos más de cuatro años de intenso trabajo han crecido tanto social como económicamente, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras. 
Una de la integrantes es la señora Reinalda A. quien es peluquera y atiende a sus clientes en un  salón que posee en su casa, y al mismo tiempo ofrece lenceria en su peluqueria.
Asi ella logra obtener buenos ingresos con las actividades que realiza, solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas de trabajo para su peluqueria.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Luchadores" was formed more than 2 years ago thanks to the leadership and support of another communal bank that was working in the same place. This group is from San Lorenzo, and as a result of intense work over 4 years they have grown both socially and economically; they are recognized in their area as very hardworking women. One of the members is Reinalda A., who is a hairdresser and serves her customers in a salon that she has in her house. She also offers lingerie for sale in her beauty salon. Reinalda makes a good income from these activities; she requests a loan to buy equipment for her beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies and equipment for her beauty salon such as hair dyes, brushes, hair dryers, hair creams and oils, and other items

loans.name: Benita Celestina

texts.es: Benita es de 49 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo varón y dos varones actualmente es tejedora de fajas de sedalina, tiene más de 15 años de experiencia, solicita su tercer crédito para capital de trabajo, después del análisis correspondiente de la inversión podemos determinar que es rentable, y con la ayuda de su esposo podrá pagar el préstamo sin ningún inconveniente.
texts.en:
Benita is 49 years old, married and has a son. She currently works weaving fine sashes made of silk and cotton, which she has been doing for more than 15 years. She is requesting her third loan for working capital, and after an analysis of the investment we can determine that it is a profitable one. With the help of her husband she will be able to repay the loan without any inconvenience.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for her weaving busines

loans.name: Kiponza Group

texts.en:
Sharifu A. is in his early thirties and is married with one three-year-old daughter. Sharifu owns a carpentry shop which he has been running for nine years. He works from 7 am to 6 pm daily and makes a monthly income of about $200.

This will be Sharifu’s third Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term ends. 

He used his first loan to buy cement and wood. He used his second loan to open a mobile phone shop where he sells and repairs mobile phones. He wants to use his third loan on a recorder for his wife’s business, to pay school fees for his child and to buy wood for his carpentry business. His dream is to one day have enough money to buy modern machines for his carpentry business.

Sharifu will share the loan with his loan group, Kiponza, which totals twelve members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loans.

In the picture, Sharifu is second from left in the first row.

loans.use: To buy a recorder for his wife's business, school fees and wood for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia tiene 33 años de edad, es separada y tiene tres hijos, vive junto a su familia en el sector Nuevo Castilla, una zona urbano marginal de la ciudad de Piura, ubicada en la provincia y región del mismo nombre a mas de dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace cuatro años a la venta de dulces en un pequeño puesto ubicado en una de las principales calles de la ciudad. Ella complementa su negocio con la venta de recargas para celular y adicionalmente vende productos de belleza por catálogo. Este negocio le permite hacerse cargo del mantenimiento de sus hijos.

Cecilia se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de más productos para ampliar su negocio. Con este préstamo ella espera aumentar su stock y su nivel de ventas.

Ella es una mujer luchadora y que diariamente da lo mejor de sí, motivada por el cariño que siente hacia sus hijos. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 33 years old, she is separated, and she has three children. She lives together with her family in the Nuevo Castilla sector, an urban zone in the outskirts of the city of Piura, in the province and region of the same name). It is located more than two hours and a half from the city of Chiclayo, the capital city of Lambayeque. For the past four years she has sold candies from a small stand located on one of the main streets of the city. She also sells prepaid cell phone cards and beauty products through a catalogue. She is able to support her children with the help of this business. Cecilia requests a first time loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of more products to supplement her business. With this loan she will increase her merchandise and stimulate an increase in sales. She is a fighter and every day she gives her all, motivated for the love she has for her children. The people that know her consider her to be a very calm and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase candies for her stand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Cover house expenses

loans.name: Splash Group

texts.es:
Este unidad de desarrollo (UDE) se llama “SPLASH” ellos le pusieron a su grupo así porque uno de los integrantes del grupo tiene un auto lavado llamado Splash y para que no se les olvidara el nombre del grupo decidieron ponerle de esa manera. Este grupo está ubicado en el municipio de Zitacuaro en el Estado de Michoacán. El grupo está conformado por 12 integrantes. 

La representante del grupo se llama María de los Ángeles R. Ángeles, ella tiene 44 años de edad, está casada con el señor Rafael quien es chofer de camiones de carga, ellos tienen 3 hijos, pero nada más dos viven con ellos Guadalupe de 19 años y Lucero de 14 años quien estudia la secundaria, Doña Rosa comenta que su hija Guadalupe ya no siguió estudiando este año la preparatoria por falta de recursos comenta que no tubo dinero suficiente para la inscripción y colegiatura, porque a su nuera la tuvieron que intervenir quirúrgicamente y tuvo gastos muy fuertes en el hospital. Doña Ángeles está pidiendo su préstamo para invertir en su negocio de ropa y dice que lo que más vende son pantalones de mezclilla para dama, también  vende calcetas y ropa interior para dama y niñas. Ella comenta que le esta echando muchas ganas a su trabajo ya que quiere que su hija entre a la preparatoria y no siga perdiendo años, ella vende su ropa a sus clientas y ofrece en las casas y que también los fines de semana vende cena. Ahorita uno de sus propósitos es aclientarse y vender también en los tianguis de las localidades aledañas a la población y su sueño es poner un negocio en su casa de papelería y regalos para estar al pendiente de su casa y de sus hijas. 

Nancy Martínez García, es parte del grupo “SPLASH” tiene 22 años y termino sus estudios de Licenciada en Educación en la UPN (Universidad Pedagógica Nacional) en el Municipio de Zitacuaro del Estado de Michoacán, aunque todavía no se ha titulado ella esta juntando dinero para titularse ya que le sale muy caro, tiene una niña de un año y medio llamada Jimena, Nancy es madre soltera y es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella se dedica a vender productos de plástico como son  cubetas, botes de basura, tinas, fibras, escobas, trapeadores, ganchos etc., ella vende sus productos en los tianguis de la población de Zitacuaro, ella decidió emprender este negocio para mantener a su pequeña hija y para ahorrar para su titulación, también dice que en su casa van sus clientes a buscarla para comprarle productos. Ella está solicitando su préstamo para invertir en plásticos y quiere vender también lo que son productos de limpieza como son jabón, shampoo, suavizante de telas, cloro y otros productos más, su esperanza es poder titularse y hacer su negocio estable si es posible en su casa.

Los otros 10 integrantes se llaman Elías R. Rodríguez, Deisy M. Leyva, Adrian M. Leyva, Erika Danilu Martínez García, Oscar Solís Martínez, María de los Ángeles R. Álvarez, Rosa María Martínez García, Cristian Enrique Álvarez Muñoz, Nancy Martínez García, J. Jesús Álvarez Hurtado, Ana Gema R. Coria, María Guadalupe A. R., ellos quieren los préstamos para invertir en venta de comida, bisutería, venta de ropa y plásticos, taller de electricidad, mueblería etc.
texts.en:
This communal bank is named "Splash" after the car wash business belonging to one of the members which they decided would make a memorable name for their group as well. This group is located in the municipality of Zitacuaro in the State of Michoacán. It is made up of 12 members. 

The group's representative is María de los Ángeles R. Ángeles. She is 44 years old and married to Rafael who is a truck driver. They have three children but only two live with them, Guadalupe, 19, and Lucero, 14, who is a middle-school student. Rosa comments that her daughter Guadalupe did not continue in her high school studies this year for lack of resources. She comments that she did not have enough money for enrollment and school fees because her daughter-in-law had to have an operation and the hospital bill was very high. Ms. Ángeles is seeking her loan to invest in her clothing business. She says her best-sellers are ladies' jeans and she also sells socks and underwear for women and children. She comments that she is putting a lot into her work because she wants her daughter to go back to high school and not keep missing years. She sells her clothing to her customers at their homes and she also sells prepared suppers on the weekends. Right now one of her goals is to acquire more customers and to start selling at the open-air markets in surrounding areas. Her dream is to start a paper and gifts business in her home so that she may keep up with her home and daughters. 

Nancy Martínez García is a member of "Splash". She is 22 years old and studies Education at the UPN (National Pedagogical University) in the Municipality of Zitacuaro of the State of Michoacán. Although she has not yet graduated she is getting together the money to graduate as it is quite expensive. She has an eighteen-month-old daughter named Jimena. Nancy is a single mother and very hard-working. She sells plastic products such as buckets, trash cans, tubs, scrubbers, brooms, mops, hangers etc. She sells her products at the open-air markets of Zitacuaro. She decided to start this business in order to support her small child and to save up for obtaining her degree. She also says that her customers come looking for her at home to buy from her. She is seeking this loan to invest in plastics and hopes also to sell cleaning products such as soap, shampoo, fabric softeners, bleach and other products. Her hope is to be able to graduate and make her business stable if possible in her home. 

The other ten members are Elías R. Rodríguez, Deisy M. Leyva, Adrian M. Leyva, Erika Danilu Martínez García, Oscar Solís Martínez, María de los Ángeles R. Álvarez, Rosa María Martínez García, Cristian Enrique Álvarez Muñoz, Nancy Martínez García, J. Jesús Álvarez Hurtado, Ana Gema R. Coria, and María Guadalupe A. R.. They want the loans to invest in food sales, costume jewelry, clothing and plastics sales, an electrical workshop, furniture etc.

loans.use: To purchase clothing such as pants, socks, blouses and underwear for children.

loans.name: Dayanjalbuu

texts.en: Dayanjalbuu S. is a 55-year-old widow who lives with her daughter in a Mongolian nomadic dwelling called a ger in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband passed away, and her daughter, age 25, is doing her masters degree at the Mongolian National University. Dayanjalbuu operates a small shop in her yard next to the local school. She opened her shop, which is owned by her daughter, in 2009 and has built a stable operation. Her shop is a legal grocery store that is licensed by Expertise Agency. Her daily sales income is around 50,000 MNT. She buys her food products from big wholesale markets such as Orgil, Nomin and Harhorin. In addition, she also provides a rental facility, and two households rent her yard--these rental fees bring in 40,000 MNT per month. Moreover, Dayanjalbuu says, "I want my daughter to complete her postgraduate degree successfully and start to work in a big organization."  She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase two freezers and more food products for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase two freezers and more food products

loans.name: Fredy Antonio

texts.es:
Freddy Antonio G., vive en el municipio de Galapa lugar muy cercano a la ciudad de Barranquilla caracterizado por la fabricación de artesanías y hermosos diseños en todos los colores, texturas, y plasmados en cualquier superficie, como tela madera, aluminio, vidrio, etc. Este es el caso  de Freddy G. quien como  artesano de esta población reconocido por sus capacidades innatas, tiene un negocio de elaborar ventanas, puertas, marcos  en aluminio que inició cuando aprendió trabajando en una gran empresa en el año 1995 en la ciudad de Barranquilla y que cuando quedó cesante en el año 2000, logró  emprender su propia microempresa con un mercado doméstico muy pequeño y gradualmente se ha dado a conocer   iniciando con sus familiares, amigos y coterráneos de galapa, donde ya es mas reconocido que antes.  Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con éste su crediKiva logrará aumentar su capacidad de compra de contado y resolver algunos pedidos  de buenos clientes que pueden irse a la competencia si no es oportuno, por eso comprará en mayor volumen, láminas de aluminio, taches, tuercas y tornillos .
Su sueño es organizar su negocio en un local independiente de su casa, con inventario de productos elaborados a crédito o de contado; su principal desafío ha sido conseguir financiamientos rápidos, para fortalecer su pequeño capital de trabajo y poder aumentar sus ventas a crédito en plazos a los que sus clientes puedan responder.
texts.en:
Freddy Antonio G. lives in Galapa, a municipality very close to the city of Barranquilla, known for its crafts with beautiful designs in all colors and textures on all kinds of surfaces like wood, aluminum, glass, etc.

This is the case with Freddy G. who is well known in this community for his innate gifts as an artisan.  He has a business making windows, doors and aluminum frames that he learned when he was an employee in a large firm in Barranquilla in 1995.  When he was laid off in 2000 he managed to set up his own micro business with a small domestic market share.  Gradually he has become better known around Galapa having started with his relatives, friends and neighbors.  He is now better known than previously.

This is his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he plans to use this Kiva loan to increase his ability to pay cash and be able to fill some pending orders that if he does not do in an opportune way may be lost to the competition.  Because of this he will buy large amounts of aluminum sheets, screws, bolts and nuts.

His dream is to set up a business someplace separate from his home with inventory available for cash or credit.  His main challenge has been getting quick loans to strengthen the little working capital he has so that he can increase his credit sales in terms his customers can respond to.

loans.use: To buy large quantities of aluminum, screws, nuts and bolts.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un padre de familia de 62 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa en Puerto Malabrigo, una zona situada en el distrito de Rázuri, provincia de Ascope, región La Libertad, a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado que consiste en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar actividades de transporte). El brinda este servicio en su localidad y en las zonas aledañas. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para sacar adelante a su familia. Su esposa cuenta con una bodega instalada en su vivienda.

Manuel desea brindar mantenimiento a su unidad móvil, debido a que esta esta empezando a sufrir algunas fallas mecánicas producto del excesivo uso y del mal estado de los caminos de la zona. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 62 year-old father who lives with his wife in Puerto Malabrigo, in Rázuri district, in Ascope province, in La Libertad region, three hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

Manuel provides transport services for cargo and passengers in a 'mototaxi' (a motorized vehicle which consists of a motorbike with a cabin behind which can be used for transporting goods and passengers).  Manuel provides this service in his town and in neighboring areas.  He uses the profits from this business to get his family ahead.  His wife has a small grocery store in their home.

Manuel would like to have his vehicle serviced as it is beginning to suffer mechanical failures owing to its excessive use and the bad state of the area's roads.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help achieve his goal.

loans.use: To pay to have his vehicle serviced and repaired

location.town: Puerto Malabrigo - Rázuri - Ascope - La Libertad

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
36-year-old Mary Ann B. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has two children aged 10 and 14. Mary Ann started her farming business four years ago. She plants and harvests corn crops that she sells at the market. Mary Ann works hard to sustain her family and her children's education.

Mary Ann joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Mary Ann is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to buy seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Laîdou Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Laïdou, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 28 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Djekonobougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles font le commerce d’articles divers, de condiments alimentaires et de l’arachide.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Laïdou sont à leur premier prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso.                                                                 
SATA D.  compte s’approvisionne en articles divers de boutique (thé, chewing-gum, biscuits, cigarettes, lait en poudre, sucre, etc.) auprès des grossistes presque hebdomadairement au marché de Dioïla. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’homme
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group named Laidou are married and they are 28 years old on average. They each have 2 children and they live in large traditional families in the village of Djekonobougou, a prefecture of Dioila, located in the region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

They sell various merchandise, condiments, and peanuts. 

The women of the Laidou group have requested their first loan from Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner). 

Sata D. acquires her general store products (tea, chewing gum, cookies, cigarettes, powdered milk, sugar, etc.) from the wholesalers on a weekly basis in the market in Dioila. She sells the products from her home, completing the sale in both cash and credit. Her clientele is made up of both women and men. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 25000FCFA which will be used to repay the loan and to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase general store merchandise.

loans.name: Joyce Njeri

texts.en:
Joyce is 57 years old, married to Henry K., and they have three children. She has been in the poultry business for a period of one year with an income of  KES 11,000 per month. 

This is her first loan from KADET LTD and she intends to use it to buy poultry feed and expand her poultry farm. She hopes to expand her farming by at least 1000 chicks to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed and expand her poultry farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 35-year-old married man with three children living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of looking after his family and his goal is to complete his house, which is currently incomplete. He is a motorcycle rider and has been in the transport sector for the last two years. With the income generated from his business he has been able to build a house. His business dream is to own at least three motorcycles. Charles is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Dora Maria

texts.es: Dora María Z. L., de treinta y nueve años de edad, reside en municipio de La Libertad departamento de La Libertad, vive en compañía de compañero de vida y tres hijos menores de edad que estudian. Ella vende desde hace mas de 10 años ropa y perfumes por catalogo, además de fantasía fina y ropa casual para hombres y mujeres, todo en su misma casa de habitación, la que cuenta con una ubicación envidiable para ejercer el comercio, además sale a distribuir sus productos a lugares vecinos, siempre a través de la modalidad de agencias de distribución y no casa por casa. Dora solicita crédito para aumentar su inventario de  perfumes, shampos, gel para el cabello y productos de limpieza facial. Dora María es muy conocida en su lugar por persona responsable y trabajadora y desea hacer crecer mas este año su negocio
texts.en:
Dora María Z. L. is 39 years old and lives in the town of La Libertad in the department of La Libertad.  She lives with her common-law husband and three school-aged minor children.  For ten years she has been selling clothing and perfumes by catalogue as well as costume jewelry and casualwear for men and women.  She does this out of her home since she the ideal place there for her business.  She also sells her products in neighboring towns through distribution agencies, not door-to-door.  

Dora is requesting a loan to buy perfume, shampoo, hair gel and facial cleansing products to increase her inventory.  Dora María is well-known in her area because she is very responsible and hard-working.  Her goal for this year is to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy perfume, shampoo, hair gel and facial cleansing products

loans.name: Sath

texts.en:
Sath S., 62, earns money to support her family by selling dried fish in Phnom Penh, in the middle of Cambodia. S. buys fish in bulk at a low price from her suppliers. She slices the fish into small pieces, mixes them with delicious ingredients, and dries them in the sunshine. A day later, she collects those fish to sell.

Sath was married, but her husband died of senility years ago. She has two children who are married, working, and living with her at home. Sath S. will use her loan to buy a cow to butcher and take its meat for resale. This will provide her with additional profit, which she will use to better meet her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy a cow to butcher and sell the meat

loans.name: Celine

texts.fr:
A 35ans d’âge, Céline est mariée, mère de 2enfantsdont l’âge varie entre  3 ans et 7ans, avec son niveau bac, elle se lance dans la vente des poissons d’eau douce depuis 8ans et cela l’intéresse.

Elle s’approvisionne en poissons au port des piroguiers et attends les camions en provenance  du nord, elle achète en gros  et revends en détails au marché. Ses ventes journalières sont de 150.000F
Avec le prêt qu’elle aura, elle va augmenter son stock de poisson en achetant :
1bac d’anguilles, 1 bac de silures, bac de carpes.
Comme toute vendeuse ambitieuse,  elle compte continuer avec HOPE -CONGO, faire plus de revenus,  épargner plus  afin de contribuer à l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Céline is 35 years old, married and mother to two children who are three and seven years old. Having reached baccalaureate level at school, she set herself up selling fresh water fish eight years ago, an activity which interests her.

She gets her supplies of fish at the canoe port, waiting for the lorries to come from the north. She buys wholesale and resells on a retail basis at the market. Her daily turnover is 150,000 francs. 

With the loan she receives she will increase her supply of fish by buying: one tub of eels, one tub of brown bullheads and one tub of carp. Like all ambitious salespeople she is hoping to continue working with Hope Congo, make more money and save more in order to contribute to her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase tubs of brown bullhead fish, eels and carps

loans.name: Diam Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Diam est créé le 27 août 2009 et fait partie du Banc Villageois Mamadou Lamine Guéye. Il est composé de 14 femmes qui habitent le même quartier.Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Ndéye Coumba F. est la responsable du groupe. Elle est à l'extrême droite de la photo et tendant la main.Elle est âgée de 30 ans, mariée avec deux enfants et a son neveu en charge.

Elle mène une activité de petit commerce de produits cosmétiques et fait de la couture aussi. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ces domaines.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'augmenter ses produits pour réaliser des bénéfices.

Elle va soutenir son mari pour la prise en charge des dépenses des membres de sa famille et renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group, Diam, was created on 27th August 2009 and is part of the Banc Villageois in Mamadou Lamine Guéye. It is made up of 14 women who live in the same neighborhood. Their principal activity is trading on a small scale.

Mrs. Ndéye Coumba F. is in charge of the group. She is on the far right of the photo and holding out her hand. She is 30 years old and married with two children and her nephew in her care.

She has a small trading activity selling cosmetics and also does sewing. She has experience in both these fields. Her new loan will allow her to increase her products in order to make a profit. She will help her husband in covering the family expenses and strengthen her savings.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics with a view to selling them

loans.name: Sokden

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokden Y.  and her husband, Mr. David Phun, live along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have two sons. All of them are in school. 

Sokden sells batteries. They buy batteries from a nearby village and sell them in a market located in Phnom Penh. Sokden is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase neighboring land to expand her property.

loans.use: To purchase neighboring land to expand her property.

loans.name: Battur

texts.en:
Mr.Battur is 40 years old and lives with his wife and 3 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. In 2000, Battur’s family moved from the countryside to the capital city in search of a better life.  Battur’s eldest daughter studies at  university. His eldest son helps in his father’s business and the youngest son studies in secondary school. Battur’s wife works in Saikhan Kharaa Co.Ltd. as a cement dealer. 

Battur runs a building materials delivery business using his truck. His family’s living condition is improving and they are happy that they moved to the capital city. Three years ago, they bought a plot of  land.  Currently they live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Last year Battur started his building project for a family house. The house is half complete and he is planning to finish it now. The loan Battur is taking will be used to buy a necessary building materials such as cement, sand, plaster, paints, wall papers to complete the building project of the family house.

loans.use: to buy necessary building materials, such as cement, sand, plaster, paints, and wall paper to complete the family house building project

loans.name: Juntos Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal Juntos al Progreso trabaja con Edaprospo desde hace 9 meses, integrado por 9 socios de los cuales se dedican al negocio de venta de refrescos, venta de comidas rápidas, bodegas, entre otros.
L. es una joven emprendedora dedicada a la venta de productos de primera necesidad (BODEGA ALEXANDRA), a sus 27 años tiene un hijo de 4 años, inicia sus labores en ese negocio, debido a que es despedida en su anterior trabajo.
Con el préstamo recibido anteriormente ha podido implementar su bodega y además pasar mas tiempo con su hijo, la meta de L. es construir su vivienda para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, con el préstamo recibido se realizara la compra de mercadería.
texts.en:
The 'Juntos al Progreso' (Together towards Progress) community bank has been working with Edaprospo for nine months.  It has nine members who work in different businesses including selling soft drinks, selling fast food and running a grocery store. 

L. is an entrepreneurial young woman who sells basic household products (Bodega Alexandra - Alexandra's Grocery Store).  She is 27 years old and has a 4 year-old son.  She started working in this business as she was let go from her previous job.

With her previous loan, L. was able to stock her store and also spend more time with her son.  Her goal is to build a house so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life.  She will use this loan to buy merchandise.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Maria Violeta

texts.es:
Violeta tiene  36  años de edad, vive  junto a su esposo e hijos. Ella cuenta con casa propia, la cual está  ubicada en la zona del caserío Granja Sasape en el distrito de Pacora cuenta solo con servicios de agua, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 200  familias.

La actividad que desarrolla Violeta es venta de comida y hamburguesas por las noches en el puente de granja Sasape, viene trabajando en ese lugar desde hace 02 años, es conocida por la zona y no presenta competencia cercana.

Violeta está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 100 para mantenimiento a su carrito sanguchero y compra de servicios e insumos, dado que su clientela ha ido en aumento y el lugar donde vende es bien transitado ya que se encuentra cerca a un paradero de motos.

Violeta es una madre de familia muy responsable  que desea que su familia alcance una mejor calidad d vida, por ello lucha diariamente, para poder contribuir a los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Violeta is 36 years old and lives with her husband and children. She has her own home, which is located in the neighborhood of the Sasape Farm in the district of Pacora. The only utility service there is water. The community is small, with approximately 200 families. 

Violeta's work is selling hamburgers and other food in the evenings at the bridge of the Sasape Farm. She has worked in this place for two years. She is well-known in the area and there is no nearby competition. 

Violeta is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 100 soles to perform maintenance on her food cart and buy services and supplies, since her customer base has been expanding. The place where she sells her food is well-traveled since it is located near a place where motorcycles stop. 

Violeta is a very responsible mother who wants her family to achieve a better quality of life. She works hard each day toward this aim, so she can contribute in covering her household's expenses.

loans.use: to maintain her food cart and buy supplies.

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
30 year-old Dy is a cattle seller. His wife is a farmer. Both can earn $190 per month. They have 2 children, one of whom is studying and one is too small to go to school. Every month, he has to spend $75 on food and $6 on other expenses for the family. He would like a loan of $1000 to buy cattle to sell. Previously, he was also a farmer with his wife, but the income is not good and can’t support the family.  He has to pay for his children's schooling. 

He saw others have success selling cattle and so he decided to do the same. Now he can earn a better income.  He plans to buy more cattle to sell in the city when he has enough money.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to sell

loans.name: Maren

texts.en:
Maren is 25 years old and single. He resides in Narok, Kenya. Maren is a maize farmer. He has been doing this for the past two years. He knew KADET through a registered client with KADET. 

Maren has been a good client and this is his second loan. He plans to use the loan to prepare land for farming and to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer.

He hopes to make profit and use it to re-invest in other business. He is an assiduous man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Julio Olmedo

texts.es:
En Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas en el cantón Santo domingo se encuentra la tienda de abarrotes del señor Julio, un hombre de 33 años que vive sólo en la parroquia Puerto Limón. Don Julio como lo llaman en el barrio se acercó a Fundación Alternativa para solicitar un crédito ya que él desea comprar más insumos para su tienda y así ampliar la variedad de productos que ofrece a la comunidad.
Julio tiene una vida humilde pero nos cuenta que disfruta mucho de su tranquilidad, su tienda pasa abierta hasta horas de la noche por lo que su jornada de trabajo diario es de al menos 15 horas. Hace algunos años sufrió un accidente mientras trabajaba como jornalero en una plantación, un palo golpeó su ojo derecho causándole una lesión irreversible y pérdida total de la visión; esto no ha sido un obstáculo para que Julio siga su pasión por los deportes ya que actualmente juega vóley con un grupo de amigos y además es arquero de un equipo de futbol barrial.
Don Julio, sueña con tener su casa propia con local comercial, quizás en un futuro tenga su propia familia.
texts.en:
Julio has a grocery store in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas in the Santo Domingo canton.  He is 33 years old, and he lives alone in the Puerto Limón parish.  Don Julio, as he is called in the neighborhood, came to the Fundación Alternativa to request a loan.  He wishes to buy more supplies for his store.  That way he will expand the variety of products he offers his community.

Julio has a humble life, but he tells us that he enjoys his peace and quiet.  His store stays open for night hours.  His daily work day is at least 15 hours.  Some years ago he suffered and accident while working as a field worker on a plantation.  A stick hit his right eye causing an irreversible lesion and total loss of vision.  

This has not been an obstacle because Juio continues his passion for sports.  He currently plays volleyball with a group of friends.  Also, he is the goalkeeper for a neighborhood soccer team.

Julio dreams of having his own house with a commercial space.  Maybe he will have his own family in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his grocery store.

loans.name: Yunus

texts.en:
Yunus is a married man with six children, all of whom attend school. He lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past three years, he has operated a retail shop, selling at the market to his neighbors and passersby. In addition he also operates a motorcycle business, which contributes another source of income. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is a Rwandan rice farmer who is married and has six children. He has been a farmer for the past 10 years; he learned rice farming from a formal training program. 

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

loans.use: To support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru: Anvar jenat i imeyet 2 detey. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Anvar 49 let. Uje 11 et kak on zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Seychas on nujdayetysa v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota.
texts.en: Anvar is married and has two children.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with his family.  Anvar is 49 years old.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for 11 years and breeds cattle.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy cows to increase quantity of livestock.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Deysiz Cristina

texts.es:
Deysiz Cristina es productora de café en pequeña escala, tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijas y dos hijos, y junto a ellos reside en la comunidad de Las Minas Lepaguare.

Deysiz inició su actividad comercial vendiendo de forma ambulante por su comunidad y las aledañas ropa de segunda mano. Su esposo se dedicaba al cultivo de café pero por problemas economicos decidió perseguir el sueño americano y emigró a los Estados Unidos, luego de enviar remesas por varios meses, Deysiz pudo comprar una pequeña finca de café y aunque al inicio no sabia mucho del manejo, contrató a un encargado y gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien. En temporada de cosecha Deysiz se levanta a las 3:00 am para hacerle desayuno a los trabajadores que recolectan la cosecha y durante el dia ayuda con algunas actividades y tambien supervisa.

El prestamo que Deysiz esta solicitado lo necesita para comprar diez quintales de melaza, abono y tambien debe pagar la mano de obra por la limpieza de la tierra de la finca. Con el apoyo de este prestamo su produccion sera de mayor calidad y podra negociar con los compradores un mejor precio de venta.

Su sueño es hacer crecer su finca y que sea una de las mejores de la region para darle una mejor condicion de vida a sus hijos y seguirles apoyando con sus estudios academicos. Deysiz tiene tres ciclos en FAMA y ha cancelado las cuotas de sus prestamos de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Deysiz Cristina is a small scale producer of coffee. She is married and has 3 daughters and 2 sons. She lives with them in Las Minas Lepaguare.

Deysiz started her business life as a street vendor selling used clothing around her neighbourhood and the surrounding area. Her husband used to grow coffee but because of economic difficulties he decided to pursue the American dream and immigrated to the United States. After sending her remittances for several months, Deysiz was able to buy a small coffee farm and although initially not knowing much about running the business, she hired a manager and 'gracias a Dios' ('thanks be to God') is doing very well. At harvest time Deysiz gets up at 3:00 am to make breakfast for the workers who harvest the crop and during the day she helps with a few of the tasks and also supervises.

The loan Deysiz is asking for is needed to buy 10 quintals (1000 lbs) of molasses, manure and also to pay for the labour used for cleaning the farmland. With the support of the loan her production will be of a better quality and she will be able to negotiate a better price with the buyers.

Her dream is to expand her farm and make it one of the best in the region so as to give her children a better quality of life and continue supporting them with their academic studies. Deysiz has 3 loan cycles with FAMA and made the repayments on her loans on time.

loans.use: to buy molasses and manure as well as pay for labour etc.

loans.name: Vanesa

texts.es: La srta. Vanesa cuenta con un internet provisto de  4 maquinas las cuales son su unica fuente generadora de ingreso que le ayudan a subsistir,la Srta. es madre soltera y la unica manera de mejorar su calidad de vida  es implementado mas computadoras en su internet ya que  por estar en un lugar estrategico cuenta con una elevada demanda por lo tanto, ella se ve en la ncesidad de solicitar un credito, pues sabe que podra pagar sus cuotas sin dificultad. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y dinamica.Aprovehca la concurrecia de clientes en su negocio y vende tambien golocinas y refrescos que tambien aumenta sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Srta. Vanesa has an Internet business equipped with four machines. This is her only source of income that enables her to survive. Vanesa is a single mother and the only way for her to improve her quality of life is to acquire more computers for her Internet café. Her business is located in a strategic area that has high demand. Vanesa sees the need to request a loan and knows that she can complete her payments without any difficulty.

She is an enterprising and dynamic woman. Vanesa will take advantage of the influx of customers to her business by also selling candy and soft drinks as a way of increasing her income.

loans.use: to purchase computer equipment for her Internet business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO DE CALCA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cristina; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de gaseosas, ella reparte a diferentes tiendas de abarrotes, la socia también trabaja como docente del nivel secundario, por medio de este negocio y de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de gaseosas. La socia solicita el préstamo para gaseosas al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Cristina belongs to the “Valle Sagrado de Calca” (Sacred Valley of Calca) communal bank, located in the Calca district of Calca province, in Cusco department. Cristina is 50 years old, married, and has 3 children. She operates her own business buying and selling soft drinks, which she distributes to various grocery stores. Cristina also works as a tutor at the secondary level.

With this business and her social work, she is able to advance her children. Cristina wants to expand her soft drink business and, consequently, she is requesting a loan to purchase soft drinks at wholesale.

Cristina is happy at the prospect of the loan and she promises to comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks at wholesale to sell.

loans.name: Feninia

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Feninia is engaged in making candies and sells them on the school campus  and to their community. She is 43 years old and has two school-aged children. They need to increase their income to support the education of their children. She aims to improve her business and make it a viable source of income.

She aims to make and produce more of her products to sell to other communities. But due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of P8,000 to buy flour, sugar, eggs, plastics and sticks needed in making candies. She mentioned that this loan will help a lot to work out her plan. She hopes that her patience and hard work will make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, eggs, plastics and sticks needed in making candies.
